Original: Sazh:Mog! I'm putting us down on that floating continent!
Dialogue: Mog! I'm putting us down on that floating continent!

Original: Mog:Roger, kupo! Everyone get ready for a rough landing, kupo!
Dialogue: Roger, kupo! Everyone get ready for a rough landing, kupo!

Original: ???:Now then... Might the sleeping beauty be awake already?
Dialogue: Now then... Might the sleeping beauty be awake already?

Original: Cecil:Unh... Who're you...?
Dialogue: Unh... Who're you...?

Original: Lightning:A line like that...has to be Edgar.
Dialogue: A line like that...has to be Edgar.

Original: Edgar:The moogle and his merry band. At last we meet.
Dialogue: The moogle and his merry band. At last we meet.

Original: Warrior of Light:Then you are the leader of Layle and Firion's Returners...
Dialogue: Then you are the leader of Layle and Firion's Returners...

Original: Layle:Were you tending to us? Nice way to steal the show.
Dialogue: Were you tending to us? Nice way to steal the show.

Original: Edgar:It's all of your information that brought me here. Thanks for your hard work.
Dialogue: It's all of your information that brought me here. Thanks for your hard work.

Original: Cecil:What about the airship? Is it a wreck?
Dialogue: What about the airship? Is it a wreck?

Original: Edgar:Not to worry. Despite appearances, I have a knack for the mechanical.
Dialogue: Not to worry. Despite appearances, I have a knack for the mechanical.

Original: Mog:You were fixing the goddess's airship, kupo?
Dialogue: You were fixing the goddess's airship, kupo?

Original: Edgar:The Goddess Materia, eh? So I have her imagination to thank for that being a serviceable product.
Dialogue: The Goddess Materia, eh? So I have her imagination to thank for that being a serviceable product.

Original: Edgar:At any rate, it'll be a bit longer until it's up and running.
Dialogue: At any rate, it'll be a bit longer until it's up and running.

Original: Edgar:How about closing up the local Torsion in the meantime?
Dialogue: How about closing up the local Torsion in the meantime?

Original: Lightning:While I don't like being told what to do, I don't have a reason to decline.
Dialogue: While I don't like being told what to do, I don't have a reason to decline.

Original: Cecil:Indeed... It seems there are monsters around.
Dialogue: Indeed... It seems there are monsters around.

Original: Warrior of Light:Edgar, once we have secured the area, I'd like to hear what you have to say.
Dialogue: Edgar, once we have secured the area, I'd like to hear what you have to say.

Original: Edgar:Naturally. Warriors of and with the light, I trust you will return safely.
Dialogue: Naturally. Warriors of and with the light, I trust you will return safely.

Original: Terra:Say, Shadow and you guys have been fighting at Edgar's direction, right?
Dialogue: Say, Shadow and you guys have been fighting at Edgar's direction, right?

Original: Shadow:The world matters not. I go where I'm paid to.
Dialogue: The world matters not. I go where I'm paid to.

Original: Firion:I don't know about "direction." I was told to protect what needed protecting how I saw fit.
Dialogue: I don't know about "direction." I was told to protect what needed protecting how I saw fit.

Original: Squall:...More or less the same here. I'd receive a commission, but the particulars were left up to me.
Dialogue: ...More or less the same here. I'd receive a commission, but the particulars were left up to me.

Original: Mog:How many are in the organization, kupo?
Dialogue: How many are in the organization, kupo?

Original: Firion:No idea. Edgar never spoke of it.
Dialogue: No idea. Edgar never spoke of it.

Original: Firion:But he seems to have been in contact with others beside us.
Dialogue: But he seems to have been in contact with others beside us.

Original: Balthier:A cautious fellow. Must be a thing among royalty.
Dialogue: A cautious fellow. Must be a thing among royalty.

Original: Balthier:Gods and moogles, otherworldly villains, and a maverick king... Who's up to the most no good?
Dialogue: Gods and moogles, otherworldly villains, and a maverick king... Who's up to the most no good?

Original: Terra:Edgar...is a friend.
Dialogue: Edgar...is a friend.

Original: Terra:He's following the will of the light... Isn't that right, Mog?
Dialogue: He's following the will of the light... Isn't that right, Mog?

Original: Mog:You bet it is, kupo! If he's a friend of yours, he's a friend of ours, kupo!
Dialogue: You bet it is, kupo! If he's a friend of yours, he's a friend of ours, kupo!

Original: Balthier:A convenient way to wrap up the conversation if I've ever heard one.
Dialogue: A convenient way to wrap up the conversation if I've ever heard one.

Original: Mog:I wish you'd trust me a little more, kupo...
Dialogue: I wish you'd trust me a little more, kupo...

Original: Onion Knight:...They looked creepy, but they weren't regular monsters, huh?
Dialogue: ...They looked creepy, but they weren't regular monsters, huh?

Original: Lightning:..."Creepy" as they are, they were once human.
Dialogue: ..."Creepy" as they are, they were once human.

Original: Shantotto:Oh? You don't say. Was it by their own misdeeds they ended up that way?
Dialogue: Oh? You don't say. Was it by their own misdeeds they ended up that way?

Original: Lightning:The opposite.
Dialogue: The opposite.

Original: Hope:In our world, there are...godlike beingsthat arbitrarily assign humans aFocus.
Dialogue: In our world, there are...godlike beings that arbitrarily assign humans a Focus.

Original: Hope:If you can't complete your Focus...even through no fault of your own...you become a Cie'th...
Dialogue: If you can't complete your Focus...even through no fault of your own...you become a Cie'th...

Original: Onion Knight:Those gods sound awfully self-serving...not that our position is all that different right now.
Dialogue: Those gods sound awfully self-serving...not that our position is all that different right now.

Original: Lightning:Yeah. And because of that airship scuffle, my confrontation with this latest goddess has to wait.
Dialogue: Yeah. And because of that airship scuffle, my confrontation with this latest goddess has to wait.

Original: Shantotto:Since we've encountered that know-it-all king, you may get your wish sooner than later.
Dialogue: Since we've encountered that know-it-all king, you may get your wish sooner than later.

Original: Shantotto:With the added pawnser, knowledge at our disposal, I simply can't think of anything greater.
Dialogue: With the added pawns—er, knowledge at our disposal, I simply can't think of anything greater.

Original: Zell:Here you guys are! We're moving out!
Dialogue: Here you guys are! We're moving out!

Original: Papalymo:May I inquire as to your topic of discussion?
Dialogue: May I inquire as to your topic of discussion?

Original: Onion Knight:We were talking about monsters. Just idle chatter.
Dialogue: We were talking about monsters. Just idle chatter.

Original: Shantotto:Yes, the creatures of far-flung realms was our subject matter.
Dialogue: Yes, the creatures of far-flung realms was our subject matter.

Original: Zell:Huh, that sounds pretty fun! The two of you sure've got a lot of smarts packed into those tiny bodies.
Dialogue: Huh, that sounds pretty fun! The two of you sure've got a lot of smarts packed into those tiny bodies.

Original: Shantotto:A smart aleck, eh? That's quite enough. Unless for some reason you want to play rough.
Dialogue: A smart aleck, eh? That's quite enough. Unless for some reason you want to play rough.

Original: Zell:N-no smart alecks here! J-just a happy, peaceful party ready to shake a leg!
Dialogue: N-no smart alecks here! J-just a happy, peaceful party ready to shake a leg!

Original: Penelo:Was that...gunfire just now?
Dialogue: Was that...gunfire just now?

Original: Zidane:I wouldn't sweat it. Probably just Laguna goofing off.
Dialogue: I wouldn't sweat it. Probably just Laguna goofing off.

Original: Laguna:Now hold on a minute there! Even I know better than to do something dangerous like that!
Dialogue: Now hold on a minute there! Even I know better than to do something dangerous like that!

Original: Cyan:Wast it thou, Sir Vincent?
Dialogue: Wast it thou, Sir Vincent?

Original: Vincent:...I'm not in the habit of drawing my weapon without an enemy around.
Dialogue: ...I'm not in the habit of drawing my weapon without an enemy around.

Original: Zidane:Hey, you think someone...might be shooting at us?
Dialogue: Hey, you think someone...might be shooting at us?

Original: Penelo:H-how are you so calm about it? Let's get out of here!
Dialogue: H-how are you so calm about it? Let's get out of here!

Original: Mog:But to where, kupo? We're in the middle of a field!
Dialogue: But to where, kupo? We're in the middle of a field!

Original: Laguna:Rule fifty-five! Every soldier knows, if you're targeted out in the open, face the enemy and charge!
Dialogue: Rule fifty-five! Every soldier knows, if you're targeted out in the open, face the enemy and charge!

Original: Penelo:What!? You're joking, right!?
Dialogue: What!? You're joking, right!?

Original: Cyan:Nay, with no place to flee, it is a plan befitting our situation.
Dialogue: Nay, with no place to flee, it is a plan befitting our situation.

Original: Vincent:Face the enemy, eh?
Dialogue: Face the enemy, eh?

Original: Laguna:Somebody's gonna regret pointing a gun at yours truly!
Dialogue: Somebody's gonna regret pointing a gun at yours truly!

Original: Penelo:Ah! Guys!
Dialogue: Ah! Guys!

Original: Mog:Wait for us, kupo!
Dialogue: Wait for us, kupo!

Original: ???:...Hold on, now. Where have I seen that one before...?
Dialogue: ...Hold on, now. Where have I seen that one before...?

Original: Zell:Stop! Cease! Hold your fire!
Dialogue: Stop! Cease! Hold your fire!

Original: ???:If it ain't Zell. What a surprise. I thought you looked familiar.
Dialogue: If it ain't Zell. What a surprise. I thought you looked familiar.

Original: Zell:We should be the surprised ones...
Dialogue: We should be the surprised ones...

Original: Squall:Couldn't you tell it was us?
Dialogue: Couldn't you tell it was us?

Original: Irvine:Ahh, sorry about that. I thought you were more of those rowdy, shiny fellas.
Dialogue: Ahh, sorry about that. I thought you were more of those rowdy, shiny fellas.

Original: Zell:Hah? You aren't calling me rowdy, are you?
Dialogue: Hah? You aren't calling me rowdy, are you?

Original: Irvine:Not you. These shiny, kinda rocky guys were attacking me, so I got a little anxious is all.
Dialogue: Not you. These shiny, kinda rocky guys were attacking me, so I got a little anxious is all.

Original: Steiner:Shiny, you say? Manikins, I wonder.
Dialogue: Shiny, you say? Manikins, I wonder.

Original: Squall:(He can't distinguish between his allies and a bunch of fakes...? Ugh.)
Dialogue: (He can't distinguish between his allies and a bunch of fakes...? Ugh.)

Original: Irvine:So, who's your company? 'Preciate if you could fill me in on the lay of the land, too.
Dialogue: So, who's your company? 'Preciate if you could fill me in on the lay of the land, too.

Original: Zell:Sounds like a job for Know-It-All-Zell. Alright, Irvine, listen good...
Dialogue: Sounds like a job for Know-It-All-Zell. Alright, Irvine, listen good...

Original: Irvine:Huh, you don't say. Stumbling into a different world sure is something.
Dialogue: Huh, you don't say. Stumbling into a different world sure is something.

Original: Firion:He's awfully cavalier about all this. I hope he doesn't slow us down...
Dialogue: He's awfully cavalier about all this. I hope he doesn't slow us down...

Original: Mog:But he's full of the light, kupo! You'll come with us, won't you, kupo?
Dialogue: But he's full of the light, kupo! You'll come with us, won't you, kupo?

Original: Irvine:Sure. These Torsions sound like a walk in the park.
Dialogue: Sure. These Torsions sound like a walk in the park.

Original: Irvine:Leave the sharpshooting to me. I'm counting on you for backup.
Dialogue: Leave the sharpshooting to me. I'm counting on you for backup.

Original: Squall:(...Same as ever.)
Dialogue: (...Same as ever.)

Original: Zell:You're the same as ever!
Dialogue: You're the same as ever!

Original: Firion:If you're Squall and Zell's comrade, you're welcome just the same, but...backup?
Dialogue: If you're Squall and Zell's comrade, you're welcome just the same, but...backup?

Original: Zell:Try to overlook his arrogance. That's just the way he is.
Dialogue: Try to overlook his arrogance. That's just the way he is.

Original: Irvine:Don't let it bother you and we'll get along just fine.
Dialogue: Don't let it bother you and we'll get along just fine.

Original: Irvine:Now, if your fancy pantses'll excuse me.
Dialogue: Now, if your fancy pantses'll excuse me.

Original: Zell:Irvine! I'm begging ya! Try to catch a drift!
Dialogue: Irvine! I'm begging ya! Try to catch a drift!

Original: Steiner:...Hrm. It would seem the light chooses all kinds...
Dialogue: ...Hrm. It would seem the light chooses all kinds...

Original: Irvine:That's an older model of a Galbadian military-issue machine gun, isn't it? Slick.
Dialogue: That's an older model of a Galbadian military-issue machine gun, isn't it? Slick.

Original: Laguna:Heh, don't you know it? I ain't sharing, though!
Dialogue: Heh, don't you know it? I ain't sharing, though!

Original: Irvine:And you pack duel pistols? That takes skill.
Dialogue: And you pack duel pistols? That takes skill.

Original: King:...Two guns let me fire twice as many rounds. Simple math.
Dialogue: ...Two guns let me fire twice as many rounds. Simple math.

Original: Irvine:No kidding. Can't argue with you there.
Dialogue: No kidding. Can't argue with you there.

Original: Irvine:Your firearm is mighty cool, too. Let me give it a try sometime, won't you?
Dialogue: Your firearm is mighty cool, too. Let me give it a try sometime, won't you?

Original: Vincent:...A nave aspiration... ...as you run from isolation, is it?
Dialogue: ...A naïve aspiration... ...as you run from isolation, is it?

Original: Yang:Oh? What sort of gathering have we here?
Dialogue: Oh? What sort of gathering have we here?

Original: Irvine:Just a little get together for gun nuts.
Dialogue: Just a little get together for gun nuts.

Original: Zell:Happy as a lark... You sure now's the time for that?
Dialogue: Happy as a lark... You sure now's the time for that?

Original: Irvine:We've got some big battles coming up, don't we? What's the harm in letting our hair down for a bit?
Dialogue: We've got some big battles coming up, don't we? What's the harm in letting our hair down for a bit?

Original: Irvine:Relax, I'll be ready when the time comes. You know what I can do.
Dialogue: Relax, I'll be ready when the time comes. You know what I can do.

Original: Zell:Yeah, I know exactly. You choke under pressure.
Dialogue: Yeah, I know exactly. You choke under pressure.

Original: Irvine:Aw, you don't have to bring that up.
Dialogue: Aw, you don't have to bring that up.

Original: Yang:Choke under pressure?
Dialogue: Choke under pressure?

Original: Zell:He's got the chops, but when it's go time, he gets the jitters.
Dialogue: He's got the chops, but when it's go time, he gets the jitters.

Original: Laguna:I know how you feel, man! I've got stage fright like you wouldn't believe!
Dialogue: I know how you feel, man! I've got stage fright like you wouldn't believe!

Original: Zell:Why do you sound proud of it...?
Dialogue: Why do you sound proud of it...?

Original: Yang:That is a problem. All the moreso for a true warrior with the actual ability...
Dialogue: That is a problem. All the moreso for a true warrior with the actual ability...

Original: Yang:Steel nerves require a steel body in which to rest! Come, we start our training immediately!
Dialogue: Steel nerves require a steel body in which to rest! Come, we start our training immediately!

Original: Zell:Oh, sweet! Count me in!
Dialogue: Oh, sweet! Count me in!

Original: Laguna:Uh-oh, I don't like where this is headed, Irvine.
Dialogue: Uh-oh, I don't like where this is headed, Irvine.

Original: Irvine:I guess every world has its hot-blooded fellas.
Dialogue: I guess every world has its hot-blooded fellas.

Original: King:......They sure talk a lot.
Dialogue: ......They sure talk a lot.

Original: Vincent:Heh...... It's not a bad thing.
Dialogue: Heh...... It's not a bad thing.

Original: Mog:Those buildings over there are our destination, kupo!
Dialogue: Those buildings over there are our destination, kupo!

Original: Cloud:Elements from our own worlds are incorporated into this one...or that's the story, at least.
Dialogue: Elements from our own worlds are incorporated into this one...or that's the story, at least.

Original: Firion:Wow, so you're from a city like that?
Dialogue: Wow, so you're from a city like that?

Original: Firion:Back home, I had always planned to see the world...but I never imagined anything like this.
Dialogue: Back home, I had always planned to see the world...but I never imagined anything like this.

Original: Lightning:For me, it's like most of you climbed straight out of some fairy tale.
Dialogue: For me, it's like most of you climbed straight out of some fairy tale.

Original: Y'shtola:Hm, fantasies take all shapes, wouldn't you say?
Dialogue: Hm, fantasies take all shapes, wouldn't you say?

Original: Warrior of Light:With the capability to construct cities like that...can there still be conflict among men?
Dialogue: With the capability to construct cities like that...can there still be conflict among men?

Original: Lightning:There are those who would conquer and exploit others wherever you go.
Dialogue: There are those who would conquer and exploit others wherever you go.

Original: Firion:Conquer, huh...?
Dialogue: Conquer, huh...?

Original: Y'shtola:...Did that touch a nerve?
Dialogue: ...Did that touch a nerve?

Original: Firion:Everyone seems to have some enemy like Garland or Sephiroth who's followed them here...
Dialogue: Everyone seems to have some enemy like Garland or Sephiroth who's followed them here...

Original: Firion:I was just thinking mine'll inevitably show up, too.
Dialogue: I was just thinking mine'll inevitably show up, too.

Original: Warrior of Light:What sort of opponent is this?
Dialogue: What sort of opponent is this?

Original: Firion:A man possessed by avarice who'll stop at nothing to conquer everything he can.
Dialogue: A man possessed by avarice who'll stop at nothing to conquer everything he can.

Original: Cloud:Sounds like a winner.
Dialogue: Sounds like a winner.

Original: Firion:Yeah. If he does turn up here, we can't take him lightly.
Dialogue: Yeah. If he does turn up here, we can't take him lightly.

Original: Mog:Talk like that and you'll jinx us, kupo! Let's keep a cautious move on, kupo.
Dialogue: Talk like that and you'll jinx us, kupo! Let's keep a cautious move on, kupo.

Original: Mog:Kupo! This is gonna be a tough one, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! This is gonna be a tough one, kupo!

Original: Mog:It's blocking the way to those buildings where the Torsion is, kupo!
Dialogue: It's blocking the way to those buildings where the Torsion is, kupo!

Original: Zidane:I guess you'd call that a gate keeper... Watch out, you guys!
Dialogue: I guess you'd call that a gate keeper... Watch out, you guys!

Original: Firion:There's a Torsion here...
Dialogue: There's a Torsion here...

Original: ???:Hmph. Can a group of worms ever amount to anything?
Dialogue: Hmph. Can a group of worms ever amount to anything?

Original: The Emperor:Even here you bare your fangs at me, Firion.
Dialogue: Even here you bare your fangs at me, Firion.

Original: The Emperor:But...what say the rest of you?
Dialogue: But...what say the rest of you?

Original: Tidus:What do you want?
Dialogue: What do you want?

Original: The Emperor:Pledge your allegiance and I will allow you to serve as my underlings.
Dialogue: Pledge your allegiance and I will allow you to serve as my underlings.

Original: The Emperor:There are more than enough of you on your side. Why not apply your skills in my employ?
Dialogue: There are more than enough of you on your side. Why not apply your skills in my employ?

Original: Warrior of Light:What would you hope to accomplish with us as your pawns?
Dialogue: What would you hope to accomplish with us as your pawns?

Original: The Emperor:We stand at the intersection connecting all worlds to each other...
Dialogue: We stand at the intersection connecting all worlds to each other...

Original: The Emperor:I shall make this realm the fortress that opens the roads for my rule.
Dialogue: I shall make this realm the fortress that opens the roads for my rule.

Original: Penelo:Opens the roads? You don't mean the roads home...!?
Dialogue: Opens the roads? You don't mean the roads home...!?

Original: Tidus:Somehow a deal with a high-and-mighty bozo doesn't sound like a very good deal.
Dialogue: Somehow a deal with a high-and-mighty bozo doesn't sound like a very good deal.

Original: Firion:It's not! Pay him no heed! This despot used fiends to bring the world under his control!
Dialogue: It's not! Pay him no heed! This despot used fiends to bring the world under his control!

Original: Terra:If we don't do something, our worlds will share the same fate!
Dialogue: If we don't do something, our worlds will share the same fate!

Original: The Emperor:Once every world belongs to me...imagine the benefits you stand to reap.
Dialogue: Once every world belongs to me...imagine the benefits you stand to reap.

Original: Terra:That does not sway me! Nor will I accept your rule!
Dialogue: That does not sway me! Nor will I accept your rule!

Original: The Emperor:Foolish... But all together, you are not a monolith.
Dialogue: Foolish... But all together, you are not a monolith.

Original: Warrior of Light:You mean to imply there are those among us who would heed your words?
Dialogue: You mean to imply there are those among us who would heed your words?

Original: The Emperor:Heh heh... I will be waiting at the Torsion.
Dialogue: Heh heh... I will be waiting at the Torsion.

Original: The Emperor:Do come see me, as you doubt your comrades' integrity along the way.
Dialogue: Do come see me, as you doubt your comrades' integrity along the way.

Original: Mog:Gone, kupo! ...It seems he went to the Torsion, kupo.
Dialogue: Gone, kupo! ...It seems he went to the Torsion, kupo.

Original: Firion:The coward fled!
Dialogue: The coward fled!

Original: Tidus:Relax. None of us are traitors.
Dialogue: Relax. None of us are traitors.

Original: Mog:Probably... There are so many of us now, so we can't be sure, kupo...
Dialogue: Probably... There are so many of us now, so we can't be sure, kupo...

Original: Terra:Mog, why would you say that? You're the one who brought us together...
Dialogue: Mog, why would you say that? You're the one who brought us together...

Original: Firion:I trust everyone. Even if someone was thinking of switching sides, we can convince him otherwise!
Dialogue: I trust everyone. Even if someone was thinking of switching sides, we can convince him otherwise!

Original: Warrior of Light:...Encouraging words. Let us take them to heart as we continue on.
Dialogue: ...Encouraging words. Let us take them to heart as we continue on.

Original: Papalymo:Lightning, why the long face? Is something on your mind?
Dialogue: Lightning, why the long face? Is something on your mind?

Original: Lightning:...Nothing you need to worry about.
Dialogue: ...Nothing you need to worry about.

Original: Shantotto:Like it or not, our fates are intertwined. You could feign some civility when he's trying to be kind.
Dialogue: Like it or not, our fates are intertwined. You could feign some civility when he's trying to be kind.

Original: Mog:Kupo!? Someone just screamed, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo!? Someone just screamed, kupo!

Original: Lightning:That voice! It can't be...!
Dialogue: That voice! It can't be...!

Original: Mog:Kupo! That girl's in trouble!
Dialogue: Kupo! That girl's in trouble!

Original: Serah:Sis!?
Dialogue: Sis!?

Original: Papalymo:"Sis"? Is that lass your kin?
Dialogue: "Sis"? Is that lass your kin?

Original: Shantotto:Now that you mention it, the resemblance isn't thin.
Dialogue: Now that you mention it, the resemblance isn't thin.

Original: Lightning:Sit tight, Serah! I've got this!
Dialogue: Sit tight, Serah! I've got this!

Original: Papalymo:Here they come! On your guards!
Dialogue: Here they come! On your guards!

Original: Lightning:Are you alright?
Dialogue: Are you alright?

Original: Serah:...Those clothes... You're...the old you...
Dialogue: ...Those clothes... You're...the old you...

Original: Wakka:Lightning's little sister? ...They're so different.
Dialogue: Lightning's little sister? ...They're so different.

Original: Edge:Yeah, she's so sweet and innocent looking.
Dialogue: Yeah, she's so sweet and innocent looking.

Original: Lightning:Serah... Where did you learn to use that weapon?
Dialogue: Serah... Where did you learn to use that weapon?

Original: Serah:Um, I think... I'm probably from a different time than the me you know.
Dialogue: Um, I think... I'm probably from a different time than the me you know.

Original: Mog:Kupo! Not just a different time, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! Not just a different time, kupo!

Original: Serah:What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Wakka:It's the Torsions' fault there's monsters everywhere. Worse'n monsters in grips, too.
Dialogue: It's the Torsions' fault there's monsters everywhere. Worse'n monsters in grips, too.

Original: Lightning:Don't worry. I'll make sure you're safe.
Dialogue: Don't worry. I'll make sure you're safe.

Original: Edge:Whoa, not just Lightning, you know? You can count on all of us!
Dialogue: Whoa, not just Lightning, you know? You can count on all of us!

Original: Serah:Um, I'm glad and all, but I can fight, too...
Dialogue: Um, I'm glad and all, but I can fight, too...

Original: Mog:Kupo! In that case, let's get a move on, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! In that case, let's get a move on, kupo!

Original: Lightning:Put your weapons away. I'll keep you safe.
Dialogue: Put your weapons away. I'll keep you safe.

Original: Serah:You're treating me like a kid!
Dialogue: You're treating me like a kid!

Original: Serah:Although...it does bring back memories. ...Back when I couldn't do anything.
Dialogue: Although...it does bring back memories. ...Back when I couldn't do anything.

Original: Vaan:Lightning, what's the matter? Are you tired?
Dialogue: Lightning, what's the matter? Are you tired?

Original: Galuf:It's no wonder, trying to cover Serah in every battle.
Dialogue: It's no wonder, trying to cover Serah in every battle.

Original: Serah:That's why I said I can fight for myself! Would you listen to me?
Dialogue: That's why I said I can fight for myself! Would you listen to me?

Original: Lightning:No! I don't care how much you've grown. As long as I'm around, you don't need to fight!
Dialogue: No! I don't care how much you've grown. As long as I'm around, you don't need to fight!

Original: Galuf:......Such obstinate siblings.
Dialogue: ......Such obstinate siblings.

Original: Galuf:Lightning, what reason do you have to stop your sister when she says she'll fight?
Dialogue: Lightning, what reason do you have to stop your sister when she says she'll fight?

Original: Galuf:And don't tell me it's because of her age. We have geezers and babes alike on the lines here.
Dialogue: And don't tell me it's because of her age. We have geezers and babes alike on the lines here.

Original: Lightning:Serah's a civilian, not a warrior. Of course I can't let her go to battle.
Dialogue: Serah's a civilian, not a warrior. Of course I can't let her go to battle.

Original: Yda:Not a warrior, huh...?
Dialogue: Not a warrior, huh...?

Original: Yda:You know, I've thought about it before, but how do you separate the warriors from otherwise?
Dialogue: You know, I've thought about it before, but how do you separate the warriors from otherwise?

Original: Vaan:That's stumped me, too. Me and Penelo're both just orphans who started using weapons as we traveled.
Dialogue: That's stumped me, too. Me and Penelo're both just orphans who started using weapons as we traveled.

Original: Galuf:Whether one has or hasn't the title or the training is merely superficial.
Dialogue: Whether one has or hasn't the title or the training is merely superficial.

Original: Galuf:If one has the will and the spirit, then anyone can be a warrior. That's my philosophy.
Dialogue: If one has the will and the spirit, then anyone can be a warrior. That's my philosophy.

Original: Lightning:...What's your point?
Dialogue: ...What's your point?

Original: Galuf:My point is your sister has those qualities.
Dialogue: My point is your sister has those qualities.

Original: Serah:As long as you have this "light," you can fight in this world, right?
Dialogue: As long as you have this "light," you can fight in this world, right?

Original: Galuf:Mog, do you sense the light in Serah?
Dialogue: Mog, do you sense the light in Serah?

Original: Mog:You bet, kupo! Dazzling light is positively pouring out of her, kupo!
Dialogue: You bet, kupo! Dazzling light is positively pouring out of her, kupo!

Original: Lightning:Stay out of this, moogle. Serah doesn't need to suffer any more than she already
Dialogue: Stay out of this, moogle. Serah doesn't need to suffer any more than she already—

Original: Serah:I can do it.
Dialogue: I can do it.

Original: Serah:Just like you've protected me, I can protect you, too.
Dialogue: Just like you've protected me, I can protect you, too.

Original: Serah:I've journeyed with that in mind. Not because anyone ordered me to, either.
Dialogue: I've journeyed with that in mind. Not because anyone ordered me to, either.

Original: Lightning:...You're always like this. You never listen to what I say...
Dialogue: ...You're always like this. You never listen to what I say...

Original: Vaan:Don't get so bent outta shape. If anyone gets into trouble, everyone'll help out like we've done this whole time so far.
Dialogue: Don't get so bent outta shape. If anyone gets into trouble, everyone'll help out like we've done this whole time so far.

Original: Serah:Thank you, Vaan. See, Sis?
Dialogue: Thank you, Vaan. See, Sis?

Original: Lightning:...Do whatever you want.
Dialogue: ...Do whatever you want.

Original: Galuf:Ho ho ho! It's settled! And thus does a new warrior with the light join our ranks!
Dialogue: Ho ho ho! It's settled! And thus does a new warrior with the light join our ranks!

Original: The Emperor:To appear before me, I take it you have made up your minds.
Dialogue: To appear before me, I take it you have made up your minds.

Original: Warrior of Light:There are none among us who would follow you. We have known that from the start.
Dialogue: There are none among us who would follow you. We have known that from the start.

Original: The Emperor:Oh? ...Then let me ask you this.
Dialogue: Oh? ...Then let me ask you this.

Original: The Emperor:Where is the purpose in repeatedly fighting meaningless battles as compelled by a pitiless god?
Dialogue: Where is the purpose in repeatedly fighting meaningless battles as compelled by a pitiless god?

Original: Cecil:You call all we have done so far meaningless?
Dialogue: You call all we have done so far meaningless?

Original: The Emperor:Claims to protect your homeworlds are, et cetera, et cetera... Worms' drivel in the end.
Dialogue: Claims to protect your homeworlds are, et cetera, et cetera... Worms' drivel in the end.

Original: The Emperor:Shall I provide you with the evidence?
Dialogue: Shall I provide you with the evidence?

Original: Galuf:And you're claiming you can give meaning to our battles?
Dialogue: And you're claiming you can give meaning to our battles?

Original: The Emperor:Precisely. Under my reign, you could personally witness your worlds being devoured.
Dialogue: Precisely. Under my reign, you could personally witness your worlds being devoured.

Original: Galuf:That's more like it.
Dialogue: That's more like it.

Original: Galuf:When all is said and done, we have a duty to protect our worlds from tyrants like you.
Dialogue: When all is said and done, we have a duty to protect our worlds from tyrants like you.

Original: Cecil:Torsions aside, we cannot allow the evil before us to go unaddressed!
Dialogue: Torsions aside, we cannot allow the evil before us to go unaddressed!

Original: Firion:Even in this world I've gathered allies. Friends who won't bow to your rule.
Dialogue: Even in this world I've gathered allies. Friends who won't bow to your rule.

Original: Firion:Your schemes end here!
Dialogue: Your schemes end here!

Original: The Emperor:Fools... Regret your decision as you fall!
Dialogue: Fools... Regret your decision as you fall!

Original: The Emperor:Those who do not accept my rule are all worms... Begone!
Dialogue: Those who do not accept my rule are all worms... Begone!

Original: The Emperor:I...? Defeated...? Unbelievable...
Dialogue: I...? Defeated...? Unbelievable...

Original: The Emperor:...Is I suppose what you would like me to say, hm?
Dialogue: ...Is I suppose what you would like me to say, hm?

Original: Firion:Everyone, keep at it! Don't let your guard down!
Dialogue: Everyone, keep at it! Don't let your guard down!

Original: The Emperor:I have had enough of you for now.
Dialogue: I have had enough of you for now.

Original: Onion Knight:I don't know about you, but I don't think I could stand serving under a coward like him.
Dialogue: I don't know about you, but I don't think I could stand serving under a coward like him.

Original: Shantotto:I think I agree with you, my dear. Crass displays of might bore me to tears.
Dialogue: I think I agree with you, my dear. Crass displays of might bore me to tears.

Original: Shadow:...For now, I'm on this side...and that makes you the enemy.
Dialogue: ...For now, I'm on this side...and that makes you the enemy.

Original: Firion:Everyone...thank you.
Dialogue: Everyone...thank you.

Original: The Emperor:Scramble as you try to flee, worms!
Dialogue: Scramble as you try to flee, worms!

Original: Firion:Let's go!
Dialogue: Let's go!

Original: The Emperor:Take care of them for me, giant from another world!
Dialogue: Take care of them for me, giant from another world!

Original: Serah:We closed the Torsion!
Dialogue: We closed the Torsion!

Original: Mog:I guess it belonged to that big guy, kupo.
Dialogue: I guess it belonged to that big guy, kupo.

Original: Irvine:Huh. So this is what you all are about.
Dialogue: Huh. So this is what you all are about.

Original: Edgar:Everyone alright? Give me a moment to bring her down.
Dialogue: Everyone alright? Give me a moment to bring her down.

Original: Warrior of Light:Edgar... I have heard a lot about you. The king leading an independent team of warriors...
Dialogue: Edgar... I have heard a lot about you. The king leading an independent team of warriors...

Original: Edgar:And you, one of the first-chosen "warriors with the light," so to speak. Glad to finally meet you.
Dialogue: And you, one of the first-chosen "warriors with the light," so to speak. Glad to finally meet you.

Original: Warrior of Light:Tell me, if you knew of our campaign, why did you not join us?
Dialogue: Tell me, if you knew of our campaign, why did you not join us?

Original: Lightning:Like me, he has little faith in those gods.
Dialogue: Like me, he has little faith in those gods.

Original: Edgar:Lightning, you look lovely today. It's as though rose petals came fluttering in...
Dialogue: Lightning, you look lovely today. It's as though rose petals came fluttering in...

Original: Lightning:...I've had little faith in him with that attitude, too.
Dialogue: ...I've had little faith in him with that attitude, too.

Original: Edgar:Color me shocked!
Dialogue: Color me shocked!

Original: Edgar:...I jest. Let me tell you about the Returners...while that moogle isn't around.
Dialogue: ...I jest. Let me tell you about the Returners...while that moogle isn't around.

Original: Edgar:I believe you've heard their names, but this world was created by two gods:
Dialogue: I believe you've heard their names, but this world was created by two gods

Original: Warrior of Light:The Goddess Materia... And the God Spiritus...
Dialogue: The Goddess Materia... And the God Spiritus...

Original: Edgar:Yes. Apparently these two are at odds with each other...
Dialogue: Yes. Apparently these two are at odds with each other...

Original: Edgar:Why was the world made? Why are the dimensions distorted? We have no answers to these basic issues.
Dialogue: Why was the world made? Why are the dimensions distorted? We have no answers to these basic issues.

Original: Edgar:That's why I thought it necessary to have a group attached to neither of the gods.
Dialogue: That's why I thought it necessary to have a group attached to neither of the gods.

Original: Warrior of Light:Attached to neither... You were searching for the reason for these battles?
Dialogue: Attached to neither... You were searching for the reason for these battles?

Original: Warrior of Light:You sent several warriors to our side. That was also part of your investigation?
Dialogue: You sent several warriors to our side. That was also part of your investigation?

Original: Edgar:That was a little bit of my direction, a little bit of their own cognizance.
Dialogue: That was a little bit of my direction, a little bit of their own cognizance.

Original: Edgar:Free will is what makes us human after all.
Dialogue: Free will is what makes us human after all.

Original: Lightning:So what made the king of info cast his own crown into the ring all of a sudden?
Dialogue: So what made the king of info cast his own crown into the ring all of a sudden?

Original: Edgar:According to Layle, you've got a date with divinity.
Dialogue: According to Layle, you've got a date with divinity.

Original: Edgar:That's a party I'd like to crash. There's a thing or two I want to confirm.
Dialogue: That's a party I'd like to crash. There's a thing or two I want to confirm.

Original: Warrior of Light:Very well. I see no reason to deny your request. Although I do not know how Mog will react.
Dialogue: Very well. I see no reason to deny your request. Although I do not know how Mog will react.

Original: Lightning:He's already acknowledged Edgar has the light. I doubt he'd go back on that.
Dialogue: He's already acknowledged Edgar has the light. I doubt he'd go back on that.

Original: Edgar:There you have it. I look forward to working with you.
Dialogue: There you have it. I look forward to working with you.

Original: Warrior of Light:Let us together uncover the truth of this world...!
Dialogue: Let us together uncover the truth of this world...!

Original: Lightning:...Serah, are you sure you're alright?
Dialogue: ...Serah, are you sure you're alright?

Original: Serah:I said I'm fine. You saw what I could do with a bow.
Dialogue: I said I'm fine. You saw what I could do with a bow.

Original: Sazh:Heheh, those're the kinda guts you'd expect outta Lightning's little sister.
Dialogue: Heheh, those're the kinda guts you'd expect outta Lightning's little sister.

Original: Hope:You really are strong. What happened in the future...?
Dialogue: You really are strong. What happened in the future...?

Original: Serah:I can't tell you, because that's what I've been fighting to protect.
Dialogue: I can't tell you, because that's what I've been fighting to protect.

Original: Lightning:...You're different from the Serah I know. It's a little...hard to deal with.
Dialogue: ...You're different from the Serah I know. It's a little...hard to deal with.

Original: Serah:Haha... C'mon, I can't be a kid forever.
Dialogue: Haha... C'mon, I can't be a kid forever.

Original: Lightning:Even I know that!
Dialogue: Even I know that!

Original: Sazh:(Hey, Hope, did you see that? Lightning just got shut down.)
Dialogue: (Hey, Hope, did you see that? Lightning just got shut down.)

Original: Hope:(Wow... I think we found her one weak spot.)
Dialogue: (Wow... I think we found her one weak spot.)

Original: Lightning:You two have something to say?
Dialogue: You two have something to say?

Original: Sazh:We were just admiring how good your sister's turned out. Right, Hope?
Dialogue: We were just admiring how good your sister's turned out. Right, Hope?

Original: Hope:Huh? Uh, yeah! Right!
Dialogue: Huh? Uh, yeah! Right!

Original: Serah:It's weird, though... I was hoping to introduce you to him.
Dialogue: It's weird, though... I was hoping to introduce you to him.

Original: Sazh:Get out! Your weapon's a moogle? What the heck is going on in the future!?
Dialogue: Get out! Your weapon's a moogle? What the heck is going on in the future!?

Original: Hope:I had never seen a moogle before other than stuffed animals.
Dialogue: I had never seen a moogle before other than stuffed animals.

Original: Serah:Right? That's why I wanted to give him a proper introduction...
Dialogue: Right? That's why I wanted to give him a proper introduction...

Original: Serah:Just like Mog here, he's been a strong ally on my journey and taught me so much.
Dialogue: Just like Mog here, he's been a strong ally on my journey and taught me so much.

Original: Lightning:Maybe he was sealed away, so he can't let any secrets slip...
Dialogue: Maybe he was sealed away, so he can't let any secrets slip...

Original: Hope:Sealed by who? Our enemies? Or...
Dialogue: Sealed by who? Our enemies? Or...

Original: Lightning:I don't trust Mog. That's the kind of trick I'd expect him to pull.
Dialogue: I don't trust Mog. That's the kind of trick I'd expect him to pull.

Original: Sazh:Now, now. It could just be the rules're different here.
Dialogue: Now, now. It could just be the rules're different here.

Original: Sazh:Hypothesizing won't do ya any good.
Dialogue: Hypothesizing won't do ya any good.

Original: Serah:That's right. Let's just concentrate on this world's struggle.
Dialogue: That's right. Let's just concentrate on this world's struggle.

Original: Serah:(I get to travel with the old Lightning and everyone else... I want to enjoy this while I can...)
Dialogue: (I get to travel with the old Lightning and everyone else... I want to enjoy this while I can...)

Original: Materia:Warriors... Why do you stand before me?
Dialogue: Warriors... Why do you stand before me?

Original: Edgar:You needn't look so serious. Who wouldn't want to catch a glimpse of a ravishing goddess?
Dialogue: You needn't look so serious. Who wouldn't want to catch a glimpse of a ravishing goddess?

Original: Ramza:Edgar, I do not believe we came here to make japes.
Dialogue: Edgar, I do not believe we came here to make japes.

Original: Edgar:...At ease. This is called proper etiquette.
Dialogue: ...At ease. This is called proper etiquette.

Original: Lightning:We've come to ask you some questions.
Dialogue: We've come to ask you some questions.

Original: Lightning:What is this world? Why did you summon us?
Dialogue: What is this world? Why did you summon us?

Original: Materia:This is a land of fantasy... A manufactured world.
Dialogue: This is a land of fantasy... A manufactured world.

Original: Materia:It was meant to be a place of respite for warriors amidst their endless struggles. However...
Dialogue: It was meant to be a place of respite for warriors amidst their endless struggles. However...

Original: Edgar:...The Torsions appeared and it became a place of something other than respite.
Dialogue: ...The Torsions appeared and it became a place of something other than respite.

Original: Mog:That's why I'm helping the goddess by guiding you, kupo.
Dialogue: That's why I'm helping the goddess by guiding you, kupo.

Original: Materia:I am accountable here. I bear the responsibilities of a god...
Dialogue: I am accountable here. I bear the responsibilities of a god...

Original: Materia:To protect this world, I need your strength.
Dialogue: To protect this world, I need your strength.

Original: Edgar:And Mog's, too, it seems.
Dialogue: And Mog's, too, it seems.

Original: Materia:Moogles are able to locate the Torsions. For that reason, I dispatched Mog.
Dialogue: Moogles are able to locate the Torsions. For that reason, I dispatched Mog.

Original: Lightning:How about we change the question. ...What is it that other god, Spiritus, is up to?
Dialogue: How about we change the question. ...What is it that other god, Spiritus, is up to?

Original: Lightning:Far from asking for aid, I get the impression everyone he summons is hellbent on destroying the world.
Dialogue: Far from asking for aid, I get the impression everyone he summons is hellbent on destroying the world.

Original: Materia:Spiritus's only recourse is power... He believes he can solve any problem with force.
Dialogue: Spiritus's only recourse is power... He believes he can solve any problem with force.

Original: Materia:The result of that line of thought are those warriors who so run counter to your beliefs.
Dialogue: The result of that line of thought are those warriors who so run counter to your beliefs.

Original: Ramza:Did you not create this world together? Is cooperation out of the question?
Dialogue: Did you not create this world together? Is cooperation out of the question?

Original: Materia:Spiritus's methods will not save this world... I must protect...my world.
Dialogue: Spiritus's methods will not save this world... I must protect...my world.

Original: Lightning:Possessive much?
Dialogue: Possessive much?

Original: Ramza:During our battles, we have noticed a feeling that our strength is being drained from us.
Dialogue: During our battles, we have noticed a feeling that our strength is being drained from us.

Original: Ramza:Know you the cause of this?
Dialogue: Know you the cause of this?

Original: Materia:Alas, no... It may be the Torsions, or it may be something else. I cannot say.
Dialogue: Alas, no... It may be the Torsions, or it may be something else. I cannot say.

Original: Edgar:Perhaps by the next time we meet, you might look into that for us. Then we'd be more eager to fight for you.
Dialogue: Perhaps by the next time we meet, you might look into that for us. Then we'd be more eager to fight for you.

Original: Lightning:Yeah. Someone who doesn't work herself doesn't really motivate me.
Dialogue: Yeah. Someone who doesn't work herself doesn't really motivate me.

Original: Materia:...Very well. Now go.
Dialogue: ...Very well. Now go.

Original: Materia:I also...will do what a god must.
Dialogue: I also...will do what a god must.

Original: Faris:Same as ever, but...nary a soul in sight, eh?
Dialogue: Same as ever, but...nary a soul in sight, eh?

Original: Edgar:Amidst crumbling ruins we may be, but same as ever, your beauty is beyond compare.
Dialogue: Amidst crumbling ruins we may be, but same as ever, your beauty is beyond compare.

Original: Faris:Ugh, foul. Shove off before I do it for you.
Dialogue: Ugh, foul. Shove off before I do it for you.

Original: Setzer:You might as well ignore him. That's just the way he is.
Dialogue: You might as well ignore him. That's just the way he is.

Original: Faris:Then direct it at Eiko. I'm sure she'd appreciate it.
Dialogue: Then direct it at Eiko. I'm sure she'd appreciate it.

Original: Edgar:...Eiko? How, uh...old were you again?
Dialogue: ...Eiko? How, uh...old were you again?

Original: Eiko:Already a fine lady of six!
Dialogue: Already a fine lady of six!

Original: Edgar:I'm afraid that's a bit too young...
Dialogue: I'm afraid that's a bit too young...

Original: Eiko:That's not fair! I told you to stop treating me like a kid!
Dialogue: That's not fair! I told you to stop treating me like a kid!

Original: Hope:...I guess he knows when to draw the line.
Dialogue: ...I guess he knows when to draw the line.

Original: Setzer:Even kings have their boundaries.
Dialogue: Even kings have their boundaries.

Original: Setzer:But listen, kid. Don't you grow up like him. There's nothing but trouble in store for you.
Dialogue: But listen, kid. Don't you grow up like him. There's nothing but trouble in store for you.

Original: Edgar:Excuse me? I've grown up just fine. Don't go putting strange ideas into impressionable young minds.
Dialogue: Excuse me? I've grown up just fine. Don't go putting strange ideas into impressionable young minds.

Original: Mog:Are we ready, kupo?
Dialogue: Are we ready, kupo?

Original: Mog:I've pinpointed the Torsion, so let's go, kupo!
Dialogue: I've pinpointed the Torsion, so let's go, kupo!

Original: Hope:Edgar, is it okay to keep going along with Mog like this?
Dialogue: Edgar, is it okay to keep going along with Mog like this?

Original: Edgar:Not only is it okay, it's in our best interest.
Dialogue: Not only is it okay, it's in our best interest.

Original: Edgar:Materia tried to hide it, but it's apparent she doesn't know much about Mog either.
Dialogue: Materia tried to hide it, but it's apparent she doesn't know much about Mog either.

Original: Hope:Which means it's up to us to find out what he's up to?
Dialogue: Which means it's up to us to find out what he's up to?

Original: Setzer:At the very least, he's not lying when he says we can't use the airship.
Dialogue: At the very least, he's not lying when he says we can't use the airship.

Original: Setzer:I checked the engines and the instrumentation, and confirmed we can't approach the Torsion. As to why...
Dialogue: I checked the engines and the instrumentation, and confirmed we can't approach the Torsion. As to why...

Original: Faris:What did Sazh and Balthier say?
Dialogue: What did Sazh and Balthier say?

Original: Setzer:I consulted with Cecil, too. Our worlds are different, but we all came to the same conclusion.
Dialogue: I consulted with Cecil, too. Our worlds are different, but we all came to the same conclusion.

Original: Hope:Up till now, near the larger Torsions, we always run into someone new from another world...
Dialogue: Up till now, near the larger Torsions, we always run into someone new from another world...

Original: Hope:I wonder if there'll be someone at this one, too.
Dialogue: I wonder if there'll be someone at this one, too.

Original: Edgar:Let's hope for someone friendly.
Dialogue: Let's hope for someone friendly.

Original: Eiko:What're we waiting for? Mog's gonna leave us.
Dialogue: What're we waiting for? Mog's gonna leave us.

Original: Faris:Aye, let's get a move on. For now, we should keep pressing forward.
Dialogue: Aye, let's get a move on. For now, we should keep pressing forward.

Original: Edgar:Indeed. We can continue our conversation on the road.
Dialogue: Indeed. We can continue our conversation on the road.

Original: Raijin:Ah! We meet again, ya know!
Dialogue: Ah! We meet again, ya know!

Original: Squall:Seifer and the disciplinary committee... You're still around?
Dialogue: Seifer and the disciplinary committee... You're still around?

Original: Fujin:STRANDED. QUANDARY.
Dialogue: STRANDED. QUANDARY.

Original: Seifer:You losers came to close the Torsion, didn't you?
Dialogue: You losers came to close the Torsion, didn't you?

Original: ???:So these are the children guided by a moogle...?
Dialogue: So these are the children guided by a moogle...?

Original: Squall:The sorceress...Ultimecia!?
Dialogue: The sorceress...Ultimecia!?

Original: Seifer:...And who let slip that name to you? Ahh, that moogle, I bet.
Dialogue: ...And who let slip that name to you? Ahh, that moogle, I bet.

Original: Squall:You don't remember!? What happened back in our world...? What you did...?
Dialogue: You don't remember!? What happened back in our world...? What you did...?

Original: Seifer:I fulfilled my dream, all on my own. I became the sorceress's knight!
Dialogue: I fulfilled my dream, all on my own. I became the sorceress's knight!

Original: Ramza:Knight? Sorceress? ...What is this about?
Dialogue: Knight? Sorceress? ...What is this about?

Original: Raijin:In our world, these people called sorceresses have special powers, ya know?
Dialogue: In our world, these people called sorceresses have special powers, ya know?

Original: Raijin:And Ultimecia is an outstanding sorceress! She granted Seifer some of that power, ya know?
Dialogue: And Ultimecia is an outstanding sorceress! She granted Seifer some of that power, ya know?

Original: Seifer:Relax, Fujin. These losers are too dumb to figure out what's going on anyway.
Dialogue: Relax, Fujin. These losers are too dumb to figure out what's going on anyway.

Original: Seifer:They have no idea what's happening in this world, or who that moogle is!
Dialogue: They have no idea what's happening in this world, or who that moogle is!

Original: Ramza:Are they our enemies or our allies?
Dialogue: Are they our enemies or our allies?

Original: Squall:...Things are all screwed up. At the very least, we can't let Ultimecia get away.
Dialogue: ...Things are all screwed up. At the very least, we can't let Ultimecia get away.

Original: Ultimecia:...The Torsion beyond here belongs to me. If you would press on, do your best to overcome the obstacles before you.
Dialogue: ...The Torsion beyond here belongs to me. If you would press on, do your best to overcome the obstacles before you.

Original: Seifer:The sorceress doesn't need to dirty her hands with small fry like you.
Dialogue: The sorceress doesn't need to dirty her hands with small fry like you.

Original: Squall:Seifer! Fujin, Raijin! Don't follow her! ...You've got to listen to me!
Dialogue: Seifer! Fujin, Raijin! Don't follow her! ...You've got to listen to me!

Original: Mog:I think a fight's inevitable, kupo!
Dialogue: I think a fight's inevitable, kupo!

Original: Ramza:If we are attacked, we'll do what we must. Someone please explain to me the circumstances afterward.
Dialogue: If we are attacked, we'll do what we must. Someone please explain to me the circumstances afterward.

Original: Seifer:No one'll be able to explain anything when I'm through with you!
Dialogue: No one'll be able to explain anything when I'm through with you!

Original: Seifer:I've fulfilled my dream! I don't have to take anyone's crap!
Dialogue: I've fulfilled my dream! I don't have to take anyone's crap!

Original: Ultimecia:...It is still not enough, yes?
Dialogue: ...It is still not enough, yes?

Original: Mog:Kupo!? Wh-what do you mean!?
Dialogue: Kupo!? Wh-what do you mean!?

Original: Ultimecia:When emotions are reft...faith betrayed... When anger and hate prevail...
Dialogue: When emotions are reft...faith betrayed... When anger and hate prevail...

Original: Ultimecia:Man seeks greater power... And strife intensifies...
Dialogue: Man seeks greater power... And strife intensifies...

Original: Fujin:SEIFER!
Dialogue: SEIFER!

Original: Raijin:It's draggin' us in, ya know!
Dialogue: It's draggin' us in, ya know!

Original: Prishe:Hey! Wake up!
Dialogue: Hey! Wake up!

Original: Squall:We're...still alive...
Dialogue: We're...still alive...

Original: Yuna:Yes...everyone in our group is well. But...more importantly...
Dialogue: Yes...everyone in our group is well. But...more importantly...

Original: Prishe:Mog's gone. Not that he isn't usually a slippery sucker.
Dialogue: Mog's gone. Not that he isn't usually a slippery sucker.

Original: Irvine:We all came tumbling down together, but no sign of Seifer and his pals, either.
Dialogue: We all came tumbling down together, but no sign of Seifer and his pals, either.

Original: Warrior of Light:There seems to be a passageway at least. Before we explore that path, though...
Dialogue: There seems to be a passageway at least. Before we explore that path, though...

Original: Prishe:We thought you two could fill us in on this "sorceress."
Dialogue: We thought you two could fill us in on this "sorceress."

Original: Squall:...How much did you tell them?
Dialogue: ...How much did you tell them?

Original: Irvine:About as far as what you'd find in a garden's textbooks.
Dialogue: About as far as what you'd find in a garden's textbooks.

Original: Warrior of Light:Rulers possessed of extreme power. Good and evil ones have existed throughout history. Protected by knights.
Dialogue: Rulers possessed of extreme power. Good and evil ones have existed throughout history. Protected by knights.

Original: Irvine:...I wasn't sure how much you'd remember.
Dialogue: ...I wasn't sure how much you'd remember.

Original: Squall:If you know of Ultimecia, then our memories can't be too far apart.
Dialogue: If you know of Ultimecia, then our memories can't be too far apart.

Original: Irvine:No telling when we might've forgotten something, though.
Dialogue: No telling when we might've forgotten something, though.

Original: Irvine:Psst... (It doesn't seem like Zell or Laguna remember anything.)
Dialogue: Psst... (It doesn't seem like Zell or Laguna remember anything.)

Original: Squall:I see... So we're at the mercy of faulty memories here, too...
Dialogue: I see... So we're at the mercy of faulty memories here, too...

Original: Yuna:Even though you came from the same world, the memories you're missing aren't the same...?
Dialogue: Even though you came from the same world, the memories you're missing aren't the same...?

Original: Prishe:First! Walk! Then while you're walking...talk!
Dialogue: First! Walk! Then while you're walking...talk!

Original: Prishe:We're gonna starve to death if we keep standing around here!
Dialogue: We're gonna starve to death if we keep standing around here!

Original: Squall:...Right. Maybe we'll find someone while we're walking, too.
Dialogue: ...Right. Maybe we'll find someone while we're walking, too.

Original: Irvine:Mog, Seifer, or Ultimecia...
Dialogue: Mog, Seifer, or Ultimecia...

Original: Irvine:...Which one's worse?
Dialogue: ...Which one's worse?

Original: Laguna:This Ultimecia isn't the sorceress I know. Does it have something to do with the Torsions?
Dialogue: This Ultimecia isn't the sorceress I know. Does it have something to do with the Torsions?

Original: Lightning:You'd said even comrades from the same world could have varying gaps in their memories and knowledge.
Dialogue: You'd said even comrades from the same world could have varying gaps in their memories and knowledge.

Original: Squall:...Pure conjecture, but more or less.
Dialogue: ...Pure conjecture, but more or less.

Original: Squall:Your sister isn't the same as you remember, right?
Dialogue: Your sister isn't the same as you remember, right?

Original: Serah:Yeah... I'm pretty sure I know about a lot more things that've happened than Lightning.
Dialogue: Yeah... I'm pretty sure I know about a lot more things that've happened than Lightning.

Original: Cecil:Apparently I've lost something as well... This darkness...seems not to be my true self.
Dialogue: Apparently I've lost something as well... This darkness...seems not to be my true self.

Original: Zell:Y'know...if you say "sorceress," a different name pops up for me, too.
Dialogue: Y'know...if you say "sorceress," a different name pops up for me, too.

Original: Squall:(...About the same as Seifer, I wonder.)
Dialogue: (...About the same as Seifer, I wonder.)

Original: Squall:How much do you remember?
Dialogue: How much do you remember?

Original: Zell:Shoot... That's about it. I feel like a lot more went down, but it's all a jumble...
Dialogue: Shoot... That's about it. I feel like a lot more went down, but it's all a jumble...

Original: Laguna:Now I get it... I'm completely lost!
Dialogue: Now I get it... I'm completely lost!

Original: Squall:Ultimecia is dangerous. That's all you need to remember.
Dialogue: Ultimecia is dangerous. That's all you need to remember.

Original: Zell:"That's all..."? Don't be a heartless jerk!
Dialogue: "That's all..."? Don't be a heartless jerk!

Original: Zell:Tell me what I forgot! I already told you what I remember!
Dialogue: Tell me what I forgot! I already told you what I remember!

Original: Cecil:I know the unease you feel. But...surely these memories must be things you need to recall on your own.
Dialogue: I know the unease you feel. But...surely these memories must be things you need to recall on your own.

Original: Lightning:That your way of telling me to accept my cluelessness about why Serahan ordinary citizenis armed for combat?
Dialogue: That your way of telling me to accept my cluelessness about why Serah—an ordinary citizen—is armed for combat?

Original: Serah:...There are some things you're not supposed to know.
Dialogue: ...There are some things you're not supposed to know.

Original: Serah:If time and space are warped, I'll have to straighten it out...
Dialogue: If time and space are warped, I'll have to straighten it out...

Original: Zell:...Hrrrm, fine. I'll try to remember myself.
Dialogue: ...Hrrrm, fine. I'll try to remember myself.

Original: Laguna:I guess I'll do the same. The name might be different, but a bad sorceress never gave me any good memories.
Dialogue: I guess I'll do the same. The name might be different, but a bad sorceress never gave me any good memories.

Original: Squall:(Zell is one thing...but what happens if Laguna remembers?)
Dialogue: (Zell is one thing...but what happens if Laguna remembers?)

Original: Squall:(Would he age on the spot to match what was missing? Would everyone else, for that matter?)
Dialogue: (Would he age on the spot to match what was missing? Would everyone else, for that matter?)

Original: Squall:...No point in dwelling on it, I guess.
Dialogue: ...No point in dwelling on it, I guess.

Original: Raijin:This is hopeless, ya know... I've got nowhere to go, ya know?
Dialogue: This is hopeless, ya know... I've got nowhere to go, ya know?

Original: Squall:They abandoned you?
Dialogue: They abandoned you?

Original: Raijin:We just got separated, ya know!
Dialogue: We just got separated, ya know!

Original: Zell:And no one came to look for you? Lost, all on your own...
Dialogue: And no one came to look for you? Lost, all on your own...

Original: Raijin:The members of the disciplinary committee are self-reliant, ya know! I'll find my way out of here, ya know?
Dialogue: The members of the disciplinary committee are self-reliant, ya know! I'll find my way out of here, ya know?

Original: Cecil:From when we met before, too...I feel you are easier to talk with. Can you tell us about Seifer and the sorceress?
Dialogue: From when we met before, too...I feel you are easier to talk with. Can you tell us about Seifer and the sorceress?

Original: Raijin:No can do, ya know?
Dialogue: No can do, ya know?

Original: Raijin:...If I ain't with him, Seifer might be all on his own, ya know?
Dialogue: ...If I ain't with him, Seifer might be all on his own, ya know?

Original: Yang:Your friendship is moving...but you must not let it mislead you.
Dialogue: Your friendship is moving...but you must not let it mislead you.

Original: Raijin:I ain't being mislead, ya know! If I defeat you guys, maybe it'll make Seifer's work a little easier, ya know?
Dialogue: I ain't being mislead, ya know! If I defeat you guys, maybe it'll make Seifer's work a little easier, ya know?

Original: Squall:You want a fight?
Dialogue: You want a fight?

Original: Zell:Of course it would end up this way... I never did get along with the disciplinary committee!
Dialogue: Of course it would end up this way... I never did get along with the disciplinary committee!

Original: Raijin:Aw, crud! I'm outmatched, ya know!
Dialogue: Aw, crud! I'm outmatched, ya know!

Original: Squall:...We've got this.
Dialogue: ...We've got this.

Original: Raijin:Y-you saved me, ya know?
Dialogue: Y-you saved me, ya know?

Original: Squall:Sorry to bother you.
Dialogue: Sorry to bother you.

Original: Tifa:Don't be a bully. He obviously needs our help.
Dialogue: Don't be a bully. He obviously needs our help.

Original: Raijin:Man... Seifer's been acting weird ever since he met the sorceress, ya know?
Dialogue: Man... Seifer's been acting weird ever since he met the sorceress, ya know?

Original: Raijin:I mean, he's always had a temper, but it's worse now, ya know?
Dialogue: I mean, he's always had a temper, but it's worse now, ya know?

Original: Squall:(Even without remembering what went down back home...he's still concerned for his friend.)
Dialogue: (Even without remembering what went down back home...he's still concerned for his friend.)

Original: Squall:The three of you don't seem to remember, but things'll get way worse if you leave them as they are.
Dialogue: The three of you don't seem to remember, but things'll get way worse if you leave them as they are.

Original: Raijin:Seriously? And he was so happy to become a knight, ya know?
Dialogue: Seriously? And he was so happy to become a knight, ya know?

Original: Firion:Could his happiness then not be his own...but a product of brainwashing?
Dialogue: Could his happiness then not be his own...but a product of brainwashing?

Original: Squall:It was when it happened in our world, so I wouldn't rule it out here.
Dialogue: It was when it happened in our world, so I wouldn't rule it out here.

Original: Raijin:I gotta do something, ya know! This is no time for getting lost, ya know!
Dialogue: I gotta do something, ya know! This is no time for getting lost, ya know!

Original: Raijin:If you know the way out of here, let me join ya, ya know?
Dialogue: If you know the way out of here, let me join ya, ya know?

Original: Tifa:Are you sure? I doubt Seifer would let that slide.
Dialogue: Are you sure? I doubt Seifer would let that slide.

Original: Raijin:I'll talk to him when we find him, ya know?
Dialogue: I'll talk to him when we find him, ya know?

Original: Firion:Then let's go. If it's something we can talk out, that will be the best course of action.
Dialogue: Then let's go. If it's something we can talk out, that will be the best course of action.

Original: Squall:(Seifer's gonna be pissed.)
Dialogue: (Seifer's gonna be pissed.)

Original: Squall:That willingness to butt heads...is what makes you friends, huh?
Dialogue: That willingness to butt heads...is what makes you friends, huh?

Original: Raijin:I owe ya one, ya know!
Dialogue: I owe ya one, ya know!

Original: Mog:Kupo... Looks like I got separated, kupo.
Dialogue: Kupo... Looks like I got separated, kupo.

Original: Mog:Should I try to go back to the airship, kupo? Or maybe call everyone to me with their dimensional coordinates...?
Dialogue: Should I try to go back to the airship, kupo? Or maybe call everyone to me with their dimensional coordinates...?

Original: Seifer:Oh...it's just you.
Dialogue: Oh...it's just you.

Original: Mog:I could say the same; where're your lackeys, kupo?
Dialogue: I could say the same; where're your lackeys, kupo?

Original: Seifer:The sorceress wants answers. Answers you've got.
Dialogue: The sorceress wants answers. Answers you've got.

Original: Seifer:This is a perfect opportunity to get them.
Dialogue: This is a perfect opportunity to get them.

Original: Mog:Kupo!? I don't support violence, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo!? I don't support violence, kupo!

Original: Seifer:If you don't want me to slice that fuzzy body up bit by bit from the top down, you'd better start talking.
Dialogue: If you don't want me to slice that fuzzy body up bit by bit from the top down, you'd better start talking.

Original: Mog:There's nothing to tell, kupo! I'm just Mog, kupo...
Dialogue: There's nothing to tell, kupo! I'm just Mog, kupo...

Original: Seifer:Shut up. Just answer my questions.
Dialogue: Shut up. Just answer my questions.

Original: Seifer:What are you really after by gathering warriors from other worlds?
Dialogue: What are you really after by gathering warriors from other worlds?

Original: Mog:Nothing, honest! Same as always, kupo! We're just closing Torsions to save the world, kupo...
Dialogue: Nothing, honest! Same as always, kupo! We're just closing Torsions to save the world, kupo...

Original: Seifer:The sorceress said she might be willing to help depending on your answer.
Dialogue: The sorceress said she might be willing to help depending on your answer.

Original: Mog:Does that mean you and Ultimecia...you're Spiritus's warriors?
Dialogue: Does that mean you and Ultimecia...you're Spiritus's warriors?

Original: Seifer:Spiritus...that's one of the gods Ultimecia said made this world. You working for him?
Dialogue: Spiritus...that's one of the gods Ultimecia said made this world. You working for him?

Original: Mog:...He's on bad terms with Materia, the goddess who summoned the warriors in my party, so I had to keep quiet, kupo.
Dialogue: ...He's on bad terms with Materia, the goddess who summoned the warriors in my party, so I had to keep quiet, kupo.

Original: Mog:He believes it's those with power who'll save this world, kupo!
Dialogue: He believes it's those with power who'll save this world, kupo!

Original: Seifer:Those with power... And I'm one of those, right?
Dialogue: Those with power... And I'm one of those, right?

Original: Mog:You bet, kupo! You're a hero!
Dialogue: You bet, kupo! You're a hero!

Original: Mog:Take me to Ultimecia; then I'll explain everything, kupo!
Dialogue: Take me to Ultimecia; then I'll explain everything, kupo!

Original: Seifer:...Hmph. Done.
Dialogue: ...Hmph. Done.

Original: Mog:Now that that's settled, let's hurry, kupo! The exit should be that-a-way, kupo!
Dialogue: Now that that's settled, let's hurry, kupo! The exit should be that-a-way, kupo!

Original: Terra:It looks like there's a way out up ahead.
Dialogue: It looks like there's a way out up ahead.

Original: Warrior of Light:We have yet to reconnect with Mog, though...
Dialogue: We have yet to reconnect with Mog, though...

Original: Edgar:You needn't worry about that.
Dialogue: You needn't worry about that.

Original: Edgar:He summons us out of the airship and conveniently detects Torsions on an everyday basis. You think he'd be lost?
Dialogue: He summons us out of the airship and conveniently detects Torsions on an everyday basis. You think he'd be lost?

Original: Cloud:...Not likely. He's probably off somewhere else up to no good.
Dialogue: ...Not likely. He's probably off somewhere else up to no good.

Original: Terra:...I guess no one has any faith left in Mog, do they?
Dialogue: ...I guess no one has any faith left in Mog, do they?

Original: Edgar:All we know is that he hasn't been honest with us. ...Don't look so glum, now.
Dialogue: All we know is that he hasn't been honest with us. ...Don't look so glum, now.

Original: Squall:Having a "will of light" has nothing to do with powers of good...
Dialogue: Having a "will of light" has nothing to do with powers of good...

Original: Edgar:Precisely. The power we exercise in this world is "willpower" and nothing more.
Dialogue: Precisely. The power we exercise in this world is "willpower" and nothing more.

Original: Cloud:Your enemy Kefka and mine, Sephiroth, have that exact same power...
Dialogue: Your enemy Kefka and mine, Sephiroth, have that exact same power...

Original: Warrior of Light:Additionally, when our powers of will are in opposition with those adversaries, some part of it vanishes.
Dialogue: Additionally, when our powers of will are in opposition with those adversaries, some part of it vanishes.

Original: Edgar:Vanishes to where, not even the gods know. As to whether Mog knows, though...
Dialogue: Vanishes to where, not even the gods know. As to whether Mog knows, though...

Original: Squall:...Sounds as though you're looking into the matter.
Dialogue: ...Sounds as though you're looking into the matter.

Original: Edgar:Yes, I'd like to think it's going well, but...you could say it's "in god's hands."
Dialogue: Yes, I'd like to think it's going well, but...you could say it's "in god's hands."

Original: Terra:Did the sorceress... Did Ultimecia destroy your world like Kefka did ours?
Dialogue: Did the sorceress... Did Ultimecia destroy your world like Kefka did ours?

Original: Squall:"Destroy"...isn't exactly the right word for it...
Dialogue: "Destroy"...isn't exactly the right word for it...

Original: Squall:I'm pretty sure she can't accomplish what she wants if she's not in our world, though.
Dialogue: I'm pretty sure she can't accomplish what she wants if she's not in our world, though.

Original: Warrior of Light:...Which is to say we know not what she may be after here.
Dialogue: ...Which is to say we know not what she may be after here.

Original: Squall:(We defeated her once... Is she...out for revenge...?)
Dialogue: (We defeated her once... Is she...out for revenge...?)

Original: Squall:(No...she wouldn't stoop to something so petty...would she?)
Dialogue: (No...she wouldn't stoop to something so petty...would she?)

Original: Ultimecia:I am alive here...
Dialogue: I am alive here...

Original: Ultimecia:I will not let you forget it...
Dialogue: I will not let you forget it...

Original: Cloud:...Looks like you're short a knight.
Dialogue: ...Looks like you're short a knight.

Original: Squall:That doesn't make things better.
Dialogue: That doesn't make things better.

Original: Ultimecia:Now then... Let us alert those sleeping in their cradles of the time to awaken.
Dialogue: Now then... Let us alert those sleeping in their cradles of the time to awaken.

Original: Ultimecia:Show me that same power you displayed when fighting my knight.
Dialogue: Show me that same power you displayed when fighting my knight.

Original: Ultimecia:Well... A fine display... And yet...something is lacking...
Dialogue: Well... A fine display... And yet...something is lacking...

Original: Ultimecia:Yes... The one who would connect us is absent.
Dialogue: Yes... The one who would connect us is absent.

Original: Squall:("Connect"? That's not an ability in this world, is it?)
Dialogue: ("Connect"? That's not an ability in this world, is it?)

Original: Ultimecia:However...the time draws near... The time...of awakening...
Dialogue: However...the time draws near... The time...of awakening...

Original: Ultimecia:Until we meet again...on the day of fate.
Dialogue: Until we meet again...on the day of fate.

Original: Squall:Those words... I don't want to hear that from you!
Dialogue: Those words... I don't want to hear that from you!

Original: Faris:Come off it! You needn't pursue the matter.
Dialogue: Come off it! You needn't pursue the matter.

Original: Onion Knight:...That's it!
Dialogue: ...That's it!

Original: Onion Knight:Vincent! We can open Torsions, too, right?
Dialogue: Vincent! We can open Torsions, too, right?

Original: Vincent:...We'll give chase.
Dialogue: ...We'll give chase.

Original: Balthier:You think it's as simple as opening a Torsion on her doorstep?
Dialogue: You think it's as simple as opening a Torsion on her doorstep?

Original: Vincent:Perhaps, if someone sufficiently associated does it...
Dialogue: Perhaps, if someone sufficiently associated does it...

Original: Squall:Tell me how. ...I'll open it.
Dialogue: Tell me how. ...I'll open it.

Original: Onion Knight:You did it... ...Looks like we can enter.
Dialogue: You did it... ...Looks like we can enter.

Original: Squall:Let's hurry.
Dialogue: Let's hurry.

Original: Balthier:Awfully agitated, aren't we?
Dialogue: Awfully agitated, aren't we?

Original: Squall:She isn't someone you can afford to be dispassionate about. ...I'm sure you've got your own opponent like that.
Dialogue: She isn't someone you can afford to be dispassionate about. ...I'm sure you've got your own opponent like that.

Original: Onion Knight:Let's go, guys.
Dialogue: Let's go, guys.

Original: King:I distinctly recall Mog saying Kefka and Seymour were summoned by a god called Spiritus.
Dialogue: I distinctly recall Mog saying Kefka and Seymour were summoned by a god called Spiritus.

Original: Lightning:To hear Materia tell it, you won't see any cooperation between those gods.
Dialogue: To hear Materia tell it, you won't see any cooperation between those gods.

Original: Shantotto:Honestly, what obstinate clods.
Dialogue: Honestly, what obstinate clods.

Original: Squall:(Did Spiritus summon Ultimecia, too? And for that matter...what about Seifer?)
Dialogue: (Did Spiritus summon Ultimecia, too? And for that matter...what about Seifer?)

Original: Tidus:Whoa, has someone got a grumpy face or what?
Dialogue: Whoa, has someone got a grumpy face or what?

Original: Vaan:Something on your mind?
Dialogue: Something on your mind?

Original: Squall:...Spiritus and those others from my world.
Dialogue: ...Spiritus and those others from my world.

Original: Squall:Ultimecia is a sorceress possessed by hate.
Dialogue: Ultimecia is a sorceress possessed by hate.

Original: Squall:She keeps up a cool demeanor, but there's no telling what she'll try to pull or when.
Dialogue: She keeps up a cool demeanor, but there's no telling what she'll try to pull or when.

Original: King:...She must've done something awful heinous to get you this worked up.
Dialogue: ...She must've done something awful heinous to get you this worked up.

Original: Squall:She did. Which is why I can't understand why Spiritus would summon someone like that.
Dialogue: She did. Which is why I can't understand why Spiritus would summon someone like that.

Original: Lightning:We only know about Spiritus from second-hand accounts.
Dialogue: We only know about Spiritus from second-hand accounts.

Original: Lightning:Who knows what his true intentions are?
Dialogue: Who knows what his true intentions are?

Original: Tidus:So Mog and Materia both could be lying? I can't tell who to trust anymore.
Dialogue: So Mog and Materia both could be lying? I can't tell who to trust anymore.

Original: Squall:Can you trust Seymour?
Dialogue: Can you trust Seymour?

Original: Tidus:Not a chance!
Dialogue: Not a chance!

Original: King:Then you've got no reason to trust the god who summoned him.
Dialogue: Then you've got no reason to trust the god who summoned him.

Original: Vaan:What if everything Mog's told us is a lie and he's on Spiritus's side!
Dialogue: What if everything Mog's told us is a lie and he's on Spiritus's side!

Original: Shantotto:Or he's opposed to both the gods and we're just along for the ride.
Dialogue: Or he's opposed to both the gods and we're just along for the ride.

Original: Lightning:There's no bottom to this rabbit hole once we start.
Dialogue: There's no bottom to this rabbit hole once we start.

Original: Squall:Let's focus on tracking down Ultimecia for now.
Dialogue: Let's focus on tracking down Ultimecia for now.

Original: Mog:Kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo!

Original: Mog:What a save, kupo! You really are strong!
Dialogue: What a save, kupo! You really are strong!

Original: Seifer:I did it to fulfill the sorceress's wishes, not save your sorry butt.
Dialogue: I did it to fulfill the sorceress's wishes, not save your sorry butt.

Original: Mog:Spoken like a true knight, kupo!
Dialogue: Spoken like a true knight, kupo!

Original: Seifer:...Hmph. So? Which way's the exit?
Dialogue: ...Hmph. So? Which way's the exit?

Original: Mog:That way, kupo.
Dialogue: That way, kupo.

Original: Mog:Once we get out of these caverns, Ultimecia is undoubtedly waiting to greet you, kupo!
Dialogue: Once we get out of these caverns, Ultimecia is undoubtedly waiting to greet you, kupo!

Original: Seifer:...You're able to tell where other people are, aren't you?
Dialogue: ...You're able to tell where other people are, aren't you?

Original: Mog:Just a little...kupo. If someone is deliberately hiding their will, I won't be able to find them, kupo.
