Original: Galuf:You make a good point, Jecht. The same will be true when you're a grandfather.
Dialogue: You make a good point, Jecht. The same will be true when you're a grandfather.

Original: Galuf:Grandchildren are such a joy. You'll do anything for them.
Dialogue: Grandchildren are such a joy. You'll do anything for them.

Original: Jecht:Ugh, I don't even wanna imagine it!
Dialogue: Ugh, I don't even wanna imagine it!

Original: Sabin:Haha! It sounds like you've got a lot to learn, Jecht!
Dialogue: Haha! It sounds like you've got a lot to learn, Jecht!

Original: Jecht:If you ever have kids, you'll understand!
Dialogue: If you ever have kids, you'll understand!

Original: Onion Knight:Yeah, yeah. In any case, let's get a move on.
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. In any case, let's get a move on.

Original: Vaan:I'm happy that you got your memories back and all, but is anything different now?
Dialogue: I'm happy that you got your memories back and all, but is anything different now?

Original: Paine:If I told you the whole story, it'd take days.
Dialogue: If I told you the whole story, it'd take days.

Original: Cloud:Maybe Seymour was saying things to try and stir up trouble.
Dialogue: Maybe Seymour was saying things to try and stir up trouble.

Original: Yuna:Yes. But there are still a few things I should explain.
Dialogue: Yes. But there are still a few things I should explain.

Original: Yuna:Not everything Maester Seymour said was untrue.
Dialogue: Not everything Maester Seymour said was untrue.

Original: Yuna:I had heard news about Tidus.
Dialogue: I had heard news about Tidus.

Original: Tidus:After the battle, I disappeared in front of everyone's eyes.
Dialogue: After the battle, I disappeared in front of everyone's eyes.

Original: Tidus:So Yuna went on a journey to find me.
Dialogue: So Yuna went on a journey to find me.

Original: Yuna:I suppose it is true that I did it for my own sake.
Dialogue: I suppose it is true that I did it for my own sake.

Original: Vaan:But I don't think it's as bad as Seymour made it seem.
Dialogue: But I don't think it's as bad as Seymour made it seem.

Original: Cloud:But he used that information to drive Yuna into a corner...
Dialogue: But he used that information to drive Yuna into a corner...

Original: Yuna:I think he wanted to weaken me and my friends.
Dialogue: I think he wanted to weaken me and my friends.

Original: Cloud:He tried to crush our wills by trampling on our feelings.
Dialogue: He tried to crush our wills by trampling on our feelings.

Original: Wakka:Calling me tubby sure trampled on mine...
Dialogue: Calling me tubby sure trampled on mine...

Original: Paine:Tubby.
Dialogue: Tubby.

Original: Wakka:Show some respect! I'm not tubby now!
Dialogue: Show some respect! I'm not tubby now!

Original: Yuna:Anyway, at the very end of my journey, I was able to see Tidus again.
Dialogue: Anyway, at the very end of my journey, I was able to see Tidus again.

Original: Yuna:Though I'm afraid he may still be a dream and disappear again...
Dialogue: Though I'm afraid he may still be a dream and disappear again...

Original: Paine:Everyone feels the same, even people from different worlds.
Dialogue: Everyone feels the same, even people from different worlds.

Original: Cloud:Yeah... People can vanish from your life at any time.
Dialogue: Yeah... People can vanish from your life at any time.

Original: Vaan:I don't really get it, but aren't you together now?
Dialogue: I don't really get it, but aren't you together now?

Original: Tidus:Yeah, we don't need to worry about what happens later.
Dialogue: Yeah, we don't need to worry about what happens later.

Original: Yuna:I think I'll be fine facing Maester Seymour now.
Dialogue: I think I'll be fine facing Maester Seymour now.

Original: Yuna:Because there are things I will believe and won't give up on, no matter what he tells me.
Dialogue: Because there are things I will believe and won't give up on, no matter what he tells me.

Original: Cloud:You've gotten stronger.
Dialogue: You've gotten stronger.

Original: Paine:No. This is the real Yuna.
Dialogue: No. This is the real Yuna.

Original: Vaan:By the way, why was she angry at you?
Dialogue: By the way, why was she angry at you?

Original: Tidus:...I completely forgot that I made Yuna worry.
Dialogue: ...I completely forgot that I made Yuna worry.

Original: Paine:And if you do it again, you're in for a world of hurt.
Dialogue: And if you do it again, you're in for a world of hurt.

Original: Tidus:I won't do it again, I swear!
Dialogue: I won't do it again, I swear!

Original: Vaan:Hmm... You look scary, but you're actually very nice, Paine.
Dialogue: Hmm... You look scary, but you're actually very nice, Paine.

Original: Paine:You wanna get hurt, too?
Dialogue: You wanna get hurt, too?

Original: Cloud:Quit while you're ahead. There's no helping Vaan.
Dialogue: Quit while you're ahead. There's no helping Vaan.

Original: Vaan:Hey! What's that supposed to mean!?
Dialogue: Hey! What's that supposed to mean!?

Original: Paine:What're you laughing at?
Dialogue: What're you laughing at?

Original: Yuna:The fact that you're one of us now, Paine.
Dialogue: The fact that you're one of us now, Paine.

Original: Paine:Say it clearer.
Dialogue: Say it clearer.

Original: Yuna:I'm happy we can go on another journey together!
Dialogue: I'm happy we can go on another journey together!

Original: Seymour:It seems like you've gotten your memories back.
Dialogue: It seems like you've gotten your memories back.

Original: Seymour:Now you understand what you threw away and what you gained, don't you?
Dialogue: Now you understand what you threw away and what you gained, don't you?

Original: Yuna:I haven't thrown anything away.
Dialogue: I haven't thrown anything away.

Original: Seymour:You mean to say you saved everyone on your second journey?
Dialogue: You mean to say you saved everyone on your second journey?

Original: Seymour:Or perhaps you never thought of them to begin with?
Dialogue: Or perhaps you never thought of them to begin with?

Original: Paine:Stop trying to pick a fight. We did what we could.
Dialogue: Stop trying to pick a fight. We did what we could.

Original: Seymour:Is that so? But did you not put your own desires first?
Dialogue: Is that so? But did you not put your own desires first?

Original: Seymour:Of course, that includes you...
Dialogue: Of course, that includes you...

Original: Paine:You're ticking me off.
Dialogue: You're ticking me off.

Original: Seymour:Humans cannot escape their own desires...
Dialogue: Humans cannot escape their own desires...

Original: Seymour:And should those desires conflict, a fight is inevitable.
Dialogue: And should those desires conflict, a fight is inevitable.

Original: Seymour:Certainly the Grand Summoner defeated a great evil and brought about peace.
Dialogue: Certainly the Grand Summoner defeated a great evil and brought about peace.

Original: Seymour:However, doing so uprooted Spira's values and conflict ensued.
Dialogue: However, doing so uprooted Spira's values and conflict ensued.

Original: Seymour:Humans are foolish existences that desire strife for as long as they live.
Dialogue: Humans are foolish existences that desire strife for as long as they live.

Original: Yuna:It's true that there was conflict...
Dialogue: It's true that there was conflict...

Original: Yuna:But we can stop it!
Dialogue: But we can stop it!

Original: Yuna:And even if you say that fighting is inevitable, I refuse to give up so easily.
Dialogue: And even if you say that fighting is inevitable, I refuse to give up so easily.

Original: Ace:You didn't give up...on resolving the fight...
Dialogue: You didn't give up...on resolving the fight...

Original: Onion Knight:Aren't you the one who tried to pick a fight by saying that dying is better?
Dialogue: Aren't you the one who tried to pick a fight by saying that dying is better?

Original: Yuna:It's easy to give up on resolving something and pick up a weapon.
Dialogue: It's easy to give up on resolving something and pick up a weapon.

Original: Yuna:But I can't say people who do that are fools.
Dialogue: But I can't say people who do that are fools.

Original: Yuna:Still, I don't want to give up. It's not something I will just accept!
Dialogue: Still, I don't want to give up. It's not something I will just accept!

Original: Seymour:Hahaha! What a hypocrite!
Dialogue: Hahaha! What a hypocrite!

Original: Ace:Even if she is a hypocrite, Yuna did what she set out to do.
Dialogue: Even if she is a hypocrite, Yuna did what she set out to do.

Original: Ace:If there is a path to resolution that isn't filled with violence and death...
Dialogue: If there is a path to resolution that isn't filled with violence and death...

Original: Ace:Then I want to take it!
Dialogue: Then I want to take it!

Original: Onion Knight:That's right!
Dialogue: That's right!

Original: Onion Knight:If sacrifices are made for some goal, whether it be yourself or others...
Dialogue: If sacrifices are made for some goal, whether it be yourself or others...

Original: Onion Knight:In the end...there's nothing but sadness.
Dialogue: In the end...there's nothing but sadness.

Original: Paine:Everyone stands with Yuna. We won't listen to what you have to say.
Dialogue: Everyone stands with Yuna. We won't listen to what you have to say.

Original: Seymour:So my words have no audience here...
Dialogue: So my words have no audience here...

Original: Seymour:It's no matter, as long as you face me with knowledge of your own crimes.
Dialogue: It's no matter, as long as you face me with knowledge of your own crimes.

Original: Seymour:Now, accept death as your punishment!
Dialogue: Now, accept death as your punishment!

Original: Seymour:You resort to your weapons in the end... But I cannot expect more from those already soaked in blood.
Dialogue: You resort to your weapons in the end... But I cannot expect more from those already soaked in blood.

Original: Yuna:You were the one who gave up on talking.
Dialogue: You were the one who gave up on talking.

Original: Yuna:But I can't agree with you, Seymour. I don't believe that death is salvation.
Dialogue: But I can't agree with you, Seymour. I don't believe that death is salvation.

Original: Yuna:I want to keep on living and searching for new possibilities!
Dialogue: I want to keep on living and searching for new possibilities!

Original: Seymour:So be it then... It's time for you to be judged!
Dialogue: So be it then... It's time for you to be judged!

Original: Seymour:...So my turn ends here. But now...
Dialogue: ...So my turn ends here. But now...

Original: Bartz:What!? A castle...!?
Dialogue: What!? A castle...!?

Original: Firion:Is this...the Emperor's Pandaemonium!?
Dialogue: Is this...the Emperor's Pandaemonium!?

Original: Seymour:...It will be the stage for your revenge.
Dialogue: ...It will be the stage for your revenge.

Original: Firion:The rebel army doesn't need revenge!
Dialogue: The rebel army doesn't need revenge!

Original: Seymour:You mean to say you fought with only righteous indignation? There was no resentment at having your family and hometown stolen from you?
Dialogue: You mean to say you fought with only righteous indignation? There was no resentment at having your family and hometown stolen from you?

Original: Seymour:Be honest. For what reason did you take up your sword and fight?
Dialogue: Be honest. For what reason did you take up your sword and fight?

Original: Seymour:Were not both comrades and enemies slain in the name of vengeance?
Dialogue: Were not both comrades and enemies slain in the name of vengeance?

Original: Firion:What do you know!?
Dialogue: What do you know!?

Original: Shantotto:Don't lose your cool. He's trying to play you for a fool.
Dialogue: Don't lose your cool. He's trying to play you for a fool.

Original: Yuna:Do you intend to make others miserable with your lies?
Dialogue: Do you intend to make others miserable with your lies?

Original: Seymour:Lies? What an interesting choice of words.
Dialogue: Lies? What an interesting choice of words.

Original: Seymour:I speak only the truth.
Dialogue: I speak only the truth.

Original: Yuna:You're twisting the story!
Dialogue: You're twisting the story!

Original: Seymour:You should understand my words better than anyone.
Dialogue: You should understand my words better than anyone.

Original: Seymour:...Until next we meet.
Dialogue: ...Until next we meet.

Original: Bartz:You said the Emperor, right? The one who wants to rule us?
Dialogue: You said the Emperor, right? The one who wants to rule us?

Original: Bartz:...Did he make this castle?
Dialogue: ...Did he make this castle?

Original: Mog:I sense a strong will in there, kupo...and one of Shinryu's larvae, too.
Dialogue: I sense a strong will in there, kupo...and one of Shinryu's larvae, too.

Original: Shantotto:If past experiences are any indication, the castle's keeper must be in a nearby location.
Dialogue: If past experiences are any indication, the castle's keeper must be in a nearby location.

Original: Firion:We need to defeat him! We cannot leave the Emperor to his own devices.
Dialogue: We need to defeat him! We cannot leave the Emperor to his own devices.

Original: Yuna:Let's go together. We can support you.
Dialogue: Let's go together. We can support you.

Original: Bartz:Yeah! We won't let you go alone!
Dialogue: Yeah! We won't let you go alone!

Original: Mog:It seems like it was very meticulously built. We should proceed with caution, kupo!
Dialogue: It seems like it was very meticulously built. We should proceed with caution, kupo!

Original: Irvine:Hey. What're you folks talking about?
Dialogue: Hey. What're you folks talking about?

Original: Cyan:Sir Sabin saw those two doing something rather...careless.
Dialogue: Sir Sabin saw those two doing something rather...careless.

Original: Irvine:He saw who now?
Dialogue: He saw who now?

Original: Lilisette:Serah and Snow. Even though they're engaged, they're not doing so hot...
Dialogue: Serah and Snow. Even though they're engaged, they're not doing so hot...

Original: Rem:They love each other very much. Anyone can see that.
Dialogue: They love each other very much. Anyone can see that.

Original: Penelo:But all they do is make the other worry...
Dialogue: But all they do is make the other worry...

Original: Rem:They sure aren't the only ones, though.
Dialogue: They sure aren't the only ones, though.

Original: Irvine:Ohhh, you mean Yuna and
Dialogue: Ohhh, you mean Yuna and—

Original: Freya:I think that is best left unsaid...
Dialogue: I think that is best left unsaid...

Original: Cyan:But because of his long training, Sir Sabin is unfamiliar with the nuances of gossip...
Dialogue: But because of his long training, Sir Sabin is unfamiliar with the nuances of gossip...

Original: Penelo:But it's great, isn't it? You get the feeling that they understand each other.
Dialogue: But it's great, isn't it? You get the feeling that they understand each other.

Original: Freya:Indeed. The brilliance of their honesty is a joy to behold.
Dialogue: Indeed. The brilliance of their honesty is a joy to behold.

Original: Cyan:Young, passionate love will gradually turn steadfast over time. There is nothing for us to worry about.
Dialogue: Young, passionate love will gradually turn steadfast over time. There is nothing for us to worry about.

Original: Irvine:Whoa. I never took you for that kind of person, Cyan.
Dialogue: Whoa. I never took you for that kind of person, Cyan.

Original: Penelo:Hmm? I can see what you mean...
Dialogue: Hmm? I can see what you mean...

Original: Cyan:Does not everyone have something to protect?
Dialogue: Does not everyone have something to protect?

Original: Lilisette:You're right! It'd be great to have a partner like that! The only people I seem to attract are weirdos!
Dialogue: You're right! It'd be great to have a partner like that! The only people I seem to attract are weirdos!

Original: Lilisette:But...if we're talking about special someones, I guess I might have some...
Dialogue: But...if we're talking about special someones, I guess I might have some...

Original: Freya:Everyone has someone or something worth fighting for. There is no need to put a name on it.
Dialogue: Everyone has someone or something worth fighting for. There is no need to put a name on it.

Original: Irvine:Hmm... In the end, it's love, isn't it?
Dialogue: Hmm... In the end, it's love, isn't it?

Original: Firion:...Revenge, huh.
Dialogue: ...Revenge, huh.

Original: Tidus:What's the matter?
Dialogue: What's the matter?

Original: Maria:Sorry. I was just thinking about Seymour's words... Something about it makes me uneasy.
Dialogue: Sorry. I was just thinking about Seymour's words... Something about it makes me uneasy.

Original: Tidus:You should just ignore what he said.
Dialogue: You should just ignore what he said.

Original: Edgar:It seems like your rebel army was also involved in quite the serious fight.
Dialogue: It seems like your rebel army was also involved in quite the serious fight.

Original: Maria:Yes... We lost many of our friends along the way.
Dialogue: Yes... We lost many of our friends along the way.

Original: Maria:I cannot say I did not bear any hatred for having my family taken from me, either.
Dialogue: I cannot say I did not bear any hatred for having my family taken from me, either.

Original: Maria:Still, many of my friends lost their lives because of my contempt...
Dialogue: Still, many of my friends lost their lives because of my contempt...

Original: Maria:I suppose that makes me a villain...
Dialogue: I suppose that makes me a villain...

Original: Firion:Our comrades all had their reasons for fighting. When their lives were lost, they passed those reasons onto us.
Dialogue: Our comrades all had their reasons for fighting. When their lives were lost, they passed those reasons onto us.

Original: Firion:We didn't waste their precious sacrifices.
Dialogue: We didn't waste their precious sacrifices.

Original: Maria:But those who perished will never return!
Dialogue: But those who perished will never return!

Original: Edgar:Please, calm down. I would hate to see you cry.
Dialogue: Please, calm down. I would hate to see you cry.

Original: Cait Sith:Sad as it may be, it's something you can't avoid during a revolt. It's the price you pay for trying to change something.
Dialogue: Sad as it may be, it's something you can't avoid during a revolt. It's the price you pay for trying to change something.

Original: Ashe:I guess you're right... For the powerless, there are only sacrifices.
Dialogue: I guess you're right... For the powerless, there are only sacrifices.

Original: Edgar:Don't think it's only a problem for the princess who's lost her kingdom, though.
Dialogue: Don't think it's only a problem for the princess who's lost her kingdom, though.

Original: Edgar:Even having a wielder of sealed magics on your side, there are still those who lose their lives.
Dialogue: Even having a wielder of sealed magics on your side, there are still those who lose their lives.

Original: Edgar:Even saying that it wasn't a matter of personal hatred...
Dialogue: Even saying that it wasn't a matter of personal hatred...

Original: Edgar:Those lost lives won't come back.
Dialogue: Those lost lives won't come back.

Original: Cait Sith:Far from it, those who say it's for the sake of "everyone" are the most dangerous.
Dialogue: Far from it, those who say it's for the sake of "everyone" are the most dangerous.

Original: Cait Sith:They say "everyone," but exclude people who they consider "necessary sacrifices." That drives me batty.
Dialogue: They say "everyone," but exclude people who they consider "necessary sacrifices." That drives me batty.

Original: Cait Sith:What of the sakes of those sacrificed?
Dialogue: What of the sakes of those sacrificed?

Original: Firion:I...couldn't just stand still.
Dialogue: I...couldn't just stand still.

Original: Firion:My hometown was razed to the ground, and I was saved by the rebel army...
Dialogue: My hometown was razed to the ground, and I was saved by the rebel army...

Original: Firion:But I didn't want it to end like that. I knew there was something we could do...
Dialogue: But I didn't want it to end like that. I knew there was something we could do...

Original: Firion:There was definitely hatred and sadness then.
Dialogue: There was definitely hatred and sadness then.

Original: Firion:So if someone calls it "revenge" and "selfish desire," then...there's not much I can say in return.
Dialogue: So if someone calls it "revenge" and "selfish desire," then...there's not much I can say in return.

Original: Tidus:Were you pretending to fight for everyone's sake even when it was only for yourself?
Dialogue: Were you pretending to fight for everyone's sake even when it was only for yourself?

Original: Maria:That...might not be untrue.
Dialogue: That...might not be untrue.

Original: Edgar:I understand your fear. Even I have difficulty collecting my thoughts.
Dialogue: I understand your fear. Even I have difficulty collecting my thoughts.

Original: Ashe:So you mean that, even though what you did was meant for the sake of all, in the end it may have been for your own reasons?
Dialogue: So you mean that, even though what you did was meant for the sake of all, in the end it may have been for your own reasons?

Original: Edgar:You get bound by that spell the moment you lose sight of your peoples' faces.
Dialogue: You get bound by that spell the moment you lose sight of your peoples' faces.

Original: Edgar:...It's a sad reality of royalty.
Dialogue: ...It's a sad reality of royalty.

Original: Cait Sith:But Seymour went too far. There's no point in thinking about what he said. It's just a waste of energy!
Dialogue: But Seymour went too far. There's no point in thinking about what he said. It's just a waste of energy!

Original: Tidus:That's right! You shouldn't take what he said at face value.
Dialogue: That's right! You shouldn't take what he said at face value.

Original: Firion:Right... I'll try not to.
Dialogue: Right... I'll try not to.

Original: Yuna:Is everything alright? You seem...down.
Dialogue: Is everything alright? You seem...down.

Original: Firion:I look that way even to you, Yuna? ...Tidus said the same.
Dialogue: I look that way even to you, Yuna? ...Tidus said the same.

Original: Firion:My apologies for making you worry.
Dialogue: My apologies for making you worry.

Original: Yuna:Please don't apologize.
Dialogue: Please don't apologize.

Original: Yuna:Is there anything we can do?
Dialogue: Is there anything we can do?

Original: Maria:...You're very kind.
Dialogue: ...You're very kind.

Original: Yuna:Maester Seymour was originally after me, but he dragged you into it, too.
Dialogue: Maester Seymour was originally after me, but he dragged you into it, too.

Original: Firion:I know I shouldn't listen to what he says.
Dialogue: I know I shouldn't listen to what he says.

Original: Firion:But the others have had similar experiences.
Dialogue: But the others have had similar experiences.

Original: Maria:It makes me remember the friends I've lost.
Dialogue: It makes me remember the friends I've lost.

Original: Yuna:That feeling is certainly important.
Dialogue: That feeling is certainly important.

Original: Yuna:Being mad, holding a grudge, or feeling sad...
Dialogue: Being mad, holding a grudge, or feeling sad...

Original: Yuna:You're told that not having those are better.
Dialogue: You're told that not having those are better.

Original: Yuna:...I used to believe that, so I would always show a smile.
Dialogue: ...I used to believe that, so I would always show a smile.

Original: Yuna:But I know I was wrong...
Dialogue: But I know I was wrong...

Original: Yuna:Ignoring those feelings will cause them to explode later.
Dialogue: Ignoring those feelings will cause them to explode later.

Original: Maria:I thought that those who were held by hatred were bad.
Dialogue: I thought that those who were held by hatred were bad.

Original: Yuna:But what makes a person good or bad
Dialogue: But what makes a person good or bad—

Original: Yuna:Is not what they do, but what they've done.
Dialogue: Is not what they do, but what they've done.

Original: Firion:What we did... I wonder if we could have avoided sacrifices.
Dialogue: What we did... I wonder if we could have avoided sacrifices.

Original: Yuna:But it's not like you can say, "From now on, we must do this," right?
Dialogue: But it's not like you can say, "From now on, we must do this," right?

Original: Maria:I wonder if the day will ever come where I can avoid a fight, even with sadness and regret in my heart...
Dialogue: I wonder if the day will ever come where I can avoid a fight, even with sadness and regret in my heart...

Original: Firion:Yuna, you said you fought for the sake of everyone, didn't you?
Dialogue: Yuna, you said you fought for the sake of everyone, didn't you?

Original: Yuna:My first journey was for everyone, yes.
Dialogue: My first journey was for everyone, yes.

Original: Yuna:I abandoned my own feelings.
Dialogue: I abandoned my own feelings.

Original: Yuna:But the journey I took with Paine was different. I did it for myself.
Dialogue: But the journey I took with Paine was different. I did it for myself.

Original: Yuna:...In the end, I got everyone involved, and it became another journey of saving others.
Dialogue: ...In the end, I got everyone involved, and it became another journey of saving others.

Original: Yuna:But I have no regrets.
Dialogue: But I have no regrets.

Original: Yuna:Because I learned that my own feelings are as important as those of others.
Dialogue: Because I learned that my own feelings are as important as those of others.

Original: Maria:Can those two truly coexist? Doesn't one have to be sacrificed...?
Dialogue: Can those two truly coexist? Doesn't one have to be sacrificed...?

Original: Yuna:I'm no sure, but...I've decided not to give up.
Dialogue: I'm no sure, but...I've decided not to give up.

Original: Yuna:If I accept something as inevitable and give up, I might regret not doing anything later.
Dialogue: If I accept something as inevitable and give up, I might regret not doing anything later.

Original: Firion:...You're right, Yuna.
Dialogue: ...You're right, Yuna.

Original: Maria:Seymour was trying to rile us up with his words and destroy our will to fight...
Dialogue: Seymour was trying to rile us up with his words and destroy our will to fight...

Original: Maria:Thank you for talking to us, Yuna. I feel better already.
Dialogue: Thank you for talking to us, Yuna. I feel better already.

Original: Yuna:I'm sure there are things the others can do for you, too, so don't be afraid to ask.
Dialogue: I'm sure there are things the others can do for you, too, so don't be afraid to ask.

Original: ???:Spiritus gave me a craving for power, and the Emperor took advantage of that, but...
Dialogue: Spiritus gave me a craving for power, and the Emperor took advantage of that, but...

Original: ???:No. Now is not the time for thinking. It is the time for action.
Dialogue: No. Now is not the time for thinking. It is the time for action.

Original: Mog:It looks like he made the castle using the dimensional hole this larvae made, kupo!
Dialogue: It looks like he made the castle using the dimensional hole this larvae made, kupo!

Original: Warrior of Light:Are you sure about this?
Dialogue: Are you sure about this?

Original: Firion:Yes... I think so.
Dialogue: Yes... I think so.

Original: Yuna:Shall we listen to what it has to say?
Dialogue: Shall we listen to what it has to say?

Original: Paine:...Even though it's a monster.
Dialogue: ...Even though it's a monster.

Original: Mog:Planesgorgers aren't like humans or animals, kupo. They don't move on their own will.
Dialogue: Planesgorgers aren't like humans or animals, kupo. They don't move on their own will.

Original: Papalymo:They are an independent existence, even more primitive than organisms who hunt for food.
Dialogue: They are an independent existence, even more primitive than organisms who hunt for food.

Original: Papalymo:They are akin to an object that falls when you throw it.
Dialogue: They are akin to an object that falls when you throw it.

Original: Mog:That's right, kupo! I'd like you to think about them that way.
Dialogue: That's right, kupo! I'd like you to think about them that way.

Original: Maria:They don't know good or bad...
Dialogue: They don't know good or bad...

Original: Paine:You let down your guard.
Dialogue: You let down your guard.

Original: Warrior of Light:Are there traps here? Is this the Emperor's doing!?
Dialogue: Are there traps here? Is this the Emperor's doing!?

Original: Paine:And if it is? Will you drop what's precious to you and let it break?
Dialogue: And if it is? Will you drop what's precious to you and let it break?

Original: Firion:...I don't want it to break. I want to protect it!
Dialogue: ...I don't want it to break. I want to protect it!

Original: Papalymo:Those are the eyes of determination. I will gladly lend you my strength, Firion.
Dialogue: Those are the eyes of determination. I will gladly lend you my strength, Firion.

Original: Maria:As will I. I refuse to lose anything else precious to me!
Dialogue: As will I. I refuse to lose anything else precious to me!

Original: Yuna:That's right. Everyone feels the same!
Dialogue: That's right. Everyone feels the same!

Original: Yuna:We will protect our memories, and our worlds, too!
Dialogue: We will protect our memories, and our worlds, too!

Original: Paine:Say it, Yuna.
Dialogue: Say it, Yuna.

Original: Yuna:Wh-what!? Um... How many people are there?
Dialogue: Wh-what!? Um... How many people are there?

Original: Yuna:F, M, Y, P... There's not enough time for everyone!
Dialogue: F, M, Y, P... There's not enough time for everyone!

Original: Paine:Then let's just say: everyone, in position!
Dialogue: Then let's just say everyone, in position!

Original: Yuna:It's showtime!
Dialogue: It's showtime!

Original: Yuna:Mission accomplished!
Dialogue: Mission accomplished!

Original: Yuna:...Or not?
Dialogue: ...Or not?

Original: Maria:There are no signs of Pandaemonium's collapse... Does this mean we've failed?
Dialogue: There are no signs of Pandaemonium's collapse... Does this mean we've failed?

Original: Mog:Kupo... It's a little different than that, I'm afraid!
Dialogue: Kupo... It's a little different than that, I'm afraid!

Original: Mog:This castle is steadily growing toward every dimension, kupo!
Dialogue: This castle is steadily growing toward every dimension, kupo!

Original: Mog:It's become something like a planesgorger! It's worse than I thought, kupo!
Dialogue: It's become something like a planesgorger! It's worse than I thought, kupo!

Original: Maria:Does it need the Emperor to grow?
Dialogue: Does it need the Emperor to grow?

Original: Firion:He said before that he would conquer every world using this one as a base.
Dialogue: He said before that he would conquer every world using this one as a base.

Original: Firion:...I suppose this is his base, then.
Dialogue: ...I suppose this is his base, then.

Original: Yuri:Are the possibilities of the world changing...? I get a bad feeling about this place.
Dialogue: Are the possibilities of the world changing...? I get a bad feeling about this place.

Original: Chelinka:It's not your imagination, Yuri. Order is being distorted here.
Dialogue: It's not your imagination, Yuri. Order is being distorted here.

Original: Chelinka:It's like that day we got separated fromfatherintown.
Dialogue: It's like that day we got separated from father in town.

Original: Yuri:So this has nothing to do with our power... It's the castle that's rewriting the possibilities?
Dialogue: So this has nothing to do with our power... It's the castle that's rewriting the possibilities?

Original: Chelinka:Probably... I think it's connecting this world to all other dimensions.
Dialogue: Probably... I think it's connecting this world to all other dimensions.

Original: Mog:If we don't hurry up and stop it, this castle is going to become a hole that links all the worlds, kupo!
Dialogue: If we don't hurry up and stop it, this castle is going to become a hole that links all the worlds, kupo!

Original: Yuri:There's no time to waste. Firion!
Dialogue: There's no time to waste. Firion!

Original: Firion:Let's go. We'll stop it!
Dialogue: Let's go. We'll stop it!

Original: Maria:...Do you think you can keep your composure?
Dialogue: ...Do you think you can keep your composure?

Original: Paine:You'll be fine even if you don't.
Dialogue: You'll be fine even if you don't.

Original: Yuna:Depending on who we're up against, you might be able to let it all out!
Dialogue: Depending on who we're up against, you might be able to let it all out!

Original: Chelinka:Right. Let your will be known!
Dialogue: Right. Let your will be known!

Original: Yuri:We'll help you fight!
Dialogue: We'll help you fight!

Original: Maria:...Thank you, everyone. I'm counting on you.
Dialogue: ...Thank you, everyone. I'm counting on you.

Original: The Emperor:Hmph... So the worms have squirmed all the way into my castle.
Dialogue: Hmph... So the worms have squirmed all the way into my castle.

Original: Paine:Who's this guy?
Dialogue: Who's this guy?

Original: Yuna:The Emperor. Even still, I just can't respect him.
Dialogue: The Emperor. Even still, I just can't respect him.

Original: Firion:He's the one responsible for destroying my home...
Dialogue: He's the one responsible for destroying my home...

Original: Celes:He's a man who craves dominion over all, including other worlds.
Dialogue: He's a man who craves dominion over all, including other worlds.

Original: Celes:His greed knows no bounds.
Dialogue: His greed knows no bounds.

Original: Maria:What do you intend to do after you've invaded the other worlds?
Dialogue: What do you intend to do after you've invaded the other worlds?

Original: Maria:Will you try and control them with monsters and servants as you did with us?
Dialogue: Will you try and control them with monsters and servants as you did with us?

Original: The Emperor:And if I do?
Dialogue: And if I do?

Original: The Emperor:I have no need for those who refuse to submit to my rule.
Dialogue: I have no need for those who refuse to submit to my rule.

Original: The Emperor:The lives of the insubordinate have no value to me. They are worthless and deserve to be crushed like the worms they are.
Dialogue: The lives of the insubordinate have no value to me. They are worthless and deserve to be crushed like the worms they are.

Original: Firion:Do you know just how many lives will be lost to that logic of yours!?
Dialogue: Do you know just how many lives will be lost to that logic of yours!?

Original: The Emperor:What use have I for such sentiment?
Dialogue: What use have I for such sentiment?

Original: ???:Hmph... What's wrong with sentiment?
Dialogue: Hmph... What's wrong with sentiment?

Original: ???:You have nothing to protect. No one will willingly obey the commands of someone whose only power is to take lives.
Dialogue: You have nothing to protect. No one will willingly obey the commands of someone whose only power is to take lives.

Original: ???:Sentiment has the power to save lives
Dialogue: Sentiment has the power to save lives—

Original: ???:Though it's not something I'd expect you to understand!
Dialogue: Though it's not something I'd expect you to understand!

Original: Leon:He's nothing more than a monster. I doubt we'll ever reach an agreement with him.
Dialogue: He's nothing more than a monster. I doubt we'll ever reach an agreement with him.

Original: The Emperor:I have nothing to say to traitors, and you are no different.
Dialogue: I have nothing to say to traitors, and you are no different.

Original: Leon:You may be right. Perhaps I am a traitor...
Dialogue: You may be right. Perhaps I am a traitor...

Original: Leon:But as such, I will fight you with all I have!
Dialogue: But as such, I will fight you with all I have!

Original: Celes:Allow me to join you.
Dialogue: Allow me to join you.

Original: Celes:Our enemy is the very incarnation of greed. I cannot allow this to continue.
Dialogue: Our enemy is the very incarnation of greed. I cannot allow this to continue.

Original: Paine:And you?
Dialogue: And you?

Original: Maria:I refuse to be governed by someone who doesn't listen to his people!
Dialogue: I refuse to be governed by someone who doesn't listen to his people!

Original: Firion:I will fight, too.
Dialogue: I will fight, too.

Original: Firion:Even if my sword is filled with burning rage!
Dialogue: Even if my sword is filled with burning rage!

Original: The Emperor:It is time to rid my castle of you pests... In the end, that man proved to be very useful.
Dialogue: It is time to rid my castle of you pests... In the end, that man proved to be very useful.

Original: The Emperor:Consider it an honor to be crushed by my hand!
Dialogue: Consider it an honor to be crushed by my hand!

Original: The Emperor:I haven't time to set new traps...
Dialogue: I haven't time to set new traps...

Original: The Emperor:Instead, I shall reduce everything to ash! Then I will rule all!
Dialogue: Instead, I shall reduce everything to ash! Then I will rule all!

Original: Firion:You don't care about people's feelings at all, do you!?
Dialogue: You don't care about people's feelings at all, do you!?

Original: The Emperor:Feelings are nothing more than filth nesting inside of worms.
Dialogue: Feelings are nothing more than filth nesting inside of worms.

Original: Leon:Even so, these worms will destroy the very foundation of your rule!
Dialogue: Even so, these worms will destroy the very foundation of your rule!

Original: The Emperor:Urgh... What is this...?
Dialogue: Urgh... What is this...?

Original: Tidus:What's happening to the dimensional distortion!?
Dialogue: What's happening to the dimensional distortion!?

Original: The Emperor:I see... So this was his true aim...
Dialogue: I see... So this was his true aim...

Original: The Emperor:It is as I thought. I need no other subordinates than my pawns to fulfill my goals.
Dialogue: It is as I thought. I need no other subordinates than my pawns to fulfill my goals.

Original: The Emperor:I shall build another castle.
Dialogue: I shall build another castle.

Original: Firion:Wait! We're not done here!
Dialogue: Wait! We're not done here!

Original: Yuna:Stop! It's no good pursuing him.
Dialogue: Stop! It's no good pursuing him.

Original: Ramza:Yuna's right. We need to get out of here now, or else we'll be crushed in this castle!
Dialogue: Yuna's right. We need to get out of here now, or else we'll be crushed in this castle!

Original: Leon:We must get out of here now!
Dialogue: We must get out of here now!

Original: Firion:That distortion...
Dialogue: That distortion...

Original: Leon:...Do you not trust me?
Dialogue: ...Do you not trust me?

Original: Firion:No, I trust you. Come on, everyone!
Dialogue: No, I trust you. Come on, everyone!

Original: Ramza:We're...outside the castle. In the city.
Dialogue: We're...outside the castle. In the city.

Original: Tidus:It looks like we made it out safely!
Dialogue: It looks like we made it out safely!

Original: Firion:Pandaemonium was destroyed...
Dialogue: Pandaemonium was destroyed...

Original: Yuna:Was this his aim, I wonder...
Dialogue: Was this his aim, I wonder...

Original: Tidus:I wouldn't put it past Seymour.
Dialogue: I wouldn't put it past Seymour.

Original: Ramza:They worked together for their own purposes. The Emperor with his traps and Seymour, his cunning...
Dialogue: They worked together for their own purposes. The Emperor with his traps and Seymour, his cunning...

Original: Yuna:The Emperor said that Seymour was his subordinate... I wonder if that was true.
Dialogue: The Emperor said that Seymour was his subordinate... I wonder if that was true.

Original: Firion:In any case, had we stayed in that castle, we would have been swallowed by the dimensional storm...
Dialogue: In any case, had we stayed in that castle, we would have been swallowed by the dimensional storm...

Original: Firion:If Leon hadn't rescued us...
Dialogue: If Leon hadn't rescued us...

Original: Yuna:Where did he go? Mog, do you know?
Dialogue: Where did he go? Mog, do you know?

Original: Mog:...He's fine. But it seems like he wants to be left alone for now, kupo.
Dialogue: ...He's fine. But it seems like he wants to be left alone for now, kupo.

Original: Firion:Your situation is no different.
Dialogue: Your situation is no different.

Original: Firion:Before you got your memories back, you bragged about remembering everything up until the end of your journey, didn't you?
Dialogue: Before you got your memories back, you bragged about remembering everything up until the end of your journey, didn't you?

Original: Tidus:Trying to explain it now is...complicated.
Dialogue: Trying to explain it now is...complicated.

Original: Prishe:Everyone has their own circumstances. There must be a lot going on inside of you, too.
Dialogue: Everyone has their own circumstances. There must be a lot going on inside of you, too.

Original: Tidus:But I'm here.
Dialogue: But I'm here.

Original: Prishe:Oh! Then that's enough. Let's go back to the airship!
Dialogue: Oh! Then that's enough. Let's go back to the airship!

Original: Yuna:We defeated the planesgorger and got the brilliance!
Dialogue: We defeated the planesgorger and got the brilliance!

Original: Yuna:We'll start our search for more brilliance once the airship lands!
Dialogue: We'll start our search for more brilliance once the airship lands!

Original: Mog:It seems like neither the Emperor nor Seymour are here, kupo.
Dialogue: It seems like neither the Emperor nor Seymour are here, kupo.

Original: Mog:Pandaemonium also stopped growing and this area seems to have stabilized, kupo!
Dialogue: Pandaemonium also stopped growing and this area seems to have stabilized, kupo!

Original: Firion:The castle ruins... the scars still remain...
Dialogue: The castle ruins... the scars still remain...

Original: Tifa:Are you okay, Firion?
Dialogue: Are you okay, Firion?

Original: Firion:I couldn't suppress my hatred for the Emperor...
Dialogue: I couldn't suppress my hatred for the Emperor...

Original: Firion:I should have known nothing good would come if I wielded my sword with those emotions in my heart...
Dialogue: I should have known nothing good would come if I wielded my sword with those emotions in my heart...

Original: Firion:...I lost my composure.
Dialogue: ...I lost my composure.

Original: Tifa:But isn't he the one who destroyed your home? ...I think it's impossible not to hate him for what he's done.
Dialogue: But isn't he the one who destroyed your home? ...I think it's impossible not to hate him for what he's done.

Original: Cecil:I think everyone understands how you feel.
Dialogue: I think everyone understands how you feel.

Original: Cecil:I myself donned the name of a paladin and fought my enemies with hatred.
Dialogue: I myself donned the name of a paladin and fought my enemies with hatred.

Original: Cecil:Though I claimed to fight for justice, I could not say that negative emotions did not exist within me.
Dialogue: Though I claimed to fight for justice, I could not say that negative emotions did not exist within me.

Original: Yuna:Pain and hatred... They're part of your emotions.
Dialogue: Pain and hatred... They're part of your emotions.

Original: Yuna:The worst thing you can do is suppress them.
Dialogue: The worst thing you can do is suppress them.

Original: Zack:You shouldn't lie about your feelings. But you shouldn't be held captive by them, either.
Dialogue: You shouldn't lie about your feelings. But you shouldn't be held captive by them, either.

Original: Zack:Look at them from a distance. It'll help you see what's really important.
Dialogue: Look at them from a distance. It'll help you see what's really important.

Original: Firion:I...see. I can't keep looking down.
Dialogue: I...see. I can't keep looking down.

Original: Paine:We're leaving.
Dialogue: We're leaving.

Original: Firion:You're driving, Paine?
Dialogue: You're driving, Paine?

Original: Yuna:Well, she did mention wanting to fly an airship back home.
Dialogue: Well, she did mention wanting to fly an airship back home.

Original: Paine:We don't have time for chitchat. Get on.
Dialogue: We don't have time for chitchat. Get on.

Original: Yuna:Over here, Paine! We'll get on right away!
Dialogue: Over here, Paine! We'll get on right away!

Original: Paine:Who's the captain around here?
Dialogue: Who's the captain around here?

Original: Yuna:Umm... Everyone?
Dialogue: Umm... Everyone?

Original: Paine:What a weird world.
Dialogue: What a weird world.

Original: Yuna:But that's fine with me!
Dialogue: But that's fine with me!

Original: Yuna:Fly safely now!
Dialogue: Fly safely now!

Original: Mog:Some people misunderstand, but Materia and Spiritus are both very important gods to this world, kupo.
Dialogue: Some people misunderstand, but Materia and Spiritus are both very important gods to this world, kupo.

Original: Yuna:Do they hate each other?
Dialogue: Do they hate each other?

Original: Mog:Yes. But it wasn't always like that, kupo.
Dialogue: Yes. But it wasn't always like that, kupo.

Original: Mog:Now they both claim that this is their world and won't make any compromises, kupo.
Dialogue: Now they both claim that this is their world and won't make any compromises, kupo.

Original: Lightning:But if they manipulated our memories to make us fight, they'll pay for it.
Dialogue: But if they manipulated our memories to make us fight, they'll pay for it.

Original: Mog:Materia can be...insensitive sometimes, kupo.
Dialogue: Materia can be...insensitive sometimes, kupo.

Original: Mog:She governs matter, but doesn't know how to deal with people's emotions, kupo.
Dialogue: She governs matter, but doesn't know how to deal with people's emotions, kupo.

Original: Yuna:That certainly sounds...insensitive.
Dialogue: That certainly sounds...insensitive.

Original: Lightning:And it was that Materia's idea of "respite" that we were thrown into...
Dialogue: And it was that Materia's idea of "respite" that we were thrown into...

Original: Mog:She's an important entity to this world. But Mog is...kupo.
Dialogue: She's an important entity to this world. But Mog is...kupo.

Original: Mog:I don't want to make you push yourselves or fight anymore, kupo.
Dialogue: I don't want to make you push yourselves or fight anymore, kupo.

Original: Mog:If you can't accept their decisions, you should say something to them, kupo.
Dialogue: If you can't accept their decisions, you should say something to them, kupo.

Original: Yuna:I feel like they may not want to hear us out, though.
Dialogue: I feel like they may not want to hear us out, though.

Original: Lightning:There's also a chance they don't understand the meaning of our questions.
Dialogue: There's also a chance they don't understand the meaning of our questions.

Original: Mog:Spiritus governs the mind, so he's quite keen on emotions, kupo. I don't recommend talking to him directly.
Dialogue: Spiritus governs the mind, so he's quite keen on emotions, kupo. I don't recommend talking to him directly.

Original: Yuna:Do you think he'll try to win us over?
Dialogue: Do you think he'll try to win us over?

Original: Mog:If that's all, that would be fine, kupo. He might say he only chooses strong warriors... But there's really no telling what he'll do.
Dialogue: If that's all, that would be fine, kupo. He might say he only chooses strong warriors... But there's really no telling what he'll do.

Original: Lightning:My head hurts...!
Dialogue: My head hurts...!

Original: Yuna:I'll try to think of a nice way to lodge my complaints.
Dialogue: I'll try to think of a nice way to lodge my complaints.

Original: Noel:I was the only person left in the world. I was all alone.
Dialogue: I was the only person left in the world. I was all alone.

Original: Noel:But I went on a journey of hope, believing I could change the future.
Dialogue: But I went on a journey of hope, believing I could change the future.

Original: Noel:Then the goddess of my world gave me a chance.
Dialogue: Then the goddess of my world gave me a chance.

Original: Noel:A chance to go back in time and change the future.
Dialogue: A chance to go back in time and change the future.

Original: ???:Noel Kreiss... You pitiful little boy...
Dialogue: Noel Kreiss... You pitiful little boy...

Original: ???:All that awaited you was tragedy.
Dialogue: All that awaited you was tragedy.

Original: Noel:I heard that I could find Serah in this world.
Dialogue: I heard that I could find Serah in this world.

Original: Noel:I thought I could protect her for sure this time, but...
Dialogue: I thought I could protect her for sure this time, but...

Original: ???:The goddess Materia has abandoned you.
Dialogue: The goddess Materia has abandoned you.

Original: ???:You will wander the desert forever.
Dialogue: You will wander the desert forever.

Original: Noel:If you hadn't been here, I might have given up this time.
Dialogue: If you hadn't been here, I might have given up this time.

Original: ???:You possess a strong heart. I am just a voice to keep you company.
Dialogue: You possess a strong heart. I am just a voice to keep you company.

Original: Noel:You really won't show me what you look like?
Dialogue: You really won't show me what you look like?

Original: ???:My visage is truly abominable. You will certainly become my enemy...
Dialogue: My visage is truly abominable. You will certainly become my enemy...

Original: Noel:But you're kind. We wouldn't be enemies.
Dialogue: But you're kind. We wouldn't be enemies.

Original: ???:...That is my destiny.
Dialogue: ...That is my destiny.

Original: ???:More importantly...
Dialogue: More importantly...

Original: Noel:Wh-what is this...!? A town!?
Dialogue: Wh-what is this...!? A town!?

Original: ???:An empty city... No doubt the doings of that broken buffoon.
Dialogue: An empty city... No doubt the doings of that broken buffoon.

Original: Noel:Am I...still alone?
Dialogue: Am I...still alone?

Original: ???:It does not matter if you stop walking. You need not become that irresponsible goddess's puppet.
Dialogue: It does not matter if you stop walking. You need not become that irresponsible goddess's puppet.

Original: Noel:You might be right, but...I want to go a little further.
Dialogue: You might be right, but...I want to go a little further.

Original: Noel:She asked me to help her, so...I believe her.
Dialogue: She asked me to help her, so...I believe her.

Original: Noel:I'm sure I'll meet her.
Dialogue: I'm sure I'll meet her.

Original: Noel:Even in this empty world.
Dialogue: Even in this empty world.

Original: Noel:And then this time, for sure...
Dialogue: And then this time, for sure...

Original: Mog:Is there really something here, kupo?
Dialogue: Is there really something here, kupo?

Original: Terra:You don't sense anything, Mog?
Dialogue: You don't sense anything, Mog?

Original: Locke:That doesn't sound good, now does it?
Dialogue: That doesn't sound good, now does it?

Original: Noct:Huh? Well... If you guys think something's up, I guess there must be.
Dialogue: Huh? Well... If you guys think something's up, I guess there must be.

Original: Setzer:I have nothing but bad memories of this town.
Dialogue: I have nothing but bad memories of this town.

Original: Setzer:The goddess said that this world was meant to be a respite for us, and yet...
Dialogue: The goddess said that this world was meant to be a respite for us, and yet...

Original: Terra:There's no respite for my heart here.
Dialogue: There's no respite for my heart here.

Original: Alisaie:Meaning this place might be yet another summoned by the enemy.
Dialogue: Meaning this place might be yet another summoned by the enemy.

Original: Mog:Kupo... You might be right. But, but...!
Dialogue: Kupo... You might be right. But, but...!

Original: Mog:I can't sense any brilliance or larvae around!
Dialogue: I can't sense any brilliance or larvae around!

Original: Lilisette:How weird... That doesn't usually happen, does it?
Dialogue: How weird... That doesn't usually happen, does it?

Original: Mog:I don't know, kupo... Maybe something's wrong with my pompom?
Dialogue: I don't know, kupo... Maybe something's wrong with my pompom?

Original: Locke:What do you think?
Dialogue: What do you think?

Original: Setzer:This may be a dangerous gamble, but we can't just leave it like this.
Dialogue: This may be a dangerous gamble, but we can't just leave it like this.

Original: Terra:Please, Mog, let us pass through here.
Dialogue: Please, Mog, let us pass through here.

Original: Locke:We might just find some treasure, too!
Dialogue: We might just find some treasure, too!

Original: Alisaie:If you believe it worth the risk, I shall follow. This is an unknown world, after all.
Dialogue: If you believe it worth the risk, I shall follow. This is an unknown world, after all.

Original: Setzer:Hey, Prince. If you've got something to say, now's the time.
Dialogue: Hey, Prince. If you've got something to say, now's the time.

Original: Noct:I've got nothing. I'll leave it up to you guys.
Dialogue: I've got nothing. I'll leave it up to you guys.

Original: Noct:...Wait. "Prince"? I don't remember telling you guys that.
Dialogue: ...Wait. "Prince"? I don't remember telling you guys that.

Original: Setzer:Haha! I thought you were just some spoiled kid, but it turns out you really are a prince.
Dialogue: Haha! I thought you were just some spoiled kid, but it turns out you really are a prince.

Original: Setzer:We're not on vacation, so stop staring. There's no one to babysit you here.
Dialogue: We're not on vacation, so stop staring. There's no one to babysit you here.

Original: Noct:What? I'm not staring! ...I'll leave if I'm in the way, though.
Dialogue: What? I'm not staring! ...I'll leave if I'm in the way, though.

Original: Mog:Don't go, kupo! We've got strength in numbers!
Dialogue: Don't go, kupo! We've got strength in numbers!

Original: Mog:It doesn't matter if you're highborn or a high roller! We can all work together!
Dialogue: It doesn't matter if you're highborn or a high roller! We can all work together!

Original: Locke:Just call him what he is: a gambler. Anyway, I'm with you, Mog.
Dialogue: Just call him what he is a gambler. Anyway, I'm with you, Mog.

Original: Terra:Yes! I agree!
Dialogue: Yes! I agree!

Original: Locke:There's no need to be so anxious. It's hard to keep our eyes on the prize if we're all worked up like this.
Dialogue: There's no need to be so anxious. It's hard to keep our eyes on the prize if we're all worked up like this.

Original: Alisaie:Let's take a moment to calm ourselves before moving forward.
Dialogue: Let's take a moment to calm ourselves before moving forward.

Original: Setzer:Yet another noble, I suspect...
Dialogue: Yet another noble, I suspect...

Original: Setzer:My apologies. I had no intention of prying.
Dialogue: My apologies. I had no intention of prying.

Original: Noct:Don't worry about it. Let's just find some good treasure and get out of here.
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. Let's just find some good treasure and get out of here.

Original: Setzer:Good grief... Yet another treasure hunter added to our ranks.
Dialogue: Good grief... Yet another treasure hunter added to our ranks.

Original: Paine:...What a lively bunch.
Dialogue: ...What a lively bunch.

Original: Paine:Who're you!?
Dialogue: Who're you!?

Original: Noel:Are you human...? A real human!?
Dialogue: Are you human...? A real human!?

Original: Celes:Identify yourself!
Dialogue: Identify yourself!

Original: Serah:Are you okay, Celes? You sound like a soldier...
Dialogue: Are you okay, Celes? You sound like a soldier...

Original: Celes:Apologies... I mean, I'm sorry. It happens unintentionally sometimes.
Dialogue: Apologies... I mean, I'm sorry. It happens unintentionally sometimes.

Original: Locke:What did you find, Paine?
Dialogue: What did you find, Paine?

Original: Paine:Not what, but who.
Dialogue: Not what, but who.

Original: Noel:Serah... What a relief.
Dialogue: Serah... What a relief.

Original: Serah:Noel!? Is that really you!?
Dialogue: Noel!? Is that really you!?

Original: Mog:A friend of yours, kupo? I couldn't sense him at all!
Dialogue: A friend of yours, kupo? I couldn't sense him at all!

Original: Noel:I'm here... Finally...
Dialogue: I'm here... Finally...

Original: Celes:Call a healer, stat!
Dialogue: Call a healer, stat!

Original: Paine:...She's from the military, isn't she?
Dialogue: ...She's from the military, isn't she?

Original: Locke:She's really straining herself here, though I doubt she's noticed it quite yet...
Dialogue: She's really straining herself here, though I doubt she's noticed it quite yet...

Original: Serah:Noel... What happened to you...?
Dialogue: Noel... What happened to you...?

Original: Eiko:You should be alright now! You were really exhausted.
Dialogue: You should be alright now! You were really exhausted.

Original: Noel:Thanks. Um... Are you all warriors of Materia?
Dialogue: Thanks. Um... Are you all warriors of Materia?

Original: Locke:That's right. Everyone here is on the same team.
Dialogue: That's right. Everyone here is on the same team.

Original: Celes:You're a friend of Serah, right? Have you met Materia?
Dialogue: You're a friend of Serah, right? Have you met Materia?

Original: Noel:I met her a long time ago. After that, I was wandering this huge world...
Dialogue: I met her a long time ago. After that, I was wandering this huge world...

Original: Mog:Kupo? You mean Materia didn't show you the way to us?
Dialogue: Kupo? You mean Materia didn't show you the way to us?

Original: Noel:She opened up a portal, but it led to an empty desert.
Dialogue: She opened up a portal, but it led to an empty desert.

Original: Noel:I've been alone since then. I've been searching for you guys for ages.
Dialogue: I've been alone since then. I've been searching for you guys for ages.

Original: Serah:How long is that?
Dialogue: How long is that?

Original: Noel:I don't know. It could have been days, months... No, years even.
Dialogue: I don't know. It could have been days, months... No, years even.

Original: Locke:From the looks of it, you seem like a formidable swordsman. Would Materia really let someone so strong just lose their way like that?
Dialogue: From the looks of it, you seem like a formidable swordsman. Would Materia really let someone so strong just lose their way like that?

Original: Mog:That really is strange, kupo! You have a really strong will!
Dialogue: That really is strange, kupo! You have a really strong will!

Original: Mog:Wills are drawn to each other, kupo.
Dialogue: Wills are drawn to each other, kupo.

Original: Mog:Even if you get lost for a little while, you should have been able to meet up with us or Spiritus's warriors in no time, kupo!
Dialogue: Even if you get lost for a little while, you should have been able to meet up with us or Spiritus's warriors in no time, kupo!

Original: Celes:If that's the way this world works, then...why was he lost for so long?
Dialogue: If that's the way this world works, then...why was he lost for so long?

Original: Eiko:Were you lonely? It must have been tough out there...
Dialogue: Were you lonely? It must have been tough out there...

Original: Noel:It's no big deal. I'm used to it.
Dialogue: It's no big deal. I'm used to it.

Original: Eiko:Used to being alone? You're just like me.
Dialogue: Used to being alone? You're just like me.

Original: Serah:Not quite.
Dialogue: Not quite.

Original: Noel:Yes. I was the last survivor. In my time, the entire world was destroyed.
Dialogue: Yes. I was the last survivor. In my time, the entire world was destroyed.

Original: Celes:So you were theonly onein adesolate world...
Dialogue: So you were the only one in a desolate world...

Original: Noel:It's fine. I went on a journey with Serah in order to change that future.
Dialogue: It's fine. I went on a journey with Serah in order to change that future.

Original: Locke:Is it alright for you to come with us?
Dialogue: Is it alright for you to come with us?

Original: Noel:Of course. I'm a great hunter. There's no prey I can't catch.
Dialogue: Of course. I'm a great hunter. There's no prey I can't catch.

Original: Locke:Perfect. Let's move out, then!
Dialogue: Perfect. Let's move out, then!

Original: Serah:Are you alright, Noel?
Dialogue: Are you alright, Noel?

Original: Noel:I'm fine...
Dialogue: I'm fine...

Original: Noel:What about you, Serah?
Dialogue: What about you, Serah?

Original: Serah:I'm doing just fine.
Dialogue: I'm doing just fine.

Original: Serah:My sister, Snow, Hope, and the others are here, too.
Dialogue: My sister, Snow, Hope, and the others are here, too.

Original: Noel:Sounds like fun. You get to fight beside them now.
Dialogue: Sounds like fun. You get to fight beside them now.

Original: Serah:Noel... He's pushing himself. I wonder what happened while he was lost...
Dialogue: Noel... He's pushing himself. I wonder what happened while he was lost...

Original: Lightning:So you were abused by this world's goddess, too... How unfortunate.
Dialogue: So you were abused by this world's goddess, too... How unfortunate.

Original: Noel:Is Materia really so careless?
Dialogue: Is Materia really so careless?

Original: Cyan:She has regrettably little understanding of human emotions.
Dialogue: She has regrettably little understanding of human emotions.

Original: Edgar:Even so, I think she went a bit too far with Noel.
Dialogue: Even so, I think she went a bit too far with Noel.

Original: Bartz:Yeah. When I regained consciousness, I was already here, but I met up with the group right after.
Dialogue: Yeah. When I regained consciousness, I was already here, but I met up with the group right after.

Original: Lightning:Were you really alone the whole time?
Dialogue: Were you really alone the whole time?

Original: Noel:Well...I didn't meet any living human beings.
Dialogue: Well...I didn't meet any living human beings.

Original: Cyan:It must have taken great mental fortitude to last so long without anyone around.
Dialogue: It must have taken great mental fortitude to last so long without anyone around.

Original: Noel:I heard a voice, though. It spoke to me.
Dialogue: I heard a voice, though. It spoke to me.

Original: Onion Knight:A voice? Are you sure it wasn't a hallucination?
Dialogue: A voice? Are you sure it wasn't a hallucination?

Original: Noel:If it were, I think I would have broken long ago.
Dialogue: If it were, I think I would have broken long ago.

Original: Lightning:I know you. You don't look broken.
Dialogue: I know you. You don't look broken.

Original: Lightning:Someone was there with you. They must have hidden their presence and talked to you.
Dialogue: Someone was there with you. They must have hidden their presence and talked to you.

Original: Bartz:So someone was there! What did you talk about?
Dialogue: So someone was there! What did you talk about?

Original: Noel:All kinds of things. This world. Trivial things, too...
Dialogue: All kinds of things. This world. Trivial things, too...

Original: Noel:And... The future that awaits me in this place...
Dialogue: And... The future that awaits me in this place...

Original: ???:Even so...you will continue walking?
Dialogue: Even so...you will continue walking?

Original: Noel:Yes. As long as I don't give up, there's still hope.
Dialogue: Yes. As long as I don't give up, there's still hope.

Original: ???:A lonely child... You're just like me: destined for destruction.
Dialogue: A lonely child... You're just like me destined for destruction.

Original: Noel:Are you alone, too?
Dialogue: Are you alone, too?

Original: ???:Yes. As I've always been.
Dialogue: Yes. As I've always been.

Original: ???:It is my nature to be forgotten.
Dialogue: It is my nature to be forgotten.

Original: ???:From long, long ago...it's been my fate to be alone.
Dialogue: From long, long ago...it's been my fate to be alone.

Original: Noel:But it's different in this world, isn't it? Can't you talk to me face-to-face?
Dialogue: But it's different in this world, isn't it? Can't you talk to me face-to-face?

Original: ???:I am a symbol of terror and hatred... People fear me...
Dialogue: I am a symbol of terror and hatred... People fear me...

Original: ???:If you looked at me, you would fear me, too.
Dialogue: If you looked at me, you would fear me, too.

Original: Noel:It doesn't matter what you look like. I know you're a nice person.
Dialogue: It doesn't matter what you look like. I know you're a nice person.

Original: ???:Haha... You're very kind.
Dialogue: Haha... You're very kind.

Original: ???:I cannot show myself to you, but I can still talk to you.
Dialogue: I cannot show myself to you, but I can still talk to you.

Original: ???:Now let me hear your story...
Dialogue: Now let me hear your story...

Original: Noel:Well, my journey and its end...
Dialogue: Well, my journey and its end...

Original: Bartz:It sounds like you had a friendly companion. But why didn't they want to show you what they looked like?
Dialogue: It sounds like you had a friendly companion. But why didn't they want to show you what they looked like?

Original: Onion Knight:Isn't that suspicious? Are you supposed to be grateful for that?
Dialogue: Isn't that suspicious? Are you supposed to be grateful for that?

Original: Noel:I don't know. I don't know what the voice wanted or why it chose me.
Dialogue: I don't know. I don't know what the voice wanted or why it chose me.

Original: Cyan:Nevertheless, simple words can become one's hope.
Dialogue: Nevertheless, simple words can become one's hope.

Original: Cyan:For Sir Noel, that voice may have been the only reason he made it through the desert.
Dialogue: For Sir Noel, that voice may have been the only reason he made it through the desert.

Original: Lightning:I won't deny whatever "hope" you have, but remember this--
Dialogue: I won't deny whatever "hope" you have, but remember this--

Original: Lightning:In this world, there are warriors of Materia and warriors of Spiritus.
Dialogue: In this world, there are warriors of Materia and warriors of Spiritus.

Original: Onion Knight:Many of Spiritus's warriors are our enemies.
Dialogue: Many of Spiritus's warriors are our enemies.

Original: Edgar:What they mean to say is that if someone is not your ally, then you should think of them as your enemy here.
Dialogue: What they mean to say is that if someone is not your ally, then you should think of them as your enemy here.

Original: Noel:...I see. It would be great if they were our ally, though.
Dialogue: ...I see. It would be great if they were our ally, though.

Original: Cyan:Perhaps thou were too harsh... He is still just a boy, is he not?
Dialogue: Perhaps thou were too harsh... He is still just a boy, is he not?

Original: Lightning:He may be mistaking this woman's voice for his mother...
Dialogue: He may be mistaking this woman's voice for his mother...

Original: Onion Knight:It's best he prepare for the worst.
Dialogue: It's best he prepare for the worst.

Original: Onion Knight:I don't recall any of our allies talking to him before he joined us.
Dialogue: I don't recall any of our allies talking to him before he joined us.

Original: Edgar:Indeed. The voice belongs to someone unknown. We should be on our guard.
Dialogue: Indeed. The voice belongs to someone unknown. We should be on our guard.

Original: Zack:Hey, Noel!
Dialogue: Hey, Noel!

Original: Zell:We heard you know how to hunt! Teach us!
Dialogue: We heard you know how to hunt! Teach us!

Original: Lightning:He's usually very cheerful. I think they'll get along just fine.
Dialogue: He's usually very cheerful. I think they'll get along just fine.

Original: Noct:I wonder if I could make a call...
Dialogue: I wonder if I could make a call...

Original: Noct:Then again...I'd have nothing to say. I don't even know how to get back...
Dialogue: Then again...I'd have nothing to say. I don't even know how to get back...

Original: Noel:Is this a bad time?
Dialogue: Is this a bad time?

Original: Noct:Not at all.
Dialogue: Not at all.

Original: Noct:Are you taking a break, too? Why don't we sit there?
Dialogue: Are you taking a break, too? Why don't we sit there?

Original: Noel:Actually, I wanted to go hunting. But I couldn't find any big prey here in town...
Dialogue: Actually, I wanted to go hunting. But I couldn't find any big prey here in town...

Original: Noel:Or is it just that this world doesn't have anything to hunt?
Dialogue: Or is it just that this world doesn't have anything to hunt?

Original: Noct:No, we've even hunted behemoth before.
Dialogue: No, we've even hunted behemoth before.

Original: Noel:Behemoth!? Can you eat those!?
Dialogue: Behemoth!? Can you eat those!?

Original: Noct:You eat them in your world?
Dialogue: You eat them in your world?

Original: Noel:In my time, people did. But it might be different for Serah and the others.
Dialogue: In my time, people did. But it might be different for Serah and the others.

Original: Noel:The monsters didn't look very edible there, though.
Dialogue: The monsters didn't look very edible there, though.

Original: Noct:Yeah, I guess there weren't many of those.
Dialogue: Yeah, I guess there weren't many of those.

Original: Noel:You dress like Lightning and the others, so I thought you might be from their time.
Dialogue: You dress like Lightning and the others, so I thought you might be from their time.

Original: Noel:Sorry if I was wrong. Are you a hunter, too?
Dialogue: Sorry if I was wrong. Are you a hunter, too?

Original: Noct:Yeah. It's a part-time-- Well, a way to make money.
Dialogue: Yeah. It's a part-time-- Well, a way to make money.

Original: Noct:And a way to gather ingredients for dinner.
Dialogue: And a way to gather ingredients for dinner.

Original: Noel:Same here.
Dialogue: Same here.

Original: Noct:But I specialize in hunting.
Dialogue: But I specialize in hunting.

Original: Noel:When I said adamantoise was delicious, Serah looked so surprised. So I think I understand.
Dialogue: When I said adamantoise was delicious, Serah looked so surprised. So I think I understand.

Original: Noct:You managed to catch one of those turtles? Impressive.
Dialogue: You managed to catch one of those turtles? Impressive.

Original: Noel:Have you ever tried it? If not, let's snag one here.
Dialogue: Have you ever tried it? If not, let's snag one here.

Original: Noel:Yeah. Let's give it a try next time.
Dialogue: Yeah. Let's give it a try next time.

Original: Noel:Your name is Noctis, right? I think you can do it.
Dialogue: Your name is Noctis, right? I think you can do it.

Original: Noct:Alright. If you're sure.
Dialogue: Alright. If you're sure.

Original: Noct:What was your name again?
Dialogue: What was your name again?

Original: Noel:Noel. Noel Kreiss. I guess I forgot to introduce myself...
Dialogue: Noel. Noel Kreiss. I guess I forgot to introduce myself...

Original: Noct:I probably just never asked. I won't forget it, though.
Dialogue: I probably just never asked. I won't forget it, though.

Original: Noct:And...you can call me Noct.
Dialogue: And...you can call me Noct.

Original: Noct:Our group is pretty big, but...they're all good people. There are some you'd get along with for sure.
Dialogue: Our group is pretty big, but...they're all good people. There are some you'd get along with for sure.

Original: Noel:I have no doubt about it!
Dialogue: I have no doubt about it!

Original: Noel:Well, let's get going, Noct! The others are waiting!
Dialogue: Well, let's get going, Noct! The others are waiting!

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):Am I...the only one...conscious...?
Dialogue: Am I...the only one...conscious...?

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):Someone... The warriors from the World of Light...
Dialogue: Someone... The warriors from the World of Light...

Original: Sabin:A dark manikin of Edgar? What happened!?
Dialogue: A dark manikin of Edgar? What happened!?

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):...Thank goodness. Please...gather the others.
Dialogue: ...Thank goodness. Please...gather the others.

Original: Sabin:They'll be here soon!
Dialogue: They'll be here soon!

Original: Noel:...He looks like he'll disappear any second now.
Dialogue: ...He looks like he'll disappear any second now.

Original: Locke:What happened? Who did this to you!?
Dialogue: What happened? Who did this to you!?

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):It was...Kefka.
Dialogue: It was...Kefka.

Original: Warrior of Light:Kefka...? Just what is he planning?
Dialogue: Kefka...? Just what is he planning?

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):There's something I need to tell you... But not now.
Dialogue: There's something I need to tell you... But not now.

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):There's something planted in us...
Dialogue: There's something planted in us...

Original: Sabin:What's happening to our manikins from the World of Darkness?
Dialogue: What's happening to our manikins from the World of Darkness?

Original: Noel:It's no good. They're not themselves anymore...
Dialogue: It's no good. They're not themselves anymore...

Original: Locke:What!? You mean they're being controlled!?
Dialogue: What!? You mean they're being controlled!?

Original: Noel:I'm not sure. I can see something black...
Dialogue: I'm not sure. I can see something black...

Original: Warrior of Light:...There's darkness inside of them.
Dialogue: ...There's darkness inside of them.

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):There's a dark impulse...overflowing from inside.
Dialogue: There's a dark impulse...overflowing from inside.

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):Warriors from the World of Light. Please, stop us. No matter what it takes.
Dialogue: Warriors from the World of Light. Please, stop us. No matter what it takes.

Original: Locke:But you've still got control of yourself!
Dialogue: But you've still got control of yourself!

Original: Sabin:He's right! You're still my brother--
Dialogue: He's right! You're still my brother--

Original: Sabin:Smart and calm and considerate of everyone...
Dialogue: Smart and calm and considerate of everyone...

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):It is out of consideration for others that I ask you to destroy us now.
Dialogue: It is out of consideration for others that I ask you to destroy us now.

Original: Warrior of Light:...We have no choice but to grant his wish.
Dialogue: ...We have no choice but to grant his wish.

Original: Noel:I agree. And if we're lucky, they'll come to their senses soon enough.
Dialogue: I agree. And if we're lucky, they'll come to their senses soon enough.

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):There's no need to take pity on us.
Dialogue: There's no need to take pity on us.

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):Please, destroy this abominable feeling...!
Dialogue: Please, destroy this abominable feeling...!

Original: Sabin:Big brother...!
Dialogue: Big brother...!

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):Please, stop us before it's too late.
Dialogue: Please, stop us before it's too late.

Original: Sabin:Ngh...! It looks like we have no choice!
Dialogue: Ngh...! It looks like we have no choice!

Original: Edgar:Yes, it certainly seems that way. Focus, Sabin!
Dialogue: Yes, it certainly seems that way. Focus, Sabin!

Original: Sabin:...You got it, big brother!
Dialogue: ...You got it, big brother!

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):The remnants of the Blackened Will...are out of control!
Dialogue: The remnants of the Blackened Will...are out of control!

Original: Celes:Look! The dark manikins' bodies are...!
Dialogue: Look! The dark manikins' bodies are...!

Original: Edgar:What happened? Do you have time to explain?
Dialogue: What happened? Do you have time to explain?

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):...Yes, but not much...
Dialogue: ...Yes, but not much...

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):Listen, warriors of the World of Light...
Dialogue: Listen, warriors of the World of Light...

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):We were captured by Kefka and put into a medium meant to create something...
Dialogue: We were captured by Kefka and put into a medium meant to create something...

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):He called it the Blackened Will.
Dialogue: He called it the Blackened Will.

Original: Terra:The Blackened Will... Isn't thatwhat possessed Mog before?
Dialogue: The Blackened Will... Isn't that what possessed Mog before?

Original: Mog:Kupo!? But the Blackened Will takes time to be born, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo!? But the Blackened Will takes time to be born, kupo!

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):...Indeed. In order for any of us to become its incubator, a certain aptitude was necessary.
Dialogue: ...Indeed. In order for any of us to become its incubator, a certain aptitude was necessary.

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):But we weren't suitable... We couldn't propagate the Blackened Will.
Dialogue: But we weren't suitable... We couldn't propagate the Blackened Will.

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):But... Celes and Terra from the World of Darkness...
Dialogue: But... Celes and Terra from the World of Darkness...

Original: Locke:Their dark manikins are still prisoners!?
Dialogue: Their dark manikins are still prisoners!?

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):Yes. They were implanted with the Blackened Will, and it continues to absorb their magic.
Dialogue: Yes. They were implanted with the Blackened Will, and it continues to absorb their magic.

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):In time, they will give birth to evil...
Dialogue: In time, they will give birth to evil...

Original: Celes:So Kefka's trying to create that monster with his inhumane experiments...
Dialogue: So Kefka's trying to create that monster with his inhumane experiments...

Original: Locke:My dark manikin isn't here, either. Was he defeated?
Dialogue: My dark manikin isn't here, either. Was he defeated?

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):No... He stayed to protect them.
Dialogue: No... He stayed to protect them.

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):Even without emotions, we can't seem to forget our desire to protect others...
Dialogue: Even without emotions, we can't seem to forget our desire to protect others...

Original: Edgar:Come now, it's not like us to give up so easily! Hang in there!
Dialogue: Come now, it's not like us to give up so easily! Hang in there!

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):Ever since I was captured, my leadership's gotten rusty...
Dialogue: Ever since I was captured, my leadership's gotten rusty...

Original: Dark Manikin (Edgar):I have no choice but to leave this to you. Please forgive me...
Dialogue: I have no choice but to leave this to you. Please forgive me...

Original: Edgar:...There is nothing to forgive.
Dialogue: ...There is nothing to forgive.

Original: Terra:It looks like Kefka was connected to this town after all...
Dialogue: It looks like Kefka was connected to this town after all...

Original: Mog:Then there's a good reason there's no brilliance here, kupo...
Dialogue: Then there's a good reason there's no brilliance here, kupo...

Original: Mog:If Kefka is incubating a Blackened Will, it takes an enormous amount of energy, kupo.
Dialogue: If Kefka is incubating a Blackened Will, it takes an enormous amount of energy, kupo.
