Original: Celes:So he took the brilliance to use as material?
Dialogue: So he took the brilliance to use as material?

Original: Edgar:Unforgiveable. He's violating the existence of others!
Dialogue: Unforgiveable. He's violating the existence of others!

Original: Locke:Where is Kefka? Can you locate him?
Dialogue: Where is Kefka? Can you locate him?

Original: Mog:I'm afraid I can't sense him right now, kupo...
Dialogue: I'm afraid I can't sense him right now, kupo...

Original: Mog:But if he needs the brilliance here, I can't imagine he's too far, kupo.
Dialogue: But if he needs the brilliance here, I can't imagine he's too far, kupo.

Original: Celes:I think I have an idea. We need to find him before something terrible happens...!
Dialogue: I think I have an idea. We need to find him before something terrible happens...!

Original: Hope:It sounds like a lot happened to you, Noel. But your memories aren't too different from ours.
Dialogue: It sounds like a lot happened to you, Noel. But your memories aren't too different from ours.

Original: Noel:I was surprised to see you so small, Hope.
Dialogue: I was surprised to see you so small, Hope.

Original: Rydia:So you met him after he grew up. I see...
Dialogue: So you met him after he grew up. I see...

Original: Yang:We were surprised to see Rydia grown up, too. Though the situation is different, I understand your feeling.
Dialogue: We were surprised to see Rydia grown up, too. Though the situation is different, I understand your feeling.

Original: Snow:It's your first time seeing me like this, right?
Dialogue: It's your first time seeing me like this, right?

Original: Noel:You haven't changed much, Snow. You're as reckless as ever.
Dialogue: You haven't changed much, Snow. You're as reckless as ever.

Original: Snow:Don't get so upset. Geez, you may be younger than me, but you can nag with the best of them.
Dialogue: Don't get so upset. Geez, you may be younger than me, but you can nag with the best of them.

Original: Yang:We know Snow to be someone always doing his best in a battle. Was he the same in your world?
Dialogue: We know Snow to be someone always doing his best in a battle. Was he the same in your world?

Original: Noel:Yes. He really made Serah worry.
Dialogue: Yes. He really made Serah worry.

Original: Rydia:You journeyed across time, right? What was it like?
Dialogue: You journeyed across time, right? What was it like?

Original: Noel:...I wonder if it was selfish of me to want to change the future.
Dialogue: ...I wonder if it was selfish of me to want to change the future.

Original: Squall:Most people live for that purpose, even without traveling through time.
Dialogue: Most people live for that purpose, even without traveling through time.

Original: Snow:Whoa, Squall! I never knew you could be so passionate!
Dialogue: Whoa, Squall! I never knew you could be so passionate!

Original: Squall:(I should've kept my mouth shut...)
Dialogue: (I should've kept my mouth shut...)

Original: Noel:But because of that, Serah and Lightning...
Dialogue: But because of that, Serah and Lightning...

Original: Snow:Did something happen to them? I thought they were as lively as ever!
Dialogue: Did something happen to them? I thought they were as lively as ever!

Original: Hope:This isn't like you, Noel. Usually you're more cheerful.
Dialogue: This isn't like you, Noel. Usually you're more cheerful.

Original: Rydia:Maybe it's just hard to talk to people...
Dialogue: Maybe it's just hard to talk to people...

Original: Noel:No, no. I'm really happy to be around so many people.
Dialogue: No, no. I'm really happy to be around so many people.

Original: Noel:...I'm just not used to it.
Dialogue: ...I'm just not used to it.

Original: Snow:You were wandering alone for a long time. It makes sense that you're tired.
Dialogue: You were wandering alone for a long time. It makes sense that you're tired.

Original: Squall:(A journey across time... Past... Future...)
Dialogue: (A journey across time... Past... Future...)

Original: Squall:(...They don't stir up good memories in me.)
Dialogue: (...They don't stir up good memories in me.)

Original: Snow:He's actually a really good kid, though, so please be good friends.
Dialogue: He's actually a really good kid, though, so please be good friends.

Original: Noel:Ugh, quit acting like you're my big brother!
Dialogue: Ugh, quit acting like you're my big brother!

Original: Yang:It's good to see people regain their sense of self when spending time with old friends.
Dialogue: It's good to see people regain their sense of self when spending time with old friends.

Original: Rydia:Indeed! Let's talk again sometime!
Dialogue: Indeed! Let's talk again sometime!

Original: Noel:Of course. Anytime.
Dialogue: Of course. Anytime.

Original: Hope:Take your time, Noel. You're always pushing yourself too hard.
Dialogue: Take your time, Noel. You're always pushing yourself too hard.

Original: Squall:(Good advice. But just how old is Hope again...?)
Dialogue: (Good advice. But just how old is Hope again...?)

Original: Noel:Is Kefka your enemy?
Dialogue: Is Kefka your enemy?

Original: Celes:Yes... It's hard to express it in a word, but he's like a plague upon our world.
Dialogue: Yes... It's hard to express it in a word, but he's like a plague upon our world.

Original: Noel:What did he want? If he destroys the world, he has no place to go.
Dialogue: What did he want? If he destroys the world, he has no place to go.

Original: Kain:As far as I have seen in this world, he has lost all rational thought.
Dialogue: As far as I have seen in this world, he has lost all rational thought.

Original: Kain:Even among Spiritus's warriors, eh's the only one who desires destruction for destruction's sake.
Dialogue: Even among Spiritus's warriors, eh's the only one who desires destruction for destruction's sake.

Original: Noel:Do you have any clue where he might be?
Dialogue: Do you have any clue where he might be?

Original: Locke:In our world, there was acitythat looked like this one. It was the capital of theempire, the place that gave birth to Kefka.
Dialogue: In our world, there was a city that looked like this one. It was the capital of the empire, the place that gave birth to Kefka.

Original: Locke:He's got ties to both the castle and the research lab. I'd like to look for those first.
Dialogue: He's got ties to both the castle and the research lab. I'd like to look for those first.

Original: Vaan:Doesn't he usually just show up around this point?
Dialogue: Doesn't he usually just show up around this point?

Original: Celes:What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Vaan:When we're in a tight spot, he usually comes to make it worse.
Dialogue: When we're in a tight spot, he usually comes to make it worse.

Original: Kain:You have a point. That clown normally appears for no reason to provoke us, then vanishes.
Dialogue: You have a point. That clown normally appears for no reason to provoke us, then vanishes.

Original: Cyan:The fact that he hasn't shown himself this time must mean...
Dialogue: The fact that he hasn't shown himself this time must mean...

Original: Celes:He hasn't the time. He's got his hands full with something else.
Dialogue: He hasn't the time. He's got his hands full with something else.

Original: Locke:If what the dark manikins said was true, then Celes and Terra from the World of Darkness are...!
Dialogue: If what the dark manikins said was true, then Celes and Terra from the World of Darkness are...!

Original: Kain:Calm down. Rushing in is what he wants.
Dialogue: Calm down. Rushing in is what he wants.

Original: Kain:Could you tell us anything more concrete about where he may be?
Dialogue: Could you tell us anything more concrete about where he may be?

Original: Noel:This is a big town. I can't tell which building is the castle.
Dialogue: This is a big town. I can't tell which building is the castle.

Original: Celes:It's a place Kefka has a connection to, and...
Dialogue: It's a place Kefka has a connection to, and...

Original: Edge:Hey! We found something strange!
Dialogue: Hey! We found something strange!

Original: Locke:What is it? And where?
Dialogue: What is it? And where?

Original: Rydia:A tower that reaches high into the sky! The top was hidden in the clouds, so we couldn't see it, but it looked huge.
Dialogue: A tower that reaches high into the sky! The top was hidden in the clouds, so we couldn't see it, but it looked huge.

Original: Kain:A tower...
Dialogue: A tower...

Original: Edge:We don't have any good memories of towers. How about your world?
Dialogue: We don't have any good memories of towers. How about your world?

Original: Celes:A tower... No, something in the sky...!
Dialogue: A tower... No, something in the sky...!

Original: Cyan:Something that floats... Yes, I have an idea.
Dialogue: Something that floats... Yes, I have an idea.

Original: Celes:I can imagine Kefka using that as a base.
Dialogue: I can imagine Kefka using that as a base.

Original: Locke:It's worth climbing. Let's go!
Dialogue: It's worth climbing. Let's go!

Original: Noel:...By the way, is Kefka a man?
Dialogue: ...By the way, is Kefka a man?

Original: Vaan:Yes. Why do you ask?
Dialogue: Yes. Why do you ask?

Original: Noel:I see. I thought he might be the voice that spoke to me, that's all.
Dialogue: I see. I thought he might be the voice that spoke to me, that's all.

Original: Kefka:More! More! There's still not enough magic!
Dialogue: More! More! There's still not enough magic!

Original: Kefka:After all the trouble I went through to sow those planesgorger seeds, this is the thanks I get!?
Dialogue: After all the trouble I went through to sow those planesgorger seeds, this is the thanks I get!?

Original: Kefka:Put some effort into it! I want to see my little Blackened Will as soon as possible!
Dialogue: Put some effort into it! I want to see my little Blackened Will as soon as possible!

Original: Ultimecia:Your voice tests my patience...
Dialogue: Your voice tests my patience...

Original: Kefka:Nobody invited you, witch! Leave us alone! Can't you see we're busy?
Dialogue: Nobody invited you, witch! Leave us alone! Can't you see we're busy?

Original: Kefka:No, no! Where do you think you're going? My little bundle of joy isn't ready to be born yet!
Dialogue: No, no! Where do you think you're going? My little bundle of joy isn't ready to be born yet!

Original: Ultimecia:Abominable buffoon...
Dialogue: Abominable buffoon...

Original: Kefka:Concentrate all your dark magic and fill it to the brim! That will give the Blackened Will shape!
Dialogue: Concentrate all your dark magic and fill it to the brim! That will give the Blackened Will shape!

Original: Ultimecia:To make that artificially is...
Dialogue: To make that artificially is...

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):Someone's coming...!
Dialogue: Someone's coming...!

Original: Ultimecia:A clear will in a puppet from the World of Darkness...?
Dialogue: A clear will in a puppet from the World of Darkness...?

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):I need to protect them... I'll protect everyone...
Dialogue: I need to protect them... I'll protect everyone...

Original: Ultimecia:Fascinating that emotional people normally become such inorganic dolls, and yet...
Dialogue: Fascinating that emotional people normally become such inorganic dolls, and yet...

Original: Ultimecia:You're different. You've been abandoned.
Dialogue: You're different. You've been abandoned.

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):You're not Kefka...
Dialogue: You're not Kefka...

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):Who are you? An ally...?
Dialogue: Who are you? An ally...?

Original: Ultimecia:I am neither friend nor enemy now. Has the power already been squeezed from you?
Dialogue: I am neither friend nor enemy now. Has the power already been squeezed from you?

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):Do you know my friends Terra and Celes...?
Dialogue: Do you know my friends Terra and Celes...?

Original: Ultimecia:They are still alive, if you can call something that merely drifts "alive."
Dialogue: They are still alive, if you can call something that merely drifts "alive."

Original: Ultimecia:Leave this place. I will open the path for you.
Dialogue: Leave this place. I will open the path for you.

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):No! I can't just leave them here!
Dialogue: No! I can't just leave them here!

Original: Ultimecia:I see... You wish to protect them. Then I will tell you where to find them.
Dialogue: I see... You wish to protect them. Then I will tell you where to find them.

Original: Ultimecia:Run straight ahead. There you shall meet your end.
Dialogue: Run straight ahead. There you shall meet your end.

Original: Ultimecia:...Or bring the clown to his.
Dialogue: ...Or bring the clown to his.

Original: Ultimecia:Foolish puppet knight...
Dialogue: Foolish puppet knight...

Original: Ultimecia:There is no place in this world for that sense of duty and what you should protect.
Dialogue: There is no place in this world for that sense of duty and what you should protect.

Original: Kefka:Well, well, well! What do we have here? Still alive?
Dialogue: Well, well, well! What do we have here? Still alive?

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):Let my friends go, Kefka!
Dialogue: Let my friends go, Kefka!

Original: Kefka:Hehehe! Let them go!?
Dialogue: Hehehe! Let them go!?

Original: Kefka:Who's the clown around here!? I can't release them, not when they're sooo full of dark magic!
Dialogue: Who's the clown around here!? I can't release them, not when they're sooo full of dark magic!

Original: Kefka:What horrible fate awaits this world now? I'm almost too scared to find out!
Dialogue: What horrible fate awaits this world now? I'm almost too scared to find out!

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):No, Locke... Get away from us...!
Dialogue: No, Locke... Get away from us...!

Original: Kefka:Did you know it's futile to grow a will inside of a puppet?
Dialogue: Did you know it's futile to grow a will inside of a puppet?

Original: Kefka:But it won't go to waste! I'll suck them all up and feed them to the planesgorgers!
Dialogue: But it won't go to waste! I'll suck them all up and feed them to the planesgorgers!

Original: Noel:Who are you? You're not a friend of Mog's, are you...?
Dialogue: Who are you? You're not a friend of Mog's, are you...?

Original: ???:Indeed. This is our first time meeting like this...poor child lost at the ends of time.
Dialogue: Indeed. This is our first time meeting like this...poor child lost at the ends of time.

Original: Noel:That voice! You're the one who talked to me while I was lost!
Dialogue: That voice! You're the one who talked to me while I was lost!

Original: ???:You cannot get close to me, for you see...
Dialogue: You cannot get close to me, for you see...

Original: Noel:You know her?
Dialogue: You know her?

Original: Squall:What did you say to him?
Dialogue: What did you say to him?

Original: Layle:I feel like this is about to get complicated...
Dialogue: I feel like this is about to get complicated...

Original: Noel:So your name is Ultimecia.
Dialogue: So your name is Ultimecia.

Original: Squall:Don't let her confuse you. She's the enemy.
Dialogue: Don't let her confuse you. She's the enemy.

Original: Serah:We have to listen to the others about their worlds. We've fought heronce before.
Dialogue: We have to listen to the others about their worlds. We've fought her once before.

Original: Layle:She used an unknowing boy as a sacrificial pawn. It was a very dirty trick.
Dialogue: She used an unknowing boy as a sacrificial pawn. It was a very dirty trick.

Original: Locke:Why did you throw Seifer away and decide to use Noel instead?
Dialogue: Why did you throw Seifer away and decide to use Noel instead?

Original: Ultimecia:He was the same as me, a lonely child on the edge of the future...
Dialogue: He was the same as me, a lonely child on the edge of the future...

Original: Squall:Don't listen to her.
Dialogue: Don't listen to her.

Original: Ultimecia:I won't tell you to lower your sword.
Dialogue: I won't tell you to lower your sword.

Original: Ultimecia:You, too, cannot escape your fate. You have a destiny to defeat me.
Dialogue: You, too, cannot escape your fate. You have a destiny to defeat me.

Original: Squall:Enough excuses.
Dialogue: Enough excuses.

Original: Ultimecia:I was born as an evil sorceress. I cannot change the future.
Dialogue: I was born as an evil sorceress. I cannot change the future.

Original: Layle:Calm down. If you don't want to fight, step back.
Dialogue: Calm down. If you don't want to fight, step back.

Original: Locke:I believe Squall. This woman is suspicious no matter which way you slice it.
Dialogue: I believe Squall. This woman is suspicious no matter which way you slice it.

Original: Serah:I'll fight, too.
Dialogue: I'll fight, too.

Original: Serah:I can't forgive you for saying such cruel things even after knowing what Noel's been through!
Dialogue: I can't forgive you for saying such cruel things even after knowing what Noel's been through!

Original: Noel:Serah! I'm sorry...
Dialogue: Serah! I'm sorry...

Original: Locke:Think about it, here and now: who should you be protecting?
Dialogue: Think about it, here and now who should you be protecting?

Original: Noel:Count me in...!
Dialogue: Count me in...!

Original: Ultimecia:Hehe... No matter.
Dialogue: Hehe... No matter.

Original: Ultimecia:Those who live in the future and destroy the future... Their destinies are bound to be different.
Dialogue: Those who live in the future and destroy the future... Their destinies are bound to be different.

Original: Squall:What were you planning to do with Noel!?
Dialogue: What were you planning to do with Noel!?

Original: Ultimecia:Hahaha... You think me a villain? Very well.
Dialogue: Hahaha... You think me a villain? Very well.

Original: Noel:What do you mean!?
Dialogue: What do you mean!?

Original: Seifer:Enough talk!
Dialogue: Enough talk!

Original: Seifer:If you don't know what to do, just stay out of my way!
Dialogue: If you don't know what to do, just stay out of my way!

Original: Ultimecia:For now, this is fine... As long as you feel the weight of destiny...
Dialogue: For now, this is fine... As long as you feel the weight of destiny...

Original: Ultimecia:You there... You're from the same world as that jester, are you not?
Dialogue: You there... You're from the same world as that jester, are you not?

Original: Celes:You mean Kefka?
Dialogue: You mean Kefka?

Original: Ultimecia:I saw him atop that tower with your puppet and a man trying to defend it.
Dialogue: I saw him atop that tower with your puppet and a man trying to defend it.

Original: Locke:My dark manikin?
Dialogue: My dark manikin?

Original: Ultimecia:Yes. He was on the brink of death. I tried to help him escape, but he desired to save his friends and did not heed me.
Dialogue: Yes. He was on the brink of death. I tried to help him escape, but he desired to save his friends and did not heed me.

Original: Ultimecia:He had emotion...or perhaps a will that grew inside of him. In any case, he may still be alive.
Dialogue: He had emotion...or perhaps a will that grew inside of him. In any case, he may still be alive.

Original: Ultimecia:If you seek words worthy of believing, then you had best find him.
Dialogue: If you seek words worthy of believing, then you had best find him.

Original: Squall:Trying to confuse us again... What is it that you want?
Dialogue: Trying to confuse us again... What is it that you want?

Original: Ultimecia:I wish to resist my solitary future and destiny.
Dialogue: I wish to resist my solitary future and destiny.

Original: Ultimecia:But... Now is not the time for my destiny.
Dialogue: But... Now is not the time for my destiny.

Original: Locke:She got away... I don't understand what her aim is.
Dialogue: She got away... I don't understand what her aim is.

Original: Celes:Destiny...and future... They're words with deep meanings, but they sounded so empty when she said them.
Dialogue: Destiny...and future... They're words with deep meanings, but they sounded so empty when she said them.

Original: Zidane:Hey, Squall. We've got some new friends who might need an explanation.
Dialogue: Hey, Squall. We've got some new friends who might need an explanation.

Original: Squall:About Ultimecia...
Dialogue: About Ultimecia...

Original: Noel:I want to know.
Dialogue: I want to know.

Original: Noel:Why did she try to trick me?
Dialogue: Why did she try to trick me?

Original: Y'shtola:Talking may not be your strong suit, and yet I would urge you to tell us all you can.
Dialogue: Talking may not be your strong suit, and yet I would urge you to tell us all you can.

Original: Y'shtola:I wish not to harbor doubts about our new companion.
Dialogue: I wish not to harbor doubts about our new companion.

Original: Celes:It's possible that people think Ultimecia made you her spy.
Dialogue: It's possible that people think Ultimecia made you her spy.

Original: Squall:Ultimecia is a sorceress full of anger and hate. She tried to erase everything but herself.
Dialogue: Ultimecia is a sorceress full of anger and hate. She tried to erase everything but herself.

Original: Squall:The past...the future, too... She wants a world where only she exists.
Dialogue: The past...the future, too... She wants a world where only she exists.

Original: Noel:Did she travel through time?
Dialogue: Did she travel through time?

Original: Squall:No. But...she interfered with it in a way that's possible in our world.
Dialogue: No. But...she interfered with it in a way that's possible in our world.

Original: Squall:She snuck into the gaps in people's hearts and made them do her bidding.
Dialogue: She snuck into the gaps in people's hearts and made them do her bidding.

Original: Squall:She even fooled people into thinking they were happy being controlled...
Dialogue: She even fooled people into thinking they were happy being controlled...

Original: Noel:And she wanted to make that me in this world...
Dialogue: And she wanted to make that me in this world...

Original: Locke:I'm glad it didn't turn out that way, though. You're our friend now, Noel.
Dialogue: I'm glad it didn't turn out that way, though. You're our friend now, Noel.

Original: Noel:I know. But when she said she was alone...that was a lie, right?
Dialogue: I know. But when she said she was alone...that was a lie, right?

Original: Squall:I don't know what she really meant.
Dialogue: I don't know what she really meant.

Original: Celes:We've only ever faced her as an enemy thus far.
Dialogue: We've only ever faced her as an enemy thus far.

Original: Noel:And if you're not allies, you're enemies in this world...
Dialogue: And if you're not allies, you're enemies in this world...

Original: Zidane:That's not the case with everyone, though... You had better think about it long and hard, Noel.
Dialogue: That's not the case with everyone, though... You had better think about it long and hard, Noel.

Original: Y'shtola:When you consider that some people are here to destroy the world or humankind, the choice should be an easy one.
Dialogue: When you consider that some people are here to destroy the world or humankind, the choice should be an easy one.

Original: Noel:...I'll keep that in mind.
Dialogue: ...I'll keep that in mind.

Original: Squall:(He still hasn't accepted it yet...)
Dialogue: (He still hasn't accepted it yet...)

Original: Squall:(It makes sense... If you're told someone you trusted is suddenly your enemy...)
Dialogue: (It makes sense... If you're told someone you trusted is suddenly your enemy...)

Original: Seifer:Hey, nitwit.
Dialogue: Hey, nitwit.

Original: Noel:You mean me?
Dialogue: You mean me?

Original: Seifer:Is there anyone else here?
Dialogue: Is there anyone else here?

Original: Raijin:We wanted to see how you're doing, ya know.
Dialogue: We wanted to see how you're doing, ya know.

Original: Seifer:No! We knew he'd be down in the dumps, so we came all this way to check on him.
Dialogue: No! We knew he'd be down in the dumps, so we came all this way to check on him.

Original: Squall:(How is that different?)
Dialogue: (How is that different?)

Original: Seifer:That sorceress... She's a force to be reckoned with. She even managed to fool me.
Dialogue: That sorceress... She's a force to be reckoned with. She even managed to fool me.

Original: Raijin:She lied and said she'd make Seifer her knight, then tossed him aside, ya know?
Dialogue: She lied and said she'd make Seifer her knight, then tossed him aside, ya know?

Original: Fujin:LIES. UNTRUSTWORTHY.
Dialogue: LIES. UNTRUSTWORTHY.

Original: Seifer:The fact that you fell for it means you're still a simple kid.
Dialogue: The fact that you fell for it means you're still a simple kid.

Original: Squall:(You're one to talk, Seifer.)
Dialogue: (You're one to talk, Seifer.)

Original: Raijin:Ultimecia only thinks about herself, y'know?
Dialogue: Ultimecia only thinks about herself, y'know?

Original: Raijin:It's unfortunate, but we want you to come to a clean decision, ya know.
Dialogue: It's unfortunate, but we want you to come to a clean decision, ya know.

Original: Noel:Maybe. Are you worried about me?
Dialogue: Maybe. Are you worried about me?

Original: Seifer:In any case, we need to stop dragging our feet and climb that tower!
Dialogue: In any case, we need to stop dragging our feet and climb that tower!

Original: Locke:Did Seifer come by to give him some clumsy encouragement...?
Dialogue: Did Seifer come by to give him some clumsy encouragement...?

Original: Squall:(Locke... You must be in a hurry.)
Dialogue: (Locke... You must be in a hurry.)

Original: Locke:Hey, Noel. Come with me.
Dialogue: Hey, Noel. Come with me.

Original: Noel:Are we in a rush?
Dialogue: Are we in a rush?

Original: Locke:No, no. Just taking a small break. Don't tell Edgar, though.
Dialogue: No, no. Just taking a small break. Don't tell Edgar, though.

Original: Locke:You come, too, Squall. You look like you could use a break.
Dialogue: You come, too, Squall. You look like you could use a break.

Original: Locke:Hm... Let's invite Noctis, too.
Dialogue: Hm... Let's invite Noctis, too.

Original: Noel:H-hey! Wait!
Dialogue: H-hey! Wait!

Original: Squall:What is he planning...?
Dialogue: What is he planning...?

Original: Squall:(How can he be the same as always? Even though they're dark manikins, they're still his friends who're in trouble...)
Dialogue: (How can he be the same as always? Even though they're dark manikins, they're still his friends who're in trouble...)

Original: Noel:Sorry. I know we're in a hurry...
Dialogue: Sorry. I know we're in a hurry...

Original: Locke:Don't worry about it. I'm sorry if you feel rushed. Treasure hunters should be free.
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. I'm sorry if you feel rushed. Treasure hunters should be free.

Original: Locke:I'm sure you understand if you're really a hunter.
Dialogue: I'm sure you understand if you're really a hunter.

Original: Noel:I hunted for food. Things like treasure didn't exist anymore.
Dialogue: I hunted for food. Things like treasure didn't exist anymore.

Original: Noel:In my time, things like monster horns and ancient beads were considered treasure.
Dialogue: In my time, things like monster horns and ancient beads were considered treasure.

Original: Noel:But any friends or family I wanted to give them to had long since passed.
Dialogue: But any friends or family I wanted to give them to had long since passed.

Original: Noel:Even people I really wanted to protect...
Dialogue: Even people I really wanted to protect...

Original: Noel:I studied the sword so I could save them, but in the end...it was useless.
Dialogue: I studied the sword so I could save them, but in the end...it was useless.

Original: Locke:You really think so? Lightning told me Serah said you're very reliable.
Dialogue: You really think so? Lightning told me Serah said you're very reliable.

Original: Noel:Serah was my partner.
Dialogue: Serah was my partner.

Original: Noel:But here she has Snow and Lightning, her family...
Dialogue: But here she has Snow and Lightning, her family...

Original: Locke:Do you think you're alone, even in this world?
Dialogue: Do you think you're alone, even in this world?

Original: Noel:...I'm not used to being around so many people.
Dialogue: ...I'm not used to being around so many people.

Original: Noel:Ever since I was born, I've been able to count the number of people in my village.
Dialogue: Ever since I was born, I've been able to count the number of people in my village.

Original: Noel:I wanted to journey with optimism... But it hurts a lot more than I expected when things get tough.
Dialogue: I wanted to journey with optimism... But it hurts a lot more than I expected when things get tough.

Original: Locke:We are a pretty big party now... Can't be easy on Squall either.
Dialogue: We are a pretty big party now... Can't be easy on Squall either.

Original: Squall:Don't bring me into this.
Dialogue: Don't bring me into this.

Original: Squall:(But he's right when he says there's something troubling me. But saying it out loud doesn't help...)
Dialogue: (But he's right when he says there's something troubling me. But saying it out loud doesn't help...)

Original: Locke:...The friends I've made here remind me of my friends back home.
Dialogue: ...The friends I've made here remind me of my friends back home.

Original: Noel:You mean like Terra and Edgar?
Dialogue: You mean like Terra and Edgar?

Original: Locke:From kings to former imperial soldiers... We had all kinds of allies from all walks of life.
Dialogue: From kings to former imperial soldiers... We had all kinds of allies from all walks of life.

Original: Locke:We all had different reasons for fighting. I don't know if I fully understood them even at the end.
Dialogue: We all had different reasons for fighting. I don't know if I fully understood them even at the end.

Original: Noel:Even still, you fought as one?
Dialogue: Even still, you fought as one?

Original: Locke:Of course. We're all adults, and we all have a past.
Dialogue: Of course. We're all adults, and we all have a past.

Original: Locke:It's good to surround yourself with all kinds. It doesn't matter if your reasons for fighting aren't the same.
Dialogue: It's good to surround yourself with all kinds. It doesn't matter if your reasons for fighting aren't the same.

Original: Locke:I think it's important to treasure your bonds with friends and family while you're young.
Dialogue: I think it's important to treasure your bonds with friends and family while you're young.

Original: Locke:Even if their way of thinking is different, you can still stand by each other's sides and fight.
Dialogue: Even if their way of thinking is different, you can still stand by each other's sides and fight.

Original: Noct:...I get what you're saying.
Dialogue: ...I get what you're saying.

Original: Locke:You, too. You might be uneasy not knowing many people here, but...
Dialogue: You, too. You might be uneasy not knowing many people here, but...

Original: Locke:Don't hesitate to rely on us. We've done our growing up.
Dialogue: Don't hesitate to rely on us. We've done our growing up.

Original: Locke:Now we'll share the burden with you younger guys.
Dialogue: Now we'll share the burden with you younger guys.

Original: Noct:It's really not that serious, but...thanks.
Dialogue: It's really not that serious, but...thanks.

Original: Locke:You're a lot better off than when I was a kid!
Dialogue: You're a lot better off than when I was a kid!

Original: Noct:...I am twenty, you know.
Dialogue: ...I am twenty, you know.

Original: Locke:Whoa, my bad! Well, our ages aside, we should work together...as friends trying to find their way.
Dialogue: Whoa, my bad! Well, our ages aside, we should work together...as friends trying to find their way.

Original: Locke:If there's ever anything you need, let me know. I'll protect my friends with my life!
Dialogue: If there's ever anything you need, let me know. I'll protect my friends with my life!

Original: Noel:Thank you. I feel like I'm ready now.
Dialogue: Thank you. I feel like I'm ready now.

Original: Locke:Then let's get going! Before anyone finds out we're gone!
Dialogue: Then let's get going! Before anyone finds out we're gone!

Original: Zidane:So Locke is a treasure hunter and Noel is a monster hunter.
Dialogue: So Locke is a treasure hunter and Noel is a monster hunter.

Original: Zidane:Yuffie is a self-proclaimed materia hunter... We've got all kinds of hunters.
Dialogue: Yuffie is a self-proclaimed materia hunter... We've got all kinds of hunters.

Original: Noel:What's that?
Dialogue: What's that?

Original: Zidane:It's an event where the more you hunt, the more points you get. Vivi and Freya participated, too. It was a lot of fun!
Dialogue: It's an event where the more you hunt, the more points you get. Vivi and Freya participated, too. It was a lot of fun!

Original: Noct:Sounds awesome.
Dialogue: Sounds awesome.

Original: Steiner:Is it true that you only ate monster meat, Sir Noel?
Dialogue: Is it true that you only ate monster meat, Sir Noel?

Original: Noel:Yeah. The ground was infertile, so you couldn't grow anything.
Dialogue: Yeah. The ground was infertile, so you couldn't grow anything.

Original: Noel:There weren't any vegetables.
Dialogue: There weren't any vegetables.

Original: Noel:Even if there were, you couldn't cultivate them. The techniques were long gone.
Dialogue: Even if there were, you couldn't cultivate them. The techniques were long gone.

Original: Zidane:That sounds like a harsh future to live in...
Dialogue: That sounds like a harsh future to live in...

Original: Steiner:What a cruel life...! I'd be happy to share some of my pickles with you.
Dialogue: What a cruel life...! I'd be happy to share some of my pickles with you.

Original: Prishe:Maybe it's better not to start him off with those pickles...
Dialogue: Maybe it's better not to start him off with those pickles...

Original: Noct:So you mean there were no veggies at all?
Dialogue: So you mean there were no veggies at all?

Original: Noel:Absolutely none. Even grass withered.
Dialogue: Absolutely none. Even grass withered.

Original: Prishe:What's up with you? Do you hate vegetables?
Dialogue: What's up with you? Do you hate vegetables?

Original: Noct:What!? I don't remember telling you that!
Dialogue: What!? I don't remember telling you that!

Original: Steiner:Even if you didn't, it's clear on your face.
Dialogue: Even if you didn't, it's clear on your face.

Original: Noct:It's not like I hate them...
Dialogue: It's not like I hate them...

Original: Noct:No. I do hate them, but...
Dialogue: No. I do hate them, but...

Original: Zidane:This is painful to watch. Vegetables are good for your health.
Dialogue: This is painful to watch. Vegetables are good for your health.

Original: Noct:Yeah, so I heard... And somehow they found their way into the food I'd always eat.
Dialogue: Yeah, so I heard... And somehow they found their way into the food I'd always eat.

Original: Steiner:Ahaha! You had an excellent chef!
Dialogue: Ahaha! You had an excellent chef!

Original: Prishe:Even without him around, you shouldn't be so picky.
Dialogue: Even without him around, you shouldn't be so picky.

Original: Zidane:He looks upset. Don't tease him so much, Prishe.
Dialogue: He looks upset. Don't tease him so much, Prishe.

Original: Noel:I heard that you like meat, but I didn't know you hated vegetables.
Dialogue: I heard that you like meat, but I didn't know you hated vegetables.

Original: Noct:I definitely prefer my meals without them.
Dialogue: I definitely prefer my meals without them.

Original: Prishe:Those two seem to get along great.
Dialogue: Those two seem to get along great.

Original: Zidane:I don't get it. They seem like complete opposites.
Dialogue: I don't get it. They seem like complete opposites.

Original: Prishe:People's hearts are a funny thing. I'm just happy that they can be friends!
Dialogue: People's hearts are a funny thing. I'm just happy that they can be friends!

Original: Edgar:It looks like it was worth slacking off.
Dialogue: It looks like it was worth slacking off.

Original: Noct:They found us out.
Dialogue: They found us out.

Original: Edgar:I like knowing how my comrades are faring.
Dialogue: I like knowing how my comrades are faring.

Original: Shadow:...It was needless work.
Dialogue: ...It was needless work.

Original: Edgar:Don't say that. I was worried.
Dialogue: Don't say that. I was worried.

Original: Firion:Is everyone here? We found an escape door on the tower!
Dialogue: Is everyone here? We found an escape door on the tower!

Original: Firion:But there's some kind of machine blocking the way.
Dialogue: But there's some kind of machine blocking the way.

Original: Rydia:Could it be...the tower's...
Dialogue: Could it be...the tower's...

Original: Edgar:Befitting of Kefka.
Dialogue: Befitting of Kefka.

Original: Edgar:I wouldn't put it past him to take things from other worlds just to shake us.
Dialogue: I wouldn't put it past him to take things from other worlds just to shake us.

Original: Edgar:Because our will is our strength in this world.
Dialogue: Because our will is our strength in this world.

Original: Cecil:How despicable... Putting an obstacle we've already overcome before us.
Dialogue: How despicable... Putting an obstacle we've already overcome before us.

Original: Firion:He's trying to make you doubt Golbez and crush your will...
Dialogue: He's trying to make you doubt Golbez and crush your will...

Original: Rydia:But we won't be shaken! We believe in Golbez!
Dialogue: But we won't be shaken! We believe in Golbez!

Original: Firion:We saw it with our own eyes.
Dialogue: We saw it with our own eyes.

Original: Edgar:Are you ready for the hunt?
Dialogue: Are you ready for the hunt?

Original: Noel:Yeah. I'll show you what I can do.
Dialogue: Yeah. I'll show you what I can do.

Original: Noct:You call this a hunt?
Dialogue: You call this a hunt?

Original: Noel:Are you gonna join or not, Noct?
Dialogue: Are you gonna join or not, Noct?

Original: Noct:Of course I am.
Dialogue: Of course I am.

Original: Cecil:Our wills stand firm. Let's go!
Dialogue: Our wills stand firm. Let's go!

Original: Cecil:The defense system should have a weakness.
Dialogue: The defense system should have a weakness.

Original: Cecil:Each machine has a complementary mechanism!
Dialogue: Each machine has a complementary mechanism!

Original: Noel:Got it! I'm used to hunting prey that work together.
Dialogue: Got it! I'm used to hunting prey that work together.

Original: Cecil:And together we shall overcome!
Dialogue: And together we shall overcome!

Original: Terra:This place... I knew it!
Dialogue: This place... I knew it!

Original: Vivi:Do you know where we are?
Dialogue: Do you know where we are?

Original: Shadow:This is theFloating Continent. It was Kefka's base inour world.
Dialogue: This is the Floating Continent. It was Kefka's base in our world.

Original: Setzer:Perhaps Terra and Celes's dark manikins are being held here somewhere...
Dialogue: Perhaps Terra and Celes's dark manikins are being held here somewhere...

Original: Vivi:...I think dark manikins have hearts and lives.
Dialogue: ...I think dark manikins have hearts and lives.

Original: Vivi:I can't help but wonder what their dark manikins are feeling now...
Dialogue: I can't help but wonder what their dark manikins are feeling now...

Original: Vivi:Aren't they being turned into tools to destroy the world?
Dialogue: Aren't they being turned into tools to destroy the world?

Original: Shadow:If you believe what the enemy says.
Dialogue: If you believe what the enemy says.

Original: Setzer:The less I want to believe it, the more likely it's true.
Dialogue: The less I want to believe it, the more likely it's true.

Original: Setzer:I imagine even an underworld assassin feels the same.
Dialogue: I imagine even an underworld assassin feels the same.

Original: Shadow:If what is common sense in my world is true here, then yes...
Dialogue: If what is common sense in my world is true here, then yes...

Original: Setzer:Blast it... I'd feel a lot better if he'd just attack us directly.
Dialogue: Blast it... I'd feel a lot better if he'd just attack us directly.

Original: Terra:Isn't there a way to search for their presence?
Dialogue: Isn't there a way to search for their presence?

Original: Yuna:Hmm... We usually depend on Mog for these things.
Dialogue: Hmm... We usually depend on Mog for these things.

Original: Yuna:But it seems like friends from the same world can somehow find each other.
Dialogue: But it seems like friends from the same world can somehow find each other.

Original: Vivi:Are you okay, miss? Aren't you afraid to go forward?
Dialogue: Are you okay, miss? Aren't you afraid to go forward?

Original: Setzer:It was hard enough seeing ourselves... It may be better if Terra and Celes don't see what's up ahead.
Dialogue: It was hard enough seeing ourselves... It may be better if Terra and Celes don't see what's up ahead.

Original: Setzer:Kept in a nursery, treated no different from plants...
Dialogue: Kept in a nursery, treated no different from plants...

Original: Terra:...I appreciate your concern.
Dialogue: ...I appreciate your concern.

Original: Terra:I would be lying if I said I wasn't scared...
Dialogue: I would be lying if I said I wasn't scared...

Original: Terra:But if my dark manikin thinks the same way I do, she would never want to be a tool of destruction...
Dialogue: But if my dark manikin thinks the same way I do, she would never want to be a tool of destruction...

Original: Terra:That's why...I want to go ahead. I need to stop Kefka.
Dialogue: That's why...I want to go ahead. I need to stop Kefka.

Original: Vivi:We'll be beside you.
Dialogue: We'll be beside you.

Original: Vivi:If you're scared, please rely on us.
Dialogue: If you're scared, please rely on us.

Original: Yuna:Yeah, we'll all go with you!
Dialogue: Yeah, we'll all go with you!

Original: Kefka:Hehehe! The time is near!
Dialogue: Hehehe! The time is near!

Original: Kefka:Look! Brilliance!
Dialogue: Look! Brilliance!

Original: Kefka:It's alive! My experiment was a success! Happy birthday, Willy!
Dialogue: It's alive! My experiment was a success! Happy birthday, Willy!

Original: Kefka:And you, my broken containers, are now useless!
Dialogue: And you, my broken containers, are now useless!

Original: Kefka:I'm going to raise you until you're strong enough to destroy this whooole dimension!
Dialogue: I'm going to raise you until you're strong enough to destroy this whooole dimension!

Original: Kefka:Attention, everyone!
Dialogue: Attention, everyone!

Original: Terra:This presence...!
Dialogue: This presence...!

Original: Ultima Weapon:"I am power both ancient and unrivaled..."
Dialogue: "I am power both ancient and unrivaled..."

Original: Ultima Weapon:"I do not bleed, for I am but strength given form..."
Dialogue: "I do not bleed, for I am but strength given form..."

Original: Noct:It's talking...
Dialogue: It's talking...

Original: Noel:But it looks edible.
Dialogue: But it looks edible.

Original: Noct:It'd be a pain to pick out all those bones and horns though...
Dialogue: It'd be a pain to pick out all those bones and horns though...

Original: Cyan:It looks like thy true power comes out once thou hast relaxed.
Dialogue: It looks like thy true power comes out once thou hast relaxed.

Original: Locke:But this is not an enemy to take lightly.
Dialogue: But this is not an enemy to take lightly.

Original: Noel:But the bigger the prey, the more fired up you get, right?
Dialogue: But the bigger the prey, the more fired up you get, right?

Original: Noct:You bet.
Dialogue: You bet.

Original: Cyan:How promising.
Dialogue: How promising.

Original: Terra:I suppose Kefka summoned this one, too.
Dialogue: I suppose Kefka summoned this one, too.

Original: Locke:Along with the Floating Continent. If that's the case, then he's a powerful foe...
Dialogue: Along with the Floating Continent. If that's the case, then he's a powerful foe...

Original: Noel:Perfect. Let's do this!
Dialogue: Perfect. Let's do this!

Original: Noct:We'll split the spoils.
Dialogue: We'll split the spoils.

Original: Locke:With treasure, the early bird gets the worm!
Dialogue: With treasure, the early bird gets the worm!

Original: Ultima Weapon:"Feeble creatures of flesh... Your time is nigh!"
Dialogue: "Feeble creatures of flesh... Your time is nigh!"

Original: Noel:We'll show you who's feeble!
Dialogue: We'll show you who's feeble!

Original: Noct:You got that right.
Dialogue: You got that right.

Original: Locke:We'll show you what we're made of!
Dialogue: We'll show you what we're made of!

Original: Locke:But it was supposed to be in the deepest part of our home world...
Dialogue: But it was supposed to be in the deepest part of our home world...

Original: Celes:I can feel Kefka's will. He doesn't want us to get inside.
Dialogue: I can feel Kefka's will. He doesn't want us to get inside.

Original: Terra:We haven't a moment to waste! We need to defeat this monster and find Kefka!
Dialogue: We haven't a moment to waste! We need to defeat this monster and find Kefka!

Original: Mog:Kupo!? Look over there, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo!? Look over there, kupo!

Original: Warrior of Light:Shinryu's larvae... A planesgorger's carcass?
Dialogue: Shinryu's larvae... A planesgorger's carcass?

Original: Locke:Did Kefka...defeat it?
Dialogue: Did Kefka...defeat it?

Original: Mog:I don't know. This is the first time I've seen one like this, kupo.
Dialogue: I don't know. This is the first time I've seen one like this, kupo.

Original: Mog:It's been stripped of its power to eat dimensions, kupo!
Dialogue: It's been stripped of its power to eat dimensions, kupo!

Original: Garnet:Maybe it's like what happened with Kuja. Perhaps he fought and weakened it?
Dialogue: Maybe it's like what happened with Kuja. Perhaps he fought and weakened it?

Original: Mog:It's more accurate to say there's nothing left in it, kupo.
Dialogue: It's more accurate to say there's nothing left in it, kupo.

Original: Warrior of Light:After being used as a medium to summon this place...
Dialogue: After being used as a medium to summon this place...

Original: Warrior of Light:He removed the planesgorging part of it...
Dialogue: He removed the planesgorging part of it...

Original: Noel:It's just an empty husk now.
Dialogue: It's just an empty husk now.

Original: Terra:So Kefka now possesses the power to consume dimensions...
Dialogue: So Kefka now possesses the power to consume dimensions...

Original: Locke:I can't believe he sacrificed even a planesgorger to get more power...
Dialogue: I can't believe he sacrificed even a planesgorger to get more power...

Original: Noel:So what do planesgorgers do?
Dialogue: So what do planesgorgers do?

Original: Locke:Eat dimensions. Or, put simply: destroy the world and the future.
Dialogue: Eat dimensions. Or, put simply destroy the world and the future.

Original: Warrior of Light:And not just this world. Even our home worlds are in danger.
Dialogue: And not just this world. Even our home worlds are in danger.

Original: Noel:So it'll become a wasteland where nobody can live, like this world?
Dialogue: So it'll become a wasteland where nobody can live, like this world?

Original: Terra:Yes. Which is why we need to stop him.
Dialogue: Yes. Which is why we need to stop him.

Original: Garnet:Look! The body...!
Dialogue: Look! The body...!

Original: Mog:Seeing that shell of energy become empty and disappear is a bad sign, kupo.
Dialogue: Seeing that shell of energy become empty and disappear is a bad sign, kupo.

Original: Terra:We need to find Kefka, quickly!
Dialogue: We need to find Kefka, quickly!

Original: Noel:What the... Everyone's collapsed.
Dialogue: What the... Everyone's collapsed.

Original: Locke:Get her away. This isn't something for a child to see.
Dialogue: Get her away. This isn't something for a child to see.

Original: Celes:This is like...in war...
Dialogue: This is like...in war...

Original: Mog:The brilliance... All of its power's been absorbed, kupo.
Dialogue: The brilliance... All of its power's been absorbed, kupo.

Original: Noel:I'll go look for survivors.
Dialogue: I'll go look for survivors.

Original: Noel:If there are any, I want to find them for sure.
Dialogue: If there are any, I want to find them for sure.

Original: Celes:Yes... We'll split up and look, too.
Dialogue: Yes... We'll split up and look, too.

Original: Krile:I'll help. It's sad, but I'll be okay.
Dialogue: I'll help. It's sad, but I'll be okay.

Original: Locke:It's our own feelings that are the problem... If you're going, take Galuf and the others with you.
Dialogue: It's our own feelings that are the problem... If you're going, take Galuf and the others with you.

Original: Krile:Got it!
Dialogue: Got it!

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):...? Is someone there...?
Dialogue: ...? Is someone there...?

Original: Noel:I found one! It's Locke!
Dialogue: I found one! It's Locke!

Original: Locke:Hey! Hold on!
Dialogue: Hey! Hold on!

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):I'm sorry... I couldn't protect them...
Dialogue: I'm sorry... I couldn't protect them...

Original: Noel:Does he still have Celes and Terra from the World of Darkness?
Dialogue: Does he still have Celes and Terra from the World of Darkness?

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):Yes. Up ahead, he's still...performing his horrible experiment to birth the Blackened Will...
Dialogue: Yes. Up ahead, he's still...performing his horrible experiment to birth the Blackened Will...

Original: Celes:...You tried to protect us. Even getting this hurt...
Dialogue: ...You tried to protect us. Even getting this hurt...

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):He took the brilliance with him.
Dialogue: He took the brilliance with him.

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):I was so obsessed with my promise to protect...
Dialogue: I was so obsessed with my promise to protect...

Original: Noel:Obsessed with...a promise...
Dialogue: Obsessed with...a promise...

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):I should have given my power to you...warriors from the World of Light...
Dialogue: I should have given my power to you...warriors from the World of Light...

Original: Locke:You idiot! That's enough!
Dialogue: You idiot! That's enough!

Original: Locke:I'll take those feelings with me, along with the strength of your will.
Dialogue: I'll take those feelings with me, along with the strength of your will.

Original: Locke:I won't waste either.
Dialogue: I won't waste either.

Original: Dark Manikin (Locke):...Thank you...
Dialogue: ...Thank you...

Original: Celes:The dark manikins keep saying that you don't have any feelings, and yet...
Dialogue: The dark manikins keep saying that you don't have any feelings, and yet...

Original: Krile:They've inherited strong emotions, just like the real deal.
Dialogue: They've inherited strong emotions, just like the real deal.

Original: Noel:Locke feels the same about protecting others.
Dialogue: Locke feels the same about protecting others.

Original: Noel:...Though he pretended to be carefree in front of me.
Dialogue: ...Though he pretended to be carefree in front of me.

Original: Celes:Oh really? If Locke says he's going to protect someone, I know he will.
Dialogue: Oh really? If Locke says he's going to protect someone, I know he will.

Original: Celes:It wasn't easy, but...
Dialogue: It wasn't easy, but...

Original: Locke:You weren't someone to just be protected.
Dialogue: You weren't someone to just be protected.

Original: Noel:Sorry. Did you hear that?
Dialogue: Sorry. Did you hear that?

Original: Locke:Of course I did. You're loud.
Dialogue: Of course I did. You're loud.

Original: Locke:Like my dark manikin, I know the pain of being unable to protect someone.
Dialogue: Like my dark manikin, I know the pain of being unable to protect someone.

Original: Locke:You know it, too. That's why you feel like we're getting nowhere fast.
Dialogue: You know it, too. That's why you feel like we're getting nowhere fast.

Original: Noel:Bull's-eye. It's so frustrating...
Dialogue: Bull's-eye. It's so frustrating...

Original: Noel:Do you think we can make it to Celes and Terra?
Dialogue: Do you think we can make it to Celes and Terra?

Original: Locke:We won't know until we try. We may be able to save them yet.
Dialogue: We won't know until we try. We may be able to save them yet.

Original: Celes:That's right... And I will fight, no matter what.
Dialogue: That's right... And I will fight, no matter what.

Original: Celes:Because I know who is evil...
Dialogue: Because I know who is evil...

Original: Lightning:Look! It's those two!
Dialogue: Look! It's those two!

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):Blackened...Will... We are... Nursery...
Dialogue: Blackened...Will... We are... Nursery...

Original: Terra:Hold on!
Dialogue: Hold on!

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):Don't come...closer...
Dialogue: Don't come...closer...

Original: Edgar:Stand back. They don't look normal.
Dialogue: Stand back. They don't look normal.

Original: Celes:But they can still talk!
Dialogue: But they can still talk!

Original: Lightning:It doesn't look like we'll have any meaningful conversations, though.
Dialogue: It doesn't look like we'll have any meaningful conversations, though.

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):The Blackened Will...devoured...our bodies...
Dialogue: The Blackened Will...devoured...our bodies...

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):It's all...gone... All...stolen...
Dialogue: It's all...gone... All...stolen...

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):The Blackened Will...ate...everything...
Dialogue: The Blackened Will...ate...everything...

Original: Terra:No... That's not how Celes speaks...
Dialogue: No... That's not how Celes speaks...

Original: Celes:Something... Something is inside of her...
Dialogue: Something... Something is inside of her...

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):You...don't know...
Dialogue: You...don't know...

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):The disgusting will...crushed us...
Dialogue: The disgusting will...crushed us...

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):Life... Dreams... Hope... All will vanish...
Dialogue: Life... Dreams... Hope... All will vanish...

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):Anything... Everything... All became nothing...
Dialogue: Anything... Everything... All became nothing...

Original: Lightning:You don't have to listen to them. It won't make you feel any better.
Dialogue: You don't have to listen to them. It won't make you feel any better.

Original: Terra:No. I must face them. Their pain won't end otherwise.
Dialogue: No. I must face them. Their pain won't end otherwise.

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):It's gone... Everything we loved...
Dialogue: It's gone... Everything we loved...

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):It was taken... It all vanished...
Dialogue: It was taken... It all vanished...

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):Vanished... Dis...appeared... Gone... All gone...
Dialogue: Vanished... Dis...appeared... Gone... All gone...

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):What vanished? We...don't know...anymore...
Dialogue: What vanished? We...don't know...anymore...

Original: Edgar:My heart is trembling... I can't...
Dialogue: My heart is trembling... I can't...

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):...We are...vessels.
Dialogue: ...We are...vessels.

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):At the bottom...of our hearts... Hidden...will... Brilliance... Shoved in...
Dialogue: At the bottom...of our hearts... Hidden...will... Brilliance... Shoved in...

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):We felt it...for a long...long time. It was painful...
Dialogue: We felt it...for a long...long time. It was painful...

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):And then it was born. It fed...on our wills...
Dialogue: And then it was born. It fed...on our wills...

Original: Celes:You mean the Blackened Will has already been born!?
Dialogue: You mean the Blackened Will has already been born!?

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):We could not stop it... Sorry...
Dialogue: We could not stop it... Sorry...

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):Sorry... Sorry, sorry...
Dialogue: Sorry... Sorry, sorry...

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):The vessel is broken... We do not need to exist... Sorry...
Dialogue: The vessel is broken... We do not need to exist... Sorry...

Original: Edgar:Enough! You've suffered enough!
Dialogue: Enough! You've suffered enough!

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):Destruction...
Dialogue: Destruction...

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):Destroy... We must destroy everything... Everyone...
Dialogue: Destroy... We must destroy everything... Everyone...

Original: Celes:...We won't be destroyed.
Dialogue: ...We won't be destroyed.

Original: Celes:We will live on your behalf!
Dialogue: We will live on your behalf!

Original: Terra:I will defeat Kefka, the monster who destroyed your hearts!
Dialogue: I will defeat Kefka, the monster who destroyed your hearts!

Original: Terra:Everyone, with me!
Dialogue: Everyone, with me!

Original: Lightning:Of course.
Dialogue: Of course.

Original: Edgar:It is painful, but...they have an impulse for destruction...
Dialogue: It is painful, but...they have an impulse for destruction...

Original: Celes:We'll take the pain away...!
Dialogue: We'll take the pain away...!

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):No one...can ease our pain...!
Dialogue: No one...can ease our pain...!

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):Ahhh...! This...power...!
Dialogue: Ahhh...! This...power...!

Original: Celes:We need to stop them quickly, or there won't be a shard of consciousness left.
Dialogue: We need to stop them quickly, or there won't be a shard of consciousness left.

Original: Locke:If we're fast enough, there may yet be a heart to save!
Dialogue: If we're fast enough, there may yet be a heart to save!

Original: Edgar:Then let us hurry. I can't stand to see their suffering any longer.
Dialogue: Then let us hurry. I can't stand to see their suffering any longer.

Original: Dark Manikin (Terra):Thank you...everyone...
Dialogue: Thank you...everyone...

Original: Dark Manikin (Celes):Please forgive us... We were...powerless...
Dialogue: Please forgive us... We were...powerless...

Original: Celes:No, you weren't powerless...
Dialogue: No, you weren't powerless...

Original: Terra:Even though your hearts were in pain, you entrusted us with your feelings...
Dialogue: Even though your hearts were in pain, you entrusted us with your feelings...

Original: Onion Knight:Terra... It must be tough, but you're holding up well.
Dialogue: Terra... It must be tough, but you're holding up well.

Original: Celes:Kefka was subjected to experiments to inject people with magic in our home world, too.
Dialogue: Kefka was subjected to experiments to inject people with magic in our home world, too.

Original: Celes:Maybe he was trying to get revenge by unconsciously reproducing that here...
Dialogue: Maybe he was trying to get revenge by unconsciously reproducing that here...

Original: Locke:Stop thinking before you start projecting...
Dialogue: Stop thinking before you start projecting...

Original: Locke:...You're hurt, Celes. Take care of yourself first.
Dialogue: ...You're hurt, Celes. Take care of yourself first.

Original: Onion Knight:He's right. You, too, Terra. You should rest, if you can.
Dialogue: He's right. You, too, Terra. You should rest, if you can.

Original: Onion Knight:It worries us, seeing you like this.
Dialogue: It worries us, seeing you like this.

Original: Terra:...You're very kind.
Dialogue: ...You're very kind.

Original: Cloud:So victims from the experiment create yet more victims...
Dialogue: So victims from the experiment create yet more victims...

Original: Vincent:to inject one life into another... Guess I have to see that nightmare here, too...
Dialogue: to inject one life into another... Guess I have to see that nightmare here, too...

Original: Noel:You two are also worried?
Dialogue: You two are also worried?

Original: Cloud:Hearing the word "experiment" brings back memories.
Dialogue: Hearing the word "experiment" brings back memories.

Original: Vincent:Indeed... It's not something we can turn a blind eye to.
Dialogue: Indeed... It's not something we can turn a blind eye to.

Original: Vincent:Unless it was something that they desired and accepted. Otherwise...
Dialogue: Unless it was something that they desired and accepted. Otherwise...

Original: Noel:I understand one thing: I want to defeat Kefka no matter what.
Dialogue: I understand one thing I want to defeat Kefka no matter what.

Original: Cloud:But if the Blackened Will has been born, we'll be in for a tough fight.
Dialogue: But if the Blackened Will has been born, we'll be in for a tough fight.

Original: Noel:What kind of enemy is it?
Dialogue: What kind of enemy is it?

Original: Vincent:One that corrodes dimensions.
Dialogue: One that corrodes dimensions.

Original: Cloud:It was originally a parasitic part of Shinryu.
Dialogue: It was originally a parasitic part of Shinryu.

Original: Noel:Shinryu... You mean the enemy that eats dimensions and destroys worlds?
Dialogue: Shinryu... You mean the enemy that eats dimensions and destroys worlds?

Original: Cloud:Yes. And the Blackened Will we faced swelled up by absorbing the power of others.
Dialogue: Yes. And the Blackened Will we faced swelled up by absorbing the power of others.

Original: Cloud:I can only imagine one born with Kefka's patronage to be even worse.
Dialogue: I can only imagine one born with Kefka's patronage to be even worse.

Original: Noel:It sounds like we just have to bring it down. For the sake of everyone's future.
Dialogue: It sounds like we just have to bring it down. For the sake of everyone's future.

Original: Cloud:Right. Once they recover, we need to go after Kefka.
Dialogue: Right. Once they recover, we need to go after Kefka.

Original: Noel:Can you move? If it's too much, then...
Dialogue: Can you move? If it's too much, then...

Original: Celes:We'll be fine. We're not alone, after all.
Dialogue: We'll be fine. We're not alone, after all.

Original: Locke:Once they say they're going, they won't listen to anything else.
Dialogue: Once they say they're going, they won't listen to anything else.

Original: Locke:We've just agreed that if they don't feel good, we'll protect them.
Dialogue: We've just agreed that if they don't feel good, we'll protect them.

Original: Noel:I see... And you agree?
Dialogue: I see... And you agree?

Original: Terra:Yes. I can't be resting here while Kefka is still running rampant.
Dialogue: Yes. I can't be resting here while Kefka is still running rampant.

Original: Onion Knight:Even if you've been through a lot, you're as stubborn as always, Terra.
Dialogue: Even if you've been through a lot, you're as stubborn as always, Terra.

Original: Cloud:If you're ready, let's get moving.
Dialogue: If you're ready, let's get moving.

Original: Locke:Right. I want to settle this once and for all.
Dialogue: Right. I want to settle this once and for all.

Original: Kefka:Oh, baby, have I outdone myself this time!
Dialogue: Oh, baby, have I outdone myself this time!

Original: Kefka:This little guy is different from those plain gorgers. Dimensions it munches on'll be the energy it uses to get to other worlds!
Dialogue: This little guy is different from those plain gorgers. Dimensions it munches on'll be the energy it uses to get to other worlds!

Original: Kefka:It's waaay better than that sorry, moogle-sucking excuse for a parasite!
Dialogue: It's waaay better than that sorry, moogle-sucking excuse for a parasite!

Original: Kefka:...Don't you think?
Dialogue: ...Don't you think?

Original: Locke:I don't have words for you anymore. We came here to defeat you!
Dialogue: I don't have words for you anymore. We came here to defeat you!

Original: Kefka:Have a cigar! A birth is a joyous occasion! And it's all thanks to those wonderful magitek mamas!
Dialogue: Have a cigar! A birth is a joyous occasion! And it's all thanks to those wonderful magitek mamas!

Original: Kefka:Even as empty dolls, they were still able to give birth to something this magnifico!
Dialogue: Even as empty dolls, they were still able to give birth to something this magnifico!

Original: Kefka:Because I stuffed those hollow noggins of theirs with the darkest of dark emotions!
Dialogue: Because I stuffed those hollow noggins of theirs with the darkest of dark emotions!

Original: Noel:This guy is just the worst of all worlds.
Dialogue: This guy is just the worst of all worlds.

Original: Celes:He has nothing but thoughts of destruction in his head. You don't need to sympathize with him.
Dialogue: He has nothing but thoughts of destruction in his head. You don't need to sympathize with him.

Original: Noct:You don't need to tell me twice.
Dialogue: You don't need to tell me twice.

Original: Noel:I get it. I know which side I stand on.
Dialogue: I get it. I know which side I stand on.

Original: Kefka:What's this? Were you thinking to bully my bouncing baby Blackened Wilbur?
Dialogue: What's this? Were you thinking to bully my bouncing baby Blackened Wilbur?

Original: Kefka:Well sucks to be you! I also had my own little buff-fest this time!
Dialogue: Well sucks to be you! I also had my own little buff-fest this time!

Original: Kefka:I went ahead and stuffed all the brilliance, magic, will, et cetera I gathered for my little bundle of joy into myself, too!
Dialogue: I went ahead and stuffed all the brilliance, magic, will, et cetera I gathered for my little bundle of joy into myself, too!

Original: Noel:Watch out!
Dialogue: Watch out!

Original: Noct:Are you okay?
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Original: Noel:I may have been too rash, but look...!
Dialogue: I may have been too rash, but look...!

Original: Kefka:You worms are always, always, always getting in my way...
Dialogue: You worms are always, always, always getting in my way...

Original: Locke:Dammit! He's not messing around anymore!
Dialogue: Dammit! He's not messing around anymore!

Original: Kefka:I'll have them crush you until not even a speck of dust remains!
Dialogue: I'll have them crush you until not even a speck of dust remains!

Original: Locke:Are you guys ready?
Dialogue: Are you guys ready?

Original: Noct:I can go anytime! I won't let him have his way.
Dialogue: I can go anytime! I won't let him have his way.

Original: Noel:Same. I won't forgive anyone who tries to take the future away from others.
Dialogue: Same. I won't forgive anyone who tries to take the future away from others.

Original: Locke:Perfect. I won't stand by and let this clown go free. Let's get him!
Dialogue: Perfect. I won't stand by and let this clown go free. Let's get him!

Original: Kefka:You never learn...
Dialogue: You never learn...

Original: Kefka:Just what do you gain by clinging to life?
Dialogue: Just what do you gain by clinging to life?

Original: Noel:You'll always have a future as long as you don't give up.
Dialogue: You'll always have a future as long as you don't give up.

Original: Noel:I won't let this world be destroyed by you!
Dialogue: I won't let this world be destroyed by you!

Original: Locke:We waver no longer!
Dialogue: We waver no longer!

Original: Kefka:Ow, ow, ow! It hurts! My stomach hurts!
Dialogue: Ow, ow, ow! It hurts! My stomach hurts!

Original: Kefka:Hehehe! You made me laugh so hard, my sides are splitting!
Dialogue: Hehehe! You made me laugh so hard, my sides are splitting!

Original: Kefka:Did you think Willy was going to wait around while you were busy hitting me?
Dialogue: Did you think Willy was going to wait around while you were busy hitting me?

Original: Locke:The air is shaking...!?
Dialogue: The air is shaking...!?

Original: Noel:The Blackened Will is moving!
Dialogue: The Blackened Will is moving!

Original: Alisaie:How despicable... I can't move. Is this the end?
Dialogue: How despicable... I can't move. Is this the end?

Original: Kefka:And now a little bug is about to snuggle under this continent's rug!
Dialogue: And now a little bug is about to snuggle under this continent's rug!

Original: Kefka:Which means so long, and thanks for all the laughs! Kefka out!
Dialogue: Which means so long, and thanks for all the laughs! Kefka out!

Original: Mog:Kupo! If we don't stop it, the Blackened Will will go on a rampage!
Dialogue: Kupo! If we don't stop it, the Blackened Will will go on a rampage!

Original: Alisaie:If what he said is true, then it has unlimited energy to run rampant!
Dialogue: If what he said is true, then it has unlimited energy to run rampant!

Original: Warrior of Light:Is there no way to detect it?
Dialogue: Is there no way to detect it?

Original: Mog:No, kupo! The entire world is jumbled! It's like being in a storm, kupo!
Dialogue: No, kupo! The entire world is jumbled! It's like being in a storm, kupo!

Original: Mog:There's no way I can trace its movements with just my pompom, kupo!
Dialogue: There's no way I can trace its movements with just my pompom, kupo!

Original: Locke:So we have no way of finding it. This world is in danger!
Dialogue: So we have no way of finding it. This world is in danger!

Original: Mog:In any case, let's evacuate to the airship, kupo! This place might be corroded at any minute!
Dialogue: In any case, let's evacuate to the airship, kupo! This place might be corroded at any minute!

Original: Noel:Grab on! We're getting out of here!
Dialogue: Grab on! We're getting out of here!

Original: Locke:We can't stay here long!
Dialogue: We can't stay here long!

Original: Setzer:I'm here!
Dialogue: I'm here!

Original: Setzer:Quickly, get on, everyone!
Dialogue: Quickly, get on, everyone!

Original: Warrior of Light:I can't believe it... This world we tried so hard to protect is going to be consumed by that beast!
Dialogue: I can't believe it... This world we tried so hard to protect is going to be consumed by that beast!

Original: Locke:No, it won't. We're going to stop it! But we have to survive this first!
Dialogue: No, it won't. We're going to stop it! But we have to survive this first!

Original: Noel:Yeah. If we lose our lives here, we won't have a chance to retaliate!
Dialogue: Yeah. If we lose our lives here, we won't have a chance to retaliate!

Original: Noel:We won't give up!
Dialogue: We won't give up!

Original: Warrior of Light:But where...
Dialogue: But where...

Original: Warrior of Light:Where did it go!?
Dialogue: Where did it go!?

Original: Locke:Hey! I know you know what's going on here!
Dialogue: Hey! I know you know what's going on here!

Original: Materia:Yes... After being born anew, the Blackened Will fled...
Dialogue: Yes... After being born anew, the Blackened Will fled...

Original: Edgar:Finding out where it's gone is proving a difficult task.
Dialogue: Finding out where it's gone is proving a difficult task.

Original: Edgar:The corrosion is starting here in your world, is it not?
Dialogue: The corrosion is starting here in your world, is it not?

Original: Materia:That is true. I have tried to find its whereabouts, but...
Dialogue: That is true. I have tried to find its whereabouts, but...

Original: Materia:...It seems to be somewhere in the World of Illusions.
Dialogue: ...It seems to be somewhere in the World of Illusions.

Original: Chelinka:Do you know anything else?
Dialogue: Do you know anything else?

Original: Yuri:I thought you gods had the power to write new possibilities... Can't you do anything about it?
Dialogue: I thought you gods had the power to write new possibilities... Can't you do anything about it?

Original: Materia:The World of Illusions belongs to the summons. It's a place with an ambiguous connection to ours.
Dialogue: The World of Illusions belongs to the summons. It's a place with an ambiguous connection to ours.

Original: Locke:Can't you open it by force?
Dialogue: Can't you open it by force?

Original: Materia:Searching their world on my own is no easy feat. It will take time.
Dialogue: Searching their world on my own is no easy feat. It will take time.

Original: Spiritus:You asked the wrong god, pathetic warriors.
Dialogue: You asked the wrong god, pathetic warriors.

Original: Edgar:Spiritus... What brings you here to Materia's chambers?
Dialogue: Spiritus... What brings you here to Materia's chambers?

Original: Edgar:Seeing as you're the very one who summoned Kefka, I assumed you had no interest in this world.
Dialogue: Seeing as you're the very one who summoned Kefka, I assumed you had no interest in this world.

Original: Spiritus:I sought only those with power to protect my world.
Dialogue: I sought only those with power to protect my world.

Original: Yuri:So you really didn't expect someone would destroy that very world...
Dialogue: So you really didn't expect someone would destroy that very world...

Original: Spiritus:I will take the blame in place of that powerless goddess.
Dialogue: I will take the blame in place of that powerless goddess.

Original: Spiritus:Now go!
Dialogue: Now go!

Original: Locke:Can we find Kefka through there?
Dialogue: Can we find Kefka through there?

Original: Spiritus:I detect the urge to destroy within... This will certainly put you in the right direction.
Dialogue: I detect the urge to destroy within... This will certainly put you in the right direction.

Original: Materia:Wait. Simply pointing my warriors toward the enemy is not enough...
Dialogue: Wait. Simply pointing my warriors toward the enemy is not enough...

Original: Materia:Let me guide you...!
Dialogue: Let me guide you...!

Original: Materia:I've fine-tuned the portal with dimensional coordinates. Now you will definitely find Kefka.
Dialogue: I've fine-tuned the portal with dimensional coordinates. Now you will definitely find Kefka.

Original: Edgar:These gods have done nothing but fight up until this very moment... And now we have no choice but to put our faith in them.
Dialogue: These gods have done nothing but fight up until this very moment... And now we have no choice but to put our faith in them.

Original: Locke:Right... Well, let's get moving. Kefka's waiting!
Dialogue: Right... Well, let's get moving. Kefka's waiting!

Original: Kefka:Hehehe... You vermin sure sniffed me out!
Dialogue: Hehehe... You vermin sure sniffed me out!

Original: Onion Knight:Vermin? Look who's talking.
Dialogue: Vermin? Look who's talking.

Original: Lenna:We were supposed to have come out in the World of Illusions... But this place is filled with evil will...
Dialogue: We were supposed to have come out in the World of Illusions... But this place is filled with evil will...

Original: Lenna:It's like we're inside a Torsion.
Dialogue: It's like we're inside a Torsion.

Original: Kefka:So glad you noticed! It's a custom make.
Dialogue: So glad you noticed! It's a custom make.

Original: Kefka:My darling Wilbur snacked on bits and pieces of the world and made its very own nest!
Dialogue: My darling Wilbur snacked on bits and pieces of the world and made its very own nest!

Original: Warrior of Light:We must destroy this world before it's too late. I can feel the darkness swelling up...
Dialogue: We must destroy this world before it's too late. I can feel the darkness swelling up...

Original: Kefka:Bingo! It was nurtured by yours truly!
Dialogue: Bingo! It was nurtured by yours truly!

Original: Kefka:It's chock-full of destructive energy and ready to burst any minute now!
Dialogue: It's chock-full of destructive energy and ready to burst any minute now!

Original: Celes:We won't let you! You won't hurt anyone again!
Dialogue: We won't let you! You won't hurt anyone again!

Original: Kefka:I'd like to see you try! This place is evil will given form.
Dialogue: I'd like to see you try! This place is evil will given form.

Original: Kefka:You won't stand a chance in here! You'll be squashed like the vermin you are!
Dialogue: You won't stand a chance in here! You'll be squashed like the vermin you are!

Original: Onion Knight:If he thinks he can just watch us from the sidelines, he's got another think coming.
Dialogue: If he thinks he can just watch us from the sidelines, he's got another think coming.

Original: Onion Knight:But we need to destroy the Blackened Will first.
Dialogue: But we need to destroy the Blackened Will first.

Original: Warrior of Light:No matter how perilous the road, we will traverse it!
Dialogue: No matter how perilous the road, we will traverse it!

Original: Celes:Yes. We'll pluck all the weeds from this world!
Dialogue: Yes. We'll pluck all the weeds from this world!

Original: Mog:I don't feel so good, kupo...
Dialogue: I don't feel so good, kupo...

Original: Lenna:Are you okay? Is something wrong?
Dialogue: Are you okay? Is something wrong?

Original: Mog:I think it's because I was possessed by the Blackened Will before, kupo...
Dialogue: I think it's because I was possessed by the Blackened Will before, kupo...

Original: Mog:It's a weird request, kupo, but... Please don't listen to me until the Blackened Will is destroyed.
Dialogue: It's a weird request, kupo, but... Please don't listen to me until the Blackened Will is destroyed.

Original: Onion Knight:You think it might still be controlling you?
Dialogue: You think it might still be controlling you?

Original: Mog:Kupo... I don't want to be a bother, kupo.
Dialogue: Kupo... I don't want to be a bother, kupo.

Original: Celes:Everyone believes in you, Mog. We're not going to start doubting you now.
Dialogue: Everyone believes in you, Mog. We're not going to start doubting you now.

Original: Lenna:But he really looks bad... He needs to rest.
Dialogue: But he really looks bad... He needs to rest.

Original: Warrior of Light:Searching for the Blackened Will will be harder than ever without Mog...
Dialogue: Searching for the Blackened Will will be harder than ever without Mog...

Original: Warrior of Light:We should make sure we're duly prepared for the road ahead.
Dialogue: We should make sure we're duly prepared for the road ahead.

Original: Kefka:Well, well! The fighting energy here sure is intense!
Dialogue: Well, well! The fighting energy here sure is intense!

Original: Tidus:Hey! There he is!
Dialogue: Hey! There he is!

Original: Cloud:Looks like he's out of luck.
Dialogue: Looks like he's out of luck.

Original: Edgar:Not even death would be enough punishment for his deeds. Perhaps we could imprison him between dimensions.
Dialogue: Not even death would be enough punishment for his deeds. Perhaps we could imprison him between dimensions.

Original: Laguna:Nice thinking! You're gonna pay for all you've put us through!
Dialogue: Nice thinking! You're gonna pay for all you've put us through!

Original: Kefka:Hehehe. All I've put you through has generated the energy I wanted!
Dialogue: Hehehe. All I've put you through has generated the energy I wanted!

Original: Kefka:And I took, thankyouverymucho!
Dialogue: And I took, thankyouverymucho!

Original: Zidane:Do you think this guy is using our battle energy to feed the Blackened Will!?
Dialogue: Do you think this guy is using our battle energy to feed the Blackened Will!?

Original: Kefka:I also nibble on some of it to keep my super-ultra-maximum buff-fest rolling!
Dialogue: I also nibble on some of it to keep my super-ultra-maximum buff-fest rolling!

Original: Kefka:Which makes you soggy paper straws before my drink bar of ruin!
Dialogue: Which makes you soggy paper straws before my drink bar of ruin!
