Dialogue: Are they painful memories? Were they better off not remembered...?

Original: Thancred:No. I couldn't forgive myself if I forgot.
Dialogue: No. I couldn't forgive myself if I forgot.

Original: Noel:Even though you went through all that trouble remembering...
Dialogue: Even though you went through all that trouble remembering...

Original: Thancred:There is no need for that. I am old enough to deal with this.
Dialogue: There is no need for that. I am old enough to deal with this.

Original: Thancred:That's right. I caught a glimpse of something my manikin saw.
Dialogue: That's right. I caught a glimpse of something my manikin saw.

Original: Thancred:It seems like the dark manikins managed to escape from Kam'lanaut.
Dialogue: It seems like the dark manikins managed to escape from Kam'lanaut.

Original: Thancred:The other two manikins should be in a safe location somewhere.
Dialogue: The other two manikins should be in a safe location somewhere.

Original: Caius:Indeed... They are somewhere that man will not find them.
Dialogue: Indeed... They are somewhere that man will not find them.

Original: Caius:Noel. It seems you have not gotten the respite promised by the gods.
Dialogue: Noel. It seems you have not gotten the respite promised by the gods.

Original: Caius:Turning such hatred and sadness toward your master...
Dialogue: Turning such hatred and sadness toward your master...

Original: Caius:Had you merely forgotten, you would not have greeted me with different emotions.
Dialogue: Had you merely forgotten, you would not have greeted me with different emotions.

Original: Noel:Grr... Why are you here!?
Dialogue: Grr... Why are you here!?

Original: Papalymo:You said you were sheltering the dark manikins?
Dialogue: You said you were sheltering the dark manikins?

Original: Caius:Yes, her manikin at least...
Dialogue: Yes, her manikin at least...

Original: Lyse:Is there something you want to say to me?
Dialogue: Is there something you want to say to me?

Original: Caius:There are things you do not want to know in your puppet's memories.
Dialogue: There are things you do not want to know in your puppet's memories.

Original: Caius:Are you pursuing her even knowing that?
Dialogue: Are you pursuing her even knowing that?

Original: Lyse:...Yes. I had a feeling that something bad had happened in my memories.
Dialogue: ...Yes. I had a feeling that something bad had happened in my memories.

Original: Lyse:But I know I can't go on without them. Like Thancred, I...
Dialogue: But I know I can't go on without them. Like Thancred, I...

Original: Lyse:I couldn't forgive myself if I forgot.
Dialogue: I couldn't forgive myself if I forgot.

Original: Lyse:Aren't you the same, Papalymo?
Dialogue: Aren't you the same, Papalymo?

Original: Papalymo:Yes, indeed.
Dialogue: Yes, indeed.

Original: Caius:How regrettable.
Dialogue: How regrettable.

Original: Caius:Such sadness should be a puppet's burden to bear. You should not let the opportunity to live in ignorant bliss pass you by.
Dialogue: Such sadness should be a puppet's burden to bear. You should not let the opportunity to live in ignorant bliss pass you by.

Original: Noel:How dare you say that about the memories of others!
Dialogue: How dare you say that about the memories of others!

Original: Noel:But in truth, you...
Dialogue: But in truth, you...

Original: Lyse:She was...precious to you.
Dialogue: She was...precious to you.

Original: Galuf:Even if you forget, reality itself remains unchanged.
Dialogue: Even if you forget, reality itself remains unchanged.

Original: Galuf:You cannot change destiny.
Dialogue: You cannot change destiny.

Original: Lyse:I can't stop here.
Dialogue: I can't stop here.

Original: Papalymo:I concur. If you wish to hinder us, I will have to fight you.
Dialogue: I concur. If you wish to hinder us, I will have to fight you.

Original: Caius:Then show me your resolve!
Dialogue: Then show me your resolve!

Original: Lyse:I saw my future self in my manikin...
Dialogue: I saw my future self in my manikin...

Original: Lyse:Even if that were the case, I can't go on forgetting!
Dialogue: Even if that were the case, I can't go on forgetting!

Original: Noel:Caius... Do you really sympathize with Lyse?
Dialogue: Caius... Do you really sympathize with Lyse?

Original: Noel:Or do you just plan on using her!?
Dialogue: Or do you just plan on using her!?

Original: Caius:I am here to see her resolve. It has nothing to do with you.
Dialogue: I am here to see her resolve. It has nothing to do with you.

Original: Caius:Now, Lyse... Show me how determined you are to get everything back.
Dialogue: Now, Lyse... Show me how determined you are to get everything back.

Original: Caius:You will find your memories beyond here.
Dialogue: You will find your memories beyond here.

Original: Lyse:Is that where my manikin is?
Dialogue: Is that where my manikin is?

Original: Noel:You want us to save her?
Dialogue: You want us to save her?

Original: Caius:I have always only held one objective.
Dialogue: I have always only held one objective.

Original: Caius:To test the road to the future countless times...to guide it to the correct future.
Dialogue: To test the road to the future countless times...to guide it to the correct future.

Original: Caius:Make haste for she did not heed my warnings...
Dialogue: Make haste for she did not heed my warnings...

Original: Caius:She may already be back at that man's side.
Dialogue: She may already be back at that man's side.

Original: Lyse:Let's go.
Dialogue: Let's go.

Original: Lenna:You don't doubt him?
Dialogue: You don't doubt him?

Original: Lyse:As long as we're together, we can overcome anything...even if it is a trap.
Dialogue: As long as we're together, we can overcome anything...even if it is a trap.

Original: Deuce:I'm so happy you can rely on us.
Dialogue: I'm so happy you can rely on us.

Original: Lyse:I'm sure my manikin...couldn't have overcome those memories alone.
Dialogue: I'm sure my manikin...couldn't have overcome those memories alone.

Original: Lyse:I can't do anything alone. I know that.
Dialogue: I can't do anything alone. I know that.

Original: Lyse:But I don't plan to rely only on my friends. I'll fight with all my might!
Dialogue: But I don't plan to rely only on my friends. I'll fight with all my might!

Original: Deuce:The dark manikin Lyse is spiraling out of control all by herself...
Dialogue: The dark manikin Lyse is spiraling out of control all by herself...

Original: Lyse:Yes! We have to stop her!
Dialogue: Yes! We have to stop her!

Original: Lyse:She's me, after all. There's no way she can do it alone, so...
Dialogue: She's me, after all. There's no way she can do it alone, so...

Original: Lenna:We will help. We're your friends, so don't look so down.
Dialogue: We will help. We're your friends, so don't look so down.

Original: Lyse:Thank you!
Dialogue: Thank you!

Original: Papalymo:I am surprised... Do you really not have your memories?
Dialogue: I am surprised... Do you really not have your memories?

Original: Lyse:What do you mean, Papalymo?
Dialogue: What do you mean, Papalymo?

Original: Papalymo:Exactly what I said.
Dialogue: Exactly what I said.

Original: Papalymo:Let us be on our way, partner.
Dialogue: Let us be on our way, partner.

Original: Papalymo:We have a manikin to save.
Dialogue: We have a manikin to save.

Original: Lyse:Yes! Full speed ahead!
Dialogue: Yes! Full speed ahead!

Original: Thancred:You two could sense it the whole time. Now I know why it felt so different.
Dialogue: You two could sense it the whole time. Now I know why it felt so different.

Original: Thancred:Alphinaud, Alisaie... You both had the memories that I lost, didn't you?
Dialogue: Alphinaud, Alisaie... You both had the memories that I lost, didn't you?

Original: Alphinaud:We had planned not to say anything, as there is no meaning in not remembering it yourself...
Dialogue: We had planned not to say anything, as there is no meaning in not remembering it yourself...

Original: Alisaie:But you and the others thought there was something weird about us.
Dialogue: But you and the others thought there was something weird about us.

Original: Thancred:I can't just let things that bother me go. I thought it had something to do with my memories.
Dialogue: I can't just let things that bother me go. I thought it had something to do with my memories.

Original: Thancred:Y'shtola and Papalymo probably thought the same.
Dialogue: Y'shtola and Papalymo probably thought the same.

Original: Alisaie:In any case, I'm just glad to see them okay.
Dialogue: In any case, I'm just glad to see them okay.

Original: Alisaie:This is a world where puppets can move and think in the same way as their originals.
Dialogue: This is a world where puppets can move and think in the same way as their originals.

Original: Alphinaud:I had my doubts on whether or not you, Papalymo, and the others were the real deal.
Dialogue: I had my doubts on whether or not you, Papalymo, and the others were the real deal.

Original: Thancred:Sorry to worry you. But thanks to you, we managed to get ourselves back.
Dialogue: Sorry to worry you. But thanks to you, we managed to get ourselves back.

Original: Alphinaud:You must have been worried, too.
Dialogue: You must have been worried, too.

Original: Alisaie:So there's no need to apologize.
Dialogue: So there's no need to apologize.

Original: Alisaie:Though it is hard for us to judge whether or not our own memories are complete...
Dialogue: Though it is hard for us to judge whether or not our own memories are complete...

Original: Alphinaud:Nevertheless, we are happy to meet old friends once more.
Dialogue: Nevertheless, we are happy to meet old friends once more.

Original: Thancred:Same here. Now to get the memories of the others back.
Dialogue: Same here. Now to get the memories of the others back.

Original: Kam'lanaut:I do not understand. Why have you returned?
Dialogue: I do not understand. Why have you returned?

Original: Dark Manikin (Lyse):Because I don't want to have any regrets.
Dialogue: Because I don't want to have any regrets.

Original: Dark Manikin (Lyse):I can't let Shinryu go unchecked...!
Dialogue: I can't let Shinryu go unchecked...!

Original: Kam'lanaut:How entertaining... You just don't know when to give up.
Dialogue: How entertaining... You just don't know when to give up.

Original: Kam'lanaut:You possess a very strong will...because within you are powerful memories.
Dialogue: You possess a very strong will...because within you are powerful memories.

Original: Kam'lanaut:In that case, perhaps it is your original who is the hollow puppet now.
Dialogue: In that case, perhaps it is your original who is the hollow puppet now.

Original: Kam'lanaut:But I have no need for your will any longer. I haven't time to trifle with foolish humans.
Dialogue: But I have no need for your will any longer. I haven't time to trifle with foolish humans.

Original: Kam'lanaut:I must rewrite this world...
Dialogue: I must rewrite this world...

Original: Dark Manikin (Lyse):I can...still fight...!
Dialogue: I can...still fight...!

Original: Lyse:We're here to help!
Dialogue: We're here to help!

Original: Lyse:I should ask you the same. Why did you come here? This is too big a fight to go alone.
Dialogue: I should ask you the same. Why did you come here? This is too big a fight to go alone.

Original: Lyse:I know because you and I are the same. Right?
Dialogue: I know because you and I are the same. Right?

Original: Dark Manikin (Lyse):How did you get your memories back?
Dialogue: How did you get your memories back?

Original: Alphinaud:Unfortunately, that doesn't seem to be the case. People's mental state changes moment by moment.
Dialogue: Unfortunately, that doesn't seem to be the case. People's mental state changes moment by moment.

Original: Faris:You didn't give Lyse her memories back because you were worried, weren't you?
Dialogue: You didn't give Lyse her memories back because you were worried, weren't you?

Original: Faris:It seems she understands that.
Dialogue: It seems she understands that.

Original: Dark Manikin (Lyse):I... I just...
Dialogue: I... I just...

Original: Lyse:Hey, Papalymo. Doesn't that Shinryu seem weird to you?
Dialogue: Hey, Papalymo. Doesn't that Shinryu seem weird to you?

Original: Lyse:It's being protected by something...
Dialogue: It's being protected by something...

Original: Papalymo:It may be like that barrier the archduke created the last time we encountered it...
Dialogue: It may be like that barrier the archduke created the last time we encountered it...

Original: Alphinaud:It needs to preserve this space. It's a protective barrier.
Dialogue: It needs to preserve this space. It's a protective barrier.

Original: Papalymo:A burdensome seal.
Dialogue: A burdensome seal.

Original: Papalymo:(My manikin from the World of Darkness sacrificed himself to break through that thing...)
Dialogue: (My manikin from the World of Darkness sacrificed himself to break through that thing...)

Original: Papalymo:Once more, I will...!
Dialogue: Once more, I will...!

Original: Lyse:There must be another way, Papalymo!
Dialogue: There must be another way, Papalymo!

Original: Papalymo:You don't mean "What do we do!?"
Dialogue: You don't mean "What do we do!?"

Original: Lyse:You wanted to be cool, didn't you?
Dialogue: You wanted to be cool, didn't you?

Original: Lyse:But my manikin has been trying her very best!
Dialogue: But my manikin has been trying her very best!

Original: Papalymo:You're right... We will fight together.
Dialogue: You're right... We will fight together.

Original: Bartz:Yes, we will. There's no need for any of us to fight alone!
Dialogue: Yes, we will. There's no need for any of us to fight alone!

Original: Dark Manikin (Lyse):That might have...hurt, a little.
Dialogue: That might have...hurt, a little.

Original: Lyse:Were you protecting me...?
Dialogue: Were you protecting me...?

Original: Dark Manikin (Lyse):It's okay. Even if I disappear, your memories won't.
Dialogue: It's okay. Even if I disappear, your memories won't.

Original: Dark Manikin (Lyse):I can give them to you... This brilliance...
Dialogue: I can give them to you... This brilliance...

Original: Lyse:I see... So that's what happened...
Dialogue: I see... So that's what happened...

Original: Lyse:I can fight! I'm ready!
Dialogue: I can fight! I'm ready!

Original: Faris:Aren't you shaken from remembering it all? You don't have to fight.
Dialogue: Aren't you shaken from remembering it all? You don't have to fight.

Original: Lyse:I know. But I will fight. No... I have to!
Dialogue: I know. But I will fight. No... I have to!

Original: Lyse:I'm done hiding behind someone else's back!
Dialogue: I'm done hiding behind someone else's back!

Original: Mog:Kupo kupo! It seems like my pom-pom is working again, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo kupo! It seems like my pom-pom is working again, kupo!

Original: Lion:We defeated Shinryu, but Kam'lanaut's world is still here.
Dialogue: We defeated Shinryu, but Kam'lanaut's world is still here.

Original: Mog:It's because he has a strong will, kupo.
Dialogue: It's because he has a strong will, kupo.

Original: Mog:But I can find that will with my pom-pom! He's definitely that way, kupo!
Dialogue: But I can find that will with my pom-pom! He's definitely that way, kupo!

Original: Lion:We've got to stop him. Come on!
Dialogue: We've got to stop him. Come on!

Original: Prishe:There's no need to rush. We're all together.
Dialogue: There's no need to rush. We're all together.

Original: Y'shtola:Still, we should not stay in this unstable atmosphere too long.
Dialogue: Still, we should not stay in this unstable atmosphere too long.

Original: Y'shtola:He is undoubtedly waiting up ahead.
Dialogue: He is undoubtedly waiting up ahead.

Original: Papalymo:Did you get your brilliance back?
Dialogue: Did you get your brilliance back?

Original: Lyse:Yes... I remember. I can't believe I forgot something so important.
Dialogue: Yes... I remember. I can't believe I forgot something so important.

Original: Lyse:But...it's okay. I think I'm getting used to everything, including my weaknesses.
Dialogue: But...it's okay. I think I'm getting used to everything, including my weaknesses.

Original: Papalymo:I was a little worried, but...no longer.
Dialogue: I was a little worried, but...no longer.

Original: Papalymo:My memories seem like they are cut off...
Dialogue: My memories seem like they are cut off...

Original: Papalymo:But I am sure you remember much more clearly what happened after the incident.
Dialogue: But I am sure you remember much more clearly what happened after the incident.

Original: Lyse:I'll tell you about it. Now I know more than you about the future.
Dialogue: I'll tell you about it. Now I know more than you about the future.

Original: Papalymo:I never thought I would see the day I would hear such a thing. I am blessed to be your guardian.
Dialogue: I never thought I would see the day I would hear such a thing. I am blessed to be your guardian.

Original: Lyse:We're "partners," right? What did you mean by that?
Dialogue: We're "partners," right? What did you mean by that?

Original: Papalymo:Exactly what I said.
Dialogue: Exactly what I said.

Original: Lyse:It was a difficult time, so...get ready to hear an epic tale.
Dialogue: It was a difficult time, so...get ready to hear an epic tale.

Original: Lyse:Everyone. Including...that person.
Dialogue: Everyone. Including...that person.

Original: Lyse:I have so many things to tell you.
Dialogue: I have so many things to tell you.

Original: Lyse:It would take days to tell. I hope you're ready to hear it all.
Dialogue: It would take days to tell. I hope you're ready to hear it all.

Original: Papalymo:I look forward to it. But...at another time.
Dialogue: I look forward to it. But...at another time.

Original: Lyse:You're right. There's still a dark manikin missing...
Dialogue: You're right. There's still a dark manikin missing...

Original: Lyse:We can't just let them be here in this unstable space.
Dialogue: We can't just let them be here in this unstable space.

Original: Papalymo:You did well, Lyse.
Dialogue: You did well, Lyse.

Original: Lyse:...That's not fair. You can't go around pretending like you know everything!
Dialogue: ...That's not fair. You can't go around pretending like you know everything!

Original: Papalymo:I understand.
Dialogue: I understand.

Original: Papalymo:Because you are my second partner.
Dialogue: Because you are my second partner.

Original: Lyse:We went forward with all our might.
Dialogue: We went forward with all our might.

Original: Lyse:Because I didn't want to ignore the things only I could do or the feelings I was entrusted with.
Dialogue: Because I didn't want to ignore the things only I could do or the feelings I was entrusted with.

Original: Lyse:But...when we succeeded, and I wanted to share my happiness...
Dialogue: But...when we succeeded, and I wanted to share my happiness...

Original: Lyse:All together...
Dialogue: All together...

Original: Papalymo:I'm sorry.
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Original: Lyse:I know it can't be helped. But...just for now...
Dialogue: I know it can't be helped. But...just for now...

Original: Lyse:Just for now...even if it's just a little...can I rest?
Dialogue: Just for now...even if it's just a little...can I rest?

Original: Papalymo:Yes, of course.
Dialogue: Yes, of course.

Original: Lyse:I was so sure I was ready, but...
Dialogue: I was so sure I was ready, but...

Original: Lyse:I wasn't. It hurts...
Dialogue: I wasn't. It hurts...

Original: Papalymo:(Even if this is a fake world, and the respite is transient at best...)
Dialogue: (Even if this is a fake world, and the respite is transient at best...)

Original: Papalymo:(The emotions on Lyse's face here...are real.)
Dialogue: (The emotions on Lyse's face here...are real.)

Original: Papalymo:(The future of my second partner...that which I should not have been able to see...is right before my eyes.)
Dialogue: (The future of my second partner...that which I should not have been able to see...is right before my eyes.)

Original: Thancred:By some fate, we are able to fight together again.
Dialogue: By some fate, we are able to fight together again.

Original: Papalymo:Though it is a battle forced on us by the gods...
Dialogue: Though it is a battle forced on us by the gods...

Original: Thancred:Still...I'm happy.
Dialogue: Still...I'm happy.

Original: Papalymo:I gave you a difficult task.
Dialogue: I gave you a difficult task.

Original: Thancred:If you were me, you would have done the same, wouldn't you?
Dialogue: If you were me, you would have done the same, wouldn't you?

Original: Papalymo:I wonder. I am by far your senior by length of service.
Dialogue: I wonder. I am by far your senior by length of service.

Original: Galuf:Hoho. Papalymo, you're still too young to say that.
Dialogue: Hoho. Papalymo, you're still too young to say that.

Original: Auron:If one's life is determined by the order of "that time," then you've still got a ways to go in this world.
Dialogue: If one's life is determined by the order of "that time," then you've still got a ways to go in this world.

Original: Papalymo:Indeed... What a strange place.
Dialogue: Indeed... What a strange place.

Original: Papalymo:Having your memories taken, then being forced to fight is selfish of the gods. I am also curious about what's happening back home.
Dialogue: Having your memories taken, then being forced to fight is selfish of the gods. I am also curious about what's happening back home.

Original: Papalymo:But traveling with companions from other worlds allowed Lyse to grow even without her memories.
Dialogue: But traveling with companions from other worlds allowed Lyse to grow even without her memories.

Original: Auron:She was able to recall the past, even without her memories...
Dialogue: She was able to recall the past, even without her memories...

Original: Thancred:Our memories may have been toyed with for someone's convenience, but we cannot say for sure.
Dialogue: Our memories may have been toyed with for someone's convenience, but we cannot say for sure.

Original: Galuf:Do you all think the gods are terrible?
Dialogue: Do you all think the gods are terrible?

Original: Thancred:The worst part is that they bear no ill will...
Dialogue: The worst part is that they bear no ill will...

Original: Auron:We cannot do anything about being called here by them. We must do what we can.
Dialogue: We cannot do anything about being called here by them. We must do what we can.

Original: Galuf:Wouldn't it be nice to have time to enjoy it?
Dialogue: Wouldn't it be nice to have time to enjoy it?

Original: Papalymo:I doubt that will happen.
Dialogue: I doubt that will happen.

Original: Galuf:A wise man you are.
Dialogue: A wise man you are.

Original: Galuf:Go to the side of your partner. She is waiting for you.
Dialogue: Go to the side of your partner. She is waiting for you.

Original: Papalymo:I suppose I should...
Dialogue: I suppose I should...

Original: Kam'lanaut:So you are the ones who broke Shinryu's barrier...
Dialogue: So you are the ones who broke Shinryu's barrier...

Original: Shantotto:Ohoho! It was foolish of you to think we couldn't get through!
Dialogue: Ohoho! It was foolish of you to think we couldn't get through!

Original: Alisaie:This place cannot stand for long without the dark manikins.
Dialogue: This place cannot stand for long without the dark manikins.

Original: Lion:This is the end!
Dialogue: This is the end!

Original: Kam'lanaut:Hmph... While basking in the benefits of this half-hearted world...
Dialogue: Hmph... While basking in the benefits of this half-hearted world...

Original: Kam'lanaut:You dare to try and stop me?
Dialogue: You dare to try and stop me?

Original: Shantotto:I think even the "half-hearted" gods would be dismayed by this world you've made.
Dialogue: I think even the "half-hearted" gods would be dismayed by this world you've made.

Original: Shantotto:Your ideal is nothing more than a bore!
Dialogue: Your ideal is nothing more than a bore!

Original: Kam'lanaut:I could not expect imperfect beings such as yourselves to understand the true world.
Dialogue: I could not expect imperfect beings such as yourselves to understand the true world.

Original: Kam'lanaut:It may feel like you accepted a reality different from the ideal...
Dialogue: It may feel like you accepted a reality different from the ideal...

Original: Kam'lanaut:But your heart is suffering from the shackles placed upon it.
Dialogue: But your heart is suffering from the shackles placed upon it.

Original: Lyse:So you think my memories are shackles on my heart.
Dialogue: So you think my memories are shackles on my heart.

Original: Lyse:Well, you're wrong!
Dialogue: Well, you're wrong!

Original: Lyse:Even if they hurt, they will help me grow!
Dialogue: Even if they hurt, they will help me grow!

Original: Kam'lanaut:I did not wish to use my power here...
Dialogue: I did not wish to use my power here...

Original: Kam'lanaut:But you leave me little choice. I will rob you of your wills for the sake of paradise!
Dialogue: But you leave me little choice. I will rob you of your wills for the sake of paradise!

Original: Kam'lanaut:There is no way for imperfect humans to enter Paradise...
Dialogue: There is no way for imperfect humans to enter Paradise...

Original: Bartz:That's quite the statement for someone born among humans!
Dialogue: That's quite the statement for someone born among humans!

Original: Lyse:We won't give up...on reality!
Dialogue: We won't give up...on reality!

Original: Kam'lanaut:No... This cannot be...!
Dialogue: No... This cannot be...!

Original: Lion:This is it!
Dialogue: This is it!

Original: Eald'narche:I grow tired of watching this.
Dialogue: I grow tired of watching this.

Original: Alphinaud:You are the one Lion spoke of before.
Dialogue: You are the one Lion spoke of before.

Original: Lion:So big brother was summoned here after all.
Dialogue: So big brother was summoned here after all.

Original: Bartz:You mean Kam'lanaut is the younger one?
Dialogue: You mean Kam'lanaut is the younger one?

Original: Eald'narche:Appearances can be deceiving.
Dialogue: Appearances can be deceiving.

Original: Eald'narche:Though I do not know how your worlds work, crystal bearers of other worlds...
Dialogue: Though I do not know how your worlds work, crystal bearers of other worlds...

Original: Bartz:You're the one who told us how to get out of the forest!
Dialogue: You're the one who told us how to get out of the forest!

Original: Lyse:We didn't know if you were on our side or not...!
Dialogue: We didn't know if you were on our side or not...!

Original: Eald'narche:Have you gotten your memories back? You've grown a little stronger, but...
Dialogue: Have you gotten your memories back? You've grown a little stronger, but...

Original: Caius:...It did not meet your expectations.
Dialogue: ...It did not meet your expectations.

Original: Alphinaud:One after the other... If they attack at once, we won't stand a chance.
Dialogue: One after the other... If they attack at once, we won't stand a chance.

Original: Kam'lanaut:Why have you come here!?
Dialogue: Why have you come here!?

Original: Eald'narche:I should be the one asking you that. What are you doing?
Dialogue: I should be the one asking you that. What are you doing?

Original: Eald'narche:Thinking yourself capable of making the true world... How conceited can you be?
Dialogue: Thinking yourself capable of making the true world... How conceited can you be?

Original: Lyse:I guess they aren't friends...
Dialogue: I guess they aren't friends...

Original: Caius:There is no alliance among us here.
Dialogue: There is no alliance among us here.

Original: Caius:I just happened to arrive in this world a little earlier than him. That is all.
Dialogue: I just happened to arrive in this world a little earlier than him. That is all.

Original: Eald'narche:Now then, aside from that vain god, there must be something else worth seeing here.
Dialogue: Now then, aside from that vain god, there must be something else worth seeing here.

Original: Caius:You must be a new warrior... Perhaps you know Kam'lanaut?
Dialogue: You must be a new warrior... Perhaps you know Kam'lanaut?

Original: Eald'narche:What makes you think that?
Dialogue: What makes you think that?

Original: Caius:Is the answer important to you?
Dialogue: Is the answer important to you?

Original: Eald'narche:Perhaps. What do you know of him?
Dialogue: Perhaps. What do you know of him?

Original: Caius:He tried to rewrite the laws of this world and create a subspace he called the true world.
Dialogue: He tried to rewrite the laws of this world and create a subspace he called the true world.

Original: Caius:I have yet to meet him, but heard his exploits from a puppet he was using to those ends.
Dialogue: I have yet to meet him, but heard his exploits from a puppet he was using to those ends.

Original: Eald'narche:He created the true world? Don't make me laugh!
Dialogue: He created the true world? Don't make me laugh!

Original: Eald'narche:He is not capable of reproducing the paradise where the gods reside.
Dialogue: He is not capable of reproducing the paradise where the gods reside.

Original: Caius:The residence of the gods is a paradise? Is that how your world works?
Dialogue: The residence of the gods is a paradise? Is that how your world works?

Original: Caius:It is so very different than my own.
Dialogue: It is so very different than my own.

Original: Eald'narche:Only perfect beings may enter that paradise, and yet he would use puppets...
Dialogue: Only perfect beings may enter that paradise, and yet he would use puppets...

Original: Eald'narche:...We will leave that for now.
Dialogue: ...We will leave that for now.

Original: Eald'narche:Can you show me where he is?
Dialogue: Can you show me where he is?

Original: Caius:So he is one who can use and dispose of others without hesitation... There is something you should know.
Dialogue: So he is one who can use and dispose of others without hesitation... There is something you should know.

Original: Caius:You can pass through dimensions like this. Follow the coordinates and aim for your destination.
Dialogue: You can pass through dimensions like this. Follow the coordinates and aim for your destination.

Original: Caius:I have seen you to your destination. What you do now is up to you.
Dialogue: I have seen you to your destination. What you do now is up to you.

Original: Eald'narche:I thought it impossible, but to see you commit such an unsightly blunder here is...disappointing.
Dialogue: I thought it impossible, but to see you commit such an unsightly blunder here is...disappointing.

Original: Eald'narche:I will correct my brother's failure and bury this space at the end of the dimension.
Dialogue: I will correct my brother's failure and bury this space at the end of the dimension.

Original: Lion:What do you mean!?
Dialogue: What do you mean!?

Original: Eald'narche:How annoying... Hold your tongue!
Dialogue: How annoying... Hold your tongue!

Original: Eald'narche:I do not want to have to fight you...
Dialogue: I do not want to have to fight you...

Original: Alphinaud:He captured the last dark manikin!
Dialogue: He captured the last dark manikin!

Original: Eald'narche:I think you know this, but she has memories from her original.
Dialogue: I think you know this, but she has memories from her original.

Original: Eald'narche:Allow me to use her, too. Now have fun playing with this puppet.
Dialogue: Allow me to use her, too. Now have fun playing with this puppet.

Original: Alphinaud:He is using dark manikins as a shield so he can escape!
Dialogue: He is using dark manikins as a shield so he can escape!

Original: Eald'narche:Did you think I would fight you? You are so very conceited...
Dialogue: Did you think I would fight you? You are so very conceited...

Original: Eald'narche:This puppet is more than you deserve.
Dialogue: This puppet is more than you deserve.

Original: Y'shtola:It cannot be helped. Even if we have to sacrifice my memories, we must go after him!
Dialogue: It cannot be helped. Even if we have to sacrifice my memories, we must go after him!

Original: Lyse:No, Y'shtola!
Dialogue: No, Y'shtola!

Original: Lyse:We are going to save her! We will stop them!
Dialogue: We are going to save her! We will stop them!

Original: Y'shtola:Thank you...
Dialogue: Thank you...

Original: Y'shtola:I will get my memories back with these hands of mine.
Dialogue: I will get my memories back with these hands of mine.

Original: Dark Manikin (Y'shtola):Gck...!
Dialogue: Gck...!

Original: Y'shtola:After casting that magic, you were captured and ran rampant...
Dialogue: After casting that magic, you were captured and ran rampant...

Original: Y'shtola:But I will release you. Leave the rest to me!
Dialogue: But I will release you. Leave the rest to me!

Original: Eald'narche:All those pitiful puppets were nothing more than trash...
Dialogue: All those pitiful puppets were nothing more than trash...

Original: Eald'narche:But no matter... I will put a quick end to their originals, too.
Dialogue: But no matter... I will put a quick end to their originals, too.

Original: Lion:We will stop you, no matter what you're scheming!
Dialogue: We will stop you, no matter what you're scheming!

Original: Eald'narche:Putting on the air of the hero... Don't you know that this is a false world?
Dialogue: Putting on the air of the hero... Don't you know that this is a false world?

Original: Eald'narche:If you still have strength, destroy them!
Dialogue: If you still have strength, destroy them!

Original: Kam'lanaut:Make no mistake... This time I will bury you!
Dialogue: Make no mistake... This time I will bury you!

Original: Kam'lanaut:Gck! Not here...
Dialogue: Gck! Not here...

Original: Eald'narche:Expose me no longer to your disgraceful form!
Dialogue: Expose me no longer to your disgraceful form!

Original: Kam'lanaut:Why... What did I do to deserve...this...
Dialogue: Why... What did I do to deserve...this...

Original: Alphinaud:How could he... To his own brother...!
Dialogue: How could he... To his own brother...!

Original: Lion:There's no brotherly love between these two. Don't let your guard down.
Dialogue: There's no brotherly love between these two. Don't let your guard down.

Original: Eald'narche:I see you won't cease talking.
Dialogue: I see you won't cease talking.

Original: Eald'narche:This small, worthless existence will be your end!
Dialogue: This small, worthless existence will be your end!

Original: Lion:Give up! This isn't the world you've dreamt of!
Dialogue: Give up! This isn't the world you've dreamt of!

Original: Warrior of Light:Having the light beside us...is our dream!
Dialogue: Having the light beside us...is our dream!

Original: Eald'narche:You blasted adventurers... Get out of my sight!
Dialogue: You blasted adventurers... Get out of my sight!

Original: Eald'narche:I will end you here and now!
Dialogue: I will end you here and now!

Original: Eald'narche:Hmph... It is time.
Dialogue: Hmph... It is time.

Original: Warrior of Light:Running away?
Dialogue: Running away?

Original: Zidane:Wait! Y'shtola's brilliance is...!
Dialogue: Wait! Y'shtola's brilliance is...!

Original: Y'shtola:I see... I have forgotten so much.
Dialogue: I see... I have forgotten so much.

Original: Y'shtola:Now let us hurry forth.
Dialogue: Now let us hurry forth.

Original: Zidane:Are you sure you're ready to go already? Did you really get your memories back?
Dialogue: Are you sure you're ready to go already? Did you really get your memories back?

Original: Y'shtola:It is because I have remembered that I know I cannot stand idle.
Dialogue: It is because I have remembered that I know I cannot stand idle.

Original: Lyse:I'm glad you got your memories back.
Dialogue: I'm glad you got your memories back.

Original: Lyse:I didn't want you to regret letting them go.
Dialogue: I didn't want you to regret letting them go.

Original: Y'shtola:...Thank you.
Dialogue: ...Thank you.

Original: Lyse:If your memories have returned, then you should know. I can't thank you guys enough.
Dialogue: If your memories have returned, then you should know. I can't thank you guys enough.

Original: Lyse:There's no way I could let you forget everything here.
Dialogue: There's no way I could let you forget everything here.

Original: Warrior of Light:Have these trying memories...become a guiding light to you?
Dialogue: Have these trying memories...become a guiding light to you?

Original: Y'shtola:I apologize if I worried you, but I am okay.
Dialogue: I apologize if I worried you, but I am okay.

Original: Y'shtola:Because I know very clearly what I must do.
Dialogue: Because I know very clearly what I must do.

Original: Mog:Kupo! Without those brothers here, the atmosphere has become really unstable, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! Without those brothers here, the atmosphere has become really unstable, kupo!

Original: Mog:Someone open a portal and get us to the airship, kupo!
Dialogue: Someone open a portal and get us to the airship, kupo!

Original: Lyse:I'll do it!
Dialogue: I'll do it!

Original: Zidane:I always had a feeling you couldn't do magic, Lyse.
Dialogue: I always had a feeling you couldn't do magic, Lyse.

Original: Lyse:Until now, maybe I couldn't. But now I've decided.
Dialogue: Until now, maybe I couldn't. But now I've decided.

Original: Lyse:Because I remembered that I have things to do back home.
Dialogue: Because I remembered that I have things to do back home.

Original: Lyse:And I want to save this world and return home, and do it with all my might!
Dialogue: And I want to save this world and return home, and do it with all my might!

Original: Mog:The portal is connected to the airship, kupo! Time to evacuate, everyone!
Dialogue: The portal is connected to the airship, kupo! Time to evacuate, everyone!

Original: Materia:Is this truly what you want?
Dialogue: Is this truly what you want?

Original: ???:If Noct and the others appear as they do from that time, then I wish to as well.
Dialogue: If Noct and the others appear as they do from that time, then I wish to as well.

Original: Materia:I understand.
Dialogue: I understand.

Original: Materia:They need you.
Dialogue: They need you.
I see...

Original: ???:I can imagine. Even more so if they are still themselves from that time.
Dialogue: I can imagine. Even more so if they are still themselves from that time.

Original: Materia:Ignis Scientia... Impart your wisdom to them.
Dialogue: Ignis Scientia... Impart your wisdom to them.

Original: Ignis:For a god, you seem to lack...spirit.
Dialogue: For a god, you seem to lack...spirit.

Original: Materia:I am losing the faith of the warriors.
Dialogue: I am losing the faith of the warriors.

Original: Materia:I have taken sad memories away from some, including your friends.
Dialogue: I have taken sad memories away from some, including your friends.

Original: Materia:I wanted to give them respite, even if just for a moment...
Dialogue: I wanted to give them respite, even if just for a moment...

Original: Ignis:Manipulating people's memories without their consent will certainly cause them to lose faith in you.
Dialogue: Manipulating people's memories without their consent will certainly cause them to lose faith in you.

Original: Materia:Yes, it seems humans are such creatures. But it is something beyond my comprehension...
Dialogue: Yes, it seems humans are such creatures. But it is something beyond my comprehension...

Original: Ignis:A weakened god and a world in peril...
Dialogue: A weakened god and a world in peril...

Original: Ignis:At the very least, I want to keep my memories as they are.
Dialogue: At the very least, I want to keep my memories as they are.

Original: Materia:Are humans happy fighting even with the burden of sad memories on them?
Dialogue: Are humans happy fighting even with the burden of sad memories on them?

Original: Ignis:You cannot change what you've experienced.
Dialogue: You cannot change what you've experienced.

Original: Ignis:My greatest priority is saving Noct.
Dialogue: My greatest priority is saving Noct.

Original: Materia:...Of course.
Dialogue: ...Of course.

Original: Materia:The memories I took are scattered throughout this world as "brilliance," or fragments of the crystal.
Dialogue: The memories I took are scattered throughout this world as "brilliance," or fragments of the crystal.

Original: Ignis:Then I suppose Noct will want to get back his memories himself.
Dialogue: Then I suppose Noct will want to get back his memories himself.

Original: Materia:...Yes, I suppose so.
Dialogue: ...Yes, I suppose so.

Original: Materia:Which is why you must...
Dialogue: Which is why you must...

Original: Ignis:I won't do anything to confuse him. Is that acceptable?
Dialogue: I won't do anything to confuse him. Is that acceptable?

Original: Materia:...I leave it in your hands.
Dialogue: ...I leave it in your hands.

Original: Ignis:Then I shall take my leave.
Dialogue: Then I shall take my leave.

Original: Materia:Is my authority...being threatened...?
Dialogue: Is my authority...being threatened...?

Original: Materia:My warriors... Take care of your comrades...
Dialogue: My warriors... Take care of your comrades...

Original: Ignis:Where am I...?
Dialogue: Where am I...?

Original: Vayne:You must be one of Materia's warriors.
Dialogue: You must be one of Materia's warriors.

Original: Ignis:It seems that way. Are you one of the warriors from another world she spoke of?
Dialogue: It seems that way. Are you one of the warriors from another world she spoke of?

Original: Vayne:That is correct. Nor, as of the moment, do I regard you as an enemy.
Dialogue: That is correct. Nor, as of the moment, do I regard you as an enemy.

Original: Vayne:My name is Vayne Carudas Solidor.
Dialogue: My name is Vayne Carudas Solidor.

Original: Ignis:Ignis Scientia.
Dialogue: Ignis Scientia.

Original: Ignis:I'm looking for a man named Noctis Lucis Caelum.
Dialogue: I'm looking for a man named Noctis Lucis Caelum.

Original: Vayne:Noctis... Yes, I know him. Are you a friend of his?
Dialogue: Noctis... Yes, I know him. Are you a friend of his?

Original: Ignis:Yes... Well, not quite.
Dialogue: Yes... Well, not quite.

Original: Ignis:I am his adviser, to put it simply.
Dialogue: I am his adviser, to put it simply.

Original: Ignis:You appear to be a wise man of station.
Dialogue: You appear to be a wise man of station.

Original: Vayne:Hmph. In this world, I'm naught more than another warrior.
Dialogue: Hmph. In this world, I'm naught more than another warrior.

Original: Vayne:But you are quite keen in your observation. Befitting of an adviser...
Dialogue: But you are quite keen in your observation. Befitting of an adviser...

Original: Vayne:One such as yourself is certainly indispensable to that prince.
Dialogue: One such as yourself is certainly indispensable to that prince.

Original: Ignis:He refers to himself as a prince?
Dialogue: He refers to himself as a prince?

Original: Vayne:He is loathe to be called as such, wishing to be treated the same as his allies.
Dialogue: He is loathe to be called as such, wishing to be treated the same as his allies.

Original: Ignis:...I see.
Dialogue: ...I see.

Original: Vayne:Can I assume then that he is not a prince to you?
Dialogue: Can I assume then that he is not a prince to you?

Original: Vayne:Perhaps because of something that happens in his future...something he has forgotten?
Dialogue: Perhaps because of something that happens in his future...something he has forgotten?

Original: Ignis:What do you know?
Dialogue: What do you know?

Original: Vayne:Something that the one who summoned you failed to say.
Dialogue: Something that the one who summoned you failed to say.

Original: Vayne:The greatest power in this world is willpower.
Dialogue: The greatest power in this world is willpower.

Original: Vayne:In order to strengthen that will, I was summoned by a god who granted me certain memories and knowledge.
Dialogue: In order to strengthen that will, I was summoned by a god who granted me certain memories and knowledge.

Original: Vayne:Though it seems Materia has also come to learn the importance of memories and histories in peoples' wills to fight.
Dialogue: Though it seems Materia has also come to learn the importance of memories and histories in peoples' wills to fight.

Original: Vayne:So there is a chance you know more than that prince does.
Dialogue: So there is a chance you know more than that prince does.

Original: Vayne:A warrior possessing a strong will can manipulate this world to his liking.
Dialogue: A warrior possessing a strong will can manipulate this world to his liking.

Original: Vayne:You can do things that prince cannot do... Take that device, for example.
Dialogue: You can do things that prince cannot do... Take that device, for example.

Original: Vayne:You can make it work in this world.
Dialogue: You can make it work in this world.

Original: Vayne:One with a strong will can overwrite the laws of this world.
Dialogue: One with a strong will can overwrite the laws of this world.

Original: Ignis:So I can bend things to my will?
Dialogue: So I can bend things to my will?

Original: Vayne:It seems you're finally starting to understand.
Dialogue: It seems you're finally starting to understand.

Original: Vayne:But remember one thing.
Dialogue: But remember one thing.

Original: Vayne:Your liege is enjoying his life as a "prince" in this world.
Dialogue: Your liege is enjoying his life as a "prince" in this world.

Original: Vayne:As such, you cannot count on the strength of his will. Do you not feel the need to change that as his adviser?
Dialogue: As such, you cannot count on the strength of his will. Do you not feel the need to change that as his adviser?

Original: Ignis:I shall determine that after we meet.
Dialogue: I shall determine that after we meet.

Original: Prompto:Noct! You're ringing, dude!
Dialogue: Noct! You're ringing, dude!

Original: Noct:What? Me?
Dialogue: What? Me?

Original: Lyse:Isn't that sound coming from your pocket?
Dialogue: Isn't that sound coming from your pocket?

Original: Fang:It might be broken. But it's sure making a ruckus, so why not take a look?
Dialogue: It might be broken. But it's sure making a ruckus, so why not take a look?

Original: Noct:Maybe it's my alarm... Huh?
Dialogue: Maybe it's my alarm... Huh?

Original: Noct:It's Ignis!
Dialogue: It's Ignis!

Original: Prompto:Really!? Answer it!
Dialogue: Really!? Answer it!

Original: Prompto:Are you the real deal!?
Dialogue: Are you the real deal!?

Original: Ignis:Of course.
Dialogue: Of course.

Original: Ignis:My apologies on the wait.
Dialogue: My apologies on the wait.

Original: Lyse:So who's our new friend?
Dialogue: So who's our new friend?

Original: Noct:Oh, right. This is Ignis. He's my...
Dialogue: Oh, right. This is Ignis. He's my...

Original: Prompto:Tactician? Isn't that a bit stiff, even for you?
Dialogue: Tactician? Isn't that a bit stiff, even for you?

Original: Ignis:I thought it the best way to speak to those from other worlds.
Dialogue: I thought it the best way to speak to those from other worlds.

Original: Ace:I appreciate it.
Dialogue: I appreciate it.

Original: Garnet:Since we're all from different worlds, the simpler you can explain it, the better.
Dialogue: Since we're all from different worlds, the simpler you can explain it, the better.

Original: Garnet:You must be very reliable to be Noctis's tactician. Welcome to the team!
Dialogue: You must be very reliable to be Noctis's tactician. Welcome to the team!

Original: Ignis:Glad to be of service.
Dialogue: Glad to be of service.

Original: Prompto:You sure are fast friends!
Dialogue: You sure are fast friends!

Original: Lyse:Hehe. Isn't that a good thing? After all, you looked so happy to see him earlier.
Dialogue: Hehe. Isn't that a good thing? After all, you looked so happy to see him earlier.

Original: Noct:Me? Happy?
Dialogue: Me? Happy?

Original: Lyse:Oh, didn't you notice?
Dialogue: Oh, didn't you notice?

Original: Lyse:When you got the call from him, you seemed so relieved, and your voice sounded so happy.
Dialogue: When you got the call from him, you seemed so relieved, and your voice sounded so happy.

Original: Noct:I wouldn't say happy... It's normal to feel relieved when one of your friends turns out to be fine, right?
Dialogue: I wouldn't say happy... It's normal to feel relieved when one of your friends turns out to be fine, right?

Original: Ignis:"Relieved," I see. You haven't changed at all, Noct.
Dialogue: "Relieved," I see. You haven't changed at all, Noct.

Original: Ace:What's the matter? Something on your mind?
Dialogue: What's the matter? Something on your mind?

Original: Ignis:I suppose I'm also relieved nothing has changed.
Dialogue: I suppose I'm also relieved nothing has changed.

Original: Lyse:There's no need to worry. Noct is doing fine.
Dialogue: There's no need to worry. Noct is doing fine.

Original: Mog:Kupo, kupo! I sense brilliance!
Dialogue: Kupo, kupo! I sense brilliance!

Original: Mog:And this time, there's no trace of Shinryu! We might be able to gather it up easily for once, kupo!
Dialogue: And this time, there's no trace of Shinryu! We might be able to gather it up easily for once, kupo!

Original: Ace:Could it be a trap set by the enemy? Is there a chance something is interfering with your pompom?
Dialogue: Could it be a trap set by the enemy? Is there a chance something is interfering with your pompom?

Original: Prompto:You're thinking too hard, Ace. I'm sure everything'll be fine!
Dialogue: You're thinking too hard, Ace. I'm sure everything'll be fine!

Original: Noct:Then let's go get that brilliance.
Dialogue: Then let's go get that brilliance.

Original: Lyse:It's definitely best we get our hands on it first, before the enemy can use it.
Dialogue: It's definitely best we get our hands on it first, before the enemy can use it.

Original: Ignis:So we are to gather this "brilliance"?
Dialogue: So we are to gather this "brilliance"?

Original: Noct:I'll explain it along the way.
Dialogue: I'll explain it along the way.

Original: Garnet:We'll introduce you to the others, too.
Dialogue: We'll introduce you to the others, too.

Original: Steiner:So Sir Ignis is responsible not only for the group's battle strategies...
Dialogue: So Sir Ignis is responsible not only for the group's battle strategies...

Original: Steiner:But their nutrition as well!
Dialogue: But their nutrition as well!

Original: Ignis:It certainly isn't easy, especially with such picky eaters about.
Dialogue: It certainly isn't easy, especially with such picky eaters about.

Original: Edgar:Though you and Noct are close in age, you hold different viewpoints and offer him advice...
Dialogue: Though you and Noct are close in age, you hold different viewpoints and offer him advice...

Original: Edgar:And not just that, you look after his health and cook, too. How fortunate he is to have a tactician such as you!
Dialogue: And not just that, you look after his health and cook, too. How fortunate he is to have a tactician such as you!

Original: Lenna:Indeed. You may not be siblings, but you're just as reliable as one.
Dialogue: Indeed. You may not be siblings, but you're just as reliable as one.

Original: Ignis:Has everyone been eating and sleeping properly? I want to learn what I can about the life here.
Dialogue: Has everyone been eating and sleeping properly? I want to learn what I can about the life here.

Original: Rosa:We have everything we need on the airship.
Dialogue: We have everything we need on the airship.

Original: Rosa:Even if more people join our team, we have plenty of room.
Dialogue: Even if more people join our team, we have plenty of room.

Original: Penelo:Yeah. There might be dangerous monsters outside, but we want for nothing with the airship.
Dialogue: Yeah. There might be dangerous monsters outside, but we want for nothing with the airship.

Original: Edgar:But perhaps we had best let Ignis know about Noct's behavior this morning.
Dialogue: But perhaps we had best let Ignis know about Noct's behavior this morning.

Original: Steiner:Indeed! This morning, Sir Noct very discreetly left his vegetables on his plate.
Dialogue: Indeed! This morning, Sir Noct very discreetly left his vegetables on his plate.

Original: Ignis:It is as I feared.
Dialogue: It is as I feared.

Original: Ignis:No matter where he goes, he fails to understand the importance of a balanced diet.
Dialogue: No matter where he goes, he fails to understand the importance of a balanced diet.

Original: Rosa:You are a much friendlier man than your title and appearance make you seem.
Dialogue: You are a much friendlier man than your title and appearance make you seem.

Original: Penelo:I agree. Though royals and their retainers seem to be conscious about all kinds of things.
Dialogue: I agree. Though royals and their retainers seem to be conscious about all kinds of things.

Original: Penelo:I feel like you're doing your best to be approachable to us, Ignis.
Dialogue: I feel like you're doing your best to be approachable to us, Ignis.

Original: Edgar:Well, this won't do. I try my hardest to be approachable...
Dialogue: Well, this won't do. I try my hardest to be approachable...

Original: Edgar:But perhaps you'd prefer a more frank approach, Penelo?
Dialogue: But perhaps you'd prefer a more frank approach, Penelo?

Original: Penelo:No. Not...really...
Dialogue: No. Not...really...

Original: Edgar:Haha, I jest! I wouldn't want Vaan to get jealous.
Dialogue: Haha, I jest! I wouldn't want Vaan to get jealous.

Original: Ignis:I don't quite understand the full situation. However...
Dialogue: I don't quite understand the full situation. However...

Original: Ignis:Perhaps that very aspect is what makes you difficult to approach, Edgar.
Dialogue: Perhaps that very aspect is what makes you difficult to approach, Edgar.

Original: Prompto:Ignis sure doesn't hold back.
Dialogue: Ignis sure doesn't hold back.

Original: Noct:He's settling in a little too well...
Dialogue: He's settling in a little too well...

Original: Noel:It's been a while since you've seen each other. Isn't there anything you want to say?
Dialogue: It's been a while since you've seen each other. Isn't there anything you want to say?

Original: Prompto:Well... Yes, but...
Dialogue: Well... Yes, but...

Original: Noel:Why so polite?
Dialogue: Why so polite?

Original: Prompto:Um, well... Sorry about that. I guess I shouldn't be...
Dialogue: Um, well... Sorry about that. I guess I shouldn't be...

Original: Prishe:You and Noct are pretty shy, huh.
Dialogue: You and Noct are pretty shy, huh.

Original: Prompto:D-did you read my mind?
Dialogue: D-did you read my mind?

Original: Noel:It's pretty easy to tell regardless.
Dialogue: It's pretty easy to tell regardless.

Original: Noel:Why don't you go talk to him? He must have things he wants to say, too.
Dialogue: Why don't you go talk to him? He must have things he wants to say, too.

Original: Noct:Yeah, maybe, but...
Dialogue: Yeah, maybe, but...

Original: Prishe:Oh, I get it. You're afraid of getting scolded, aren't you?
Dialogue: Oh, I get it. You're afraid of getting scolded, aren't you?

Original: Noct:But we need to talk to him about what we remember.
Dialogue: But we need to talk to him about what we remember.

Original: Noel:Then I'll call him over.
Dialogue: Then I'll call him over.

Original: Noct:So you met Materia?
Dialogue: So you met Materia?

Original: Ignis:Yes. She gave me the gist of this world and said you had already arrived.
Dialogue: Yes. She gave me the gist of this world and said you had already arrived.

Original: Ignis:Why do you ask?
Dialogue: Why do you ask?

Original: Prompto:Neither of us met her...
Dialogue: Neither of us met her...

Original: Noct:And we have some allies from other worlds who've lost their memories...
Dialogue: And we have some allies from other worlds who've lost their memories...

Original: Noct:And some of their friends who arrived afterward had all theirs intact.
Dialogue: And some of their friends who arrived afterward had all theirs intact.

Original: Ignis:You're worried your memories may not be complete?
Dialogue: You're worried your memories may not be complete?

Original: Prompto:I don't want to forget anything important...
Dialogue: I don't want to forget anything important...

Original: Ignis:I may not have all of my memories.
Dialogue: I may not have all of my memories.

Original: Ignis:And I don't want to risk worsening the situation by saying something vague or incomplete.
Dialogue: And I don't want to risk worsening the situation by saying something vague or incomplete.

Original: Prompto:We were looking for him and asking around if anyone'd seen a big dude with tattoos, but...
Dialogue: We were looking for him and asking around if anyone'd seen a big dude with tattoos, but...

Original: Prompto:No luck.
Dialogue: No luck.

Original: Noct:If Gladio is here, he must be looking for us, too.
Dialogue: If Gladio is here, he must be looking for us, too.

Original: Ignis:In which case, we're bound to run into him eventually.
Dialogue: In which case, we're bound to run into him eventually.

Original: Ignis:How have you two been faring here? And what of your camera, Prompto?
Dialogue: How have you two been faring here? And what of your camera, Prompto?

Original: Prompto:It didn't make the trip. I must have dropped it somewhere.
Dialogue: It didn't make the trip. I must have dropped it somewhere.

Original: Ignis:Then we need to keep an eye out for that, too. We should keep a record of our journey in this world.
Dialogue: Then we need to keep an eye out for that, too. We should keep a record of our journey in this world.

Original: Prompto:Yeah! It'd be great to look back on all the amazing things we did and all the great people we met!
Dialogue: Yeah! It'd be great to look back on all the amazing things we did and all the great people we met!

Original: Prompto:We'll get to look back on those pictures and reminisce about our adventures.
Dialogue: We'll get to look back on those pictures and reminisce about our adventures.

Original: Ignis:Is there anything else you're lacking?
Dialogue: Is there anything else you're lacking?

Original: Noct:Not really. Mog takes care of the rest.
Dialogue: Not really. Mog takes care of the rest.

Original: Noct:I've even got the hang of fighting with our new friends.
Dialogue: I've even got the hang of fighting with our new friends.

Original: Prompto:You can't imagine how surprised I was to hear we were in a different world, but I guess we're all in the same boat here.
Dialogue: You can't imagine how surprised I was to hear we were in a different world, but I guess we're all in the same boat here.

Original: Ignis:How has the journey been?
Dialogue: How has the journey been?

Original: Noct:Well, it's not all bad.
Dialogue: Well, it's not all bad.

Original: Prompto:Definitely different from home, but it's been fun so far.
Dialogue: Definitely different from home, but it's been fun so far.

Original: Ignis:...I see.
Dialogue: ...I see.

Original: Prompto:You seem...underwhelmed. Something wrong?
Dialogue: You seem...underwhelmed. Something wrong?

Original: Ignis:I'm no different than usual.
Dialogue: I'm no different than usual.

Original: Noct:(You're as far from "usual" as I've ever seen...)
Dialogue: (You're as far from "usual" as I've ever seen...)

Original: ???:With this world as the ark, I can fly anywhere.
Dialogue: With this world as the ark, I can fly anywhere.

Original: ???:Who controls this world?
Dialogue: «Who controls this world?»

Original: ???:The gods.
Dialogue: The gods.

Original: ???:The seat of the gods will become my new promised land.
Dialogue: «The seat of the gods will become my new promised land.»

Original: ???:But there are those who stand in the way.
Dialogue: But there are those who stand in the way.

Original: ???:A powerless god cannot stop me.
Dialogue: «A powerless god cannot stop me.»

Original: ???:Ah, yes... It's best to end them.
Dialogue: Ah, yes... It's best to end them.

Original: ???:Ha ha ha...
Dialogue: Ha ha ha...

Original: ???:I will take their throne and...
Dialogue: I will take their throne and...

Original: Vayne:...Try to become a god?
Dialogue: ...Try to become a god?

Original: Vayne:...But perhaps worth considering. If he strikes down Materia...
Dialogue: ...But perhaps worth considering. If he strikes down Materia...

Original: Vayne:It might be a chance to release all those held captive by this world.
Dialogue: It might be a chance to release all those held captive by this world.

Original: Vayne:If one has the strength of will to oppose the gods, he can escape their rule. That is the type of world we are in.
Dialogue: If one has the strength of will to oppose the gods, he can escape their rule. That is the type of world we are in.

Original: Vayne:They probably make their way for Materia's chambers...
Dialogue: They probably make their way for Materia's chambers...

Original: Vayne:She is perhaps easier prey than Spiritus.
Dialogue: She is perhaps easier prey than Spiritus.

Original: Vayne:...I shall make my own preparations.
Dialogue: ...I shall make my own preparations.

Original: Vayne:Have you grown accustomed to this world?
Dialogue: Have you grown accustomed to this world?

Original: Vayne:It seems you've grown suspicious of me... Perhaps you've heard some bad rumors?
Dialogue: It seems you've grown suspicious of me... Perhaps you've heard some bad rumors?

Original: Ignis:Vaan and his friends said you were their enemy.
Dialogue: Vaan and his friends said you were their enemy.

Original: Vayne:But we have an agreement to fight together in this world, and I have no intention of starting a fight now.
Dialogue: But we have an agreement to fight together in this world, and I have no intention of starting a fight now.

Original: Ignis:What business have you with me?
Dialogue: What business have you with me?

Original: Vayne:I have a question for you as a newcomer to this world: what do you think of it?
Dialogue: I have a question for you as a newcomer to this world what do you think of it?

Original: Vayne:For example... How did you find your liege?
Dialogue: For example... How did you find your liege?

Original: Ignis:He seemed fine and at ease here.
Dialogue: He seemed fine and at ease here.

Original: Vayne:A safe answer.
Dialogue: A safe answer.

Original: Ignis:What are you getting at?
Dialogue: What are you getting at?

Original: Vayne:Do not think your allies are the only ones who came from your world.
Dialogue: Do not think your allies are the only ones who came from your world.

Original: Vayne:It seems your crystal chooses its king regardless of one's sovereignty.
Dialogue: It seems your crystal chooses its king regardless of one's sovereignty.

Original: Vayne:It selects a ruler without democracy...
Dialogue: It selects a ruler without democracy...

Original: Vayne:And the chosen one has no choice but to obey its supernatural selector.
Dialogue: And the chosen one has no choice but to obey its supernatural selector.

Original: Ignis:That is our world.
Dialogue: That is our world.

Original: Vayne:They were merely my own thoughts on the matter. Do you feel no resentment at being bound by gods and legends?
Dialogue: They were merely my own thoughts on the matter. Do you feel no resentment at being bound by gods and legends?

Original: Ignis:...I do not need to answer you.
Dialogue: ...I do not need to answer you.

Original: Vayne:...Regardless, the gods in this world differ from the ones in yours.
Dialogue: ...Regardless, the gods in this world differ from the ones in yours.

Original: Vayne:You've witnessed Materia's weakness with your own eyes, haven't you?
Dialogue: You've witnessed Materia's weakness with your own eyes, haven't you?

Original: Ignis:She said she was losing the faith of her warriors.
Dialogue: She said she was losing the faith of her warriors.

Original: Vayne:Yes. And now someone who knows of her weakness is seeking to seize her authority.
Dialogue: Yes. And now someone who knows of her weakness is seeking to seize her authority.

Original: Vayne:Be on your guard. The current state of affairs may be detestable, but...
Dialogue: Be on your guard. The current state of affairs may be detestable, but...

Original: Vayne:Being ruled by someone who seeks to be a hero by slaying the gods is perhaps an even worse fate.
Dialogue: Being ruled by someone who seeks to be a hero by slaying the gods is perhaps an even worse fate.

Original: Vayne:I would keep a watchful eye on anything...peculiar that may appear before you.
Dialogue: I would keep a watchful eye on anything...peculiar that may appear before you.

Original: Ignis:What a strange man.
Dialogue: What a strange man.

Original: Ignis:I had best regroup with the others.
Dialogue: I had best regroup with the others.

Original: Materia:You would turn your blade on a god... Why?
Dialogue: You would turn your blade on a god... Why?

Original: Zack:It is the natural reward for a god without a will...
Dialogue: It is the natural reward for a god without a will...

Original: Materia:Accepting the will of the warriors...is my responsibility as a god.
Dialogue: Accepting the will of the warriors...is my responsibility as a god.

Original: Zack:Ha ha ha...
Dialogue: Ha ha ha...

Original: Sephiroth:Now, the goddess's throne...
Dialogue: Now, the goddess's throne...

Original: Sephiroth:The worlds are connected here... However...
Dialogue: The worlds are connected here... However...

Original: Sephiroth:I must first rid it of its parasites.
Dialogue: I must first rid it of its parasites.

Original: Sephiroth:They have been divided. Some of them won't respond...
Dialogue: They have been divided. Some of them won't respond...

Original: Sephiroth:The power of my will...is being hindered by the law of the gods.
Dialogue: The power of my will...is being hindered by the law of the gods.

Original: Sephiroth:So how well can empty puppets fare?
Dialogue: So how well can empty puppets fare?

Original: Dark Manikin (Zack):Where is this...?
Dialogue: Where is this...?

Original: Dark Manikin (Zack):Why are there so many of me...?
Dialogue: Why are there so many of me...?

Original: Dark Manikin (Zack):So...we weren't unique.
Dialogue: So...we weren't unique.

Original: Dark Manikin (Zack):Why are you standing in Materia's place...?
Dialogue: Why are you standing in Materia's place...?

Original: Sephiroth:This place belongs to me now.
Dialogue: This place belongs to me now.

Original: Sephiroth:And you...are my warriors.
Dialogue: And you...are my warriors.

Original: Dark Manikin (Zack):Yeah right! To defeat people like you, we
Dialogue: Yeah right! To defeat people like you, we—

Original: Sephiroth:You...are puppets.
Dialogue: You...are puppets.

Original: Sephiroth:As copies, all you need to do is fulfill your role.
Dialogue: As copies, all you need to do is fulfill your role.

Original: Sephiroth:Copy their memories, delude them, and crush their will.
Dialogue: Copy their memories, delude them, and crush their will.

Original: Dark Manikin (Zack):My body...won't...listen to me...
Dialogue: My body...won't...listen to me...

Original: Ignis:I just finished inspecting the airship's equipment.
Dialogue: I just finished inspecting the airship's equipment.

Original: Noel:It has everything you need, right?
Dialogue: It has everything you need, right?

Original: Ignis:I found it absolutely fascinating.
Dialogue: I found it absolutely fascinating.

Original: Ignis:For example, I saw a vegetable with a star-shaped cross-section.
Dialogue: For example, I saw a vegetable with a star-shaped cross-section.

Original: Yuri:It's like the star carrots from our world.
Dialogue: It's like the star carrots from our world.

Original: Ignis:A carrot... So it's a root vegetable.
Dialogue: A carrot... So it's a root vegetable.

Original: Chelinka:Yeah! You can put it in a stew or saut it.
Dialogue: Yeah! You can put it in a stew or sauté it.

Original: Ignis:I see.
Dialogue: I see.

Original: Noel:Noct doesn't eat those red vegetables.
Dialogue: Noct doesn't eat those red vegetables.

Original: Sabin:Gahaha! Whether you simmer or fry it, he won't even take a bite.
Dialogue: Gahaha! Whether you simmer or fry it, he won't even take a bite.

Original: Ignis:I'll give it a taste later.
Dialogue: I'll give it a taste later.

Original: Prishe:This world doesn't have many unique foods like those pickles Steiner carries around...
Dialogue: This world doesn't have many unique foods like those pickles Steiner carries around...

Original: Prishe:There are "similar" foods, though.
Dialogue: There are "similar" foods, though.

Original: Yuri:But if you keep thinking they're fakes, food starts tasting pretty bland.
Dialogue: But if you keep thinking they're fakes, food starts tasting pretty bland.

Original: Chelinka:Even if we don't eat for a long time, though, we're completely fine here. Maybe we don't need to eat at all in this world.
Dialogue: Even if we don't eat for a long time, though, we're completely fine here. Maybe we don't need to eat at all in this world.

Original: Prishe:I know how you feel! But that's exactly why I eat!
Dialogue: I know how you feel! But that's exactly why I eat!

Original: Prishe:I eat and have a blast here!
Dialogue: I eat and have a blast here!

Original: Sabin:Yeah! Even if a cure or potion will heal our wounds, nothing quite rejuvenates the heart like a good meal.
Dialogue: Yeah! Even if a cure or potion will heal our wounds, nothing quite rejuvenates the heart like a good meal.

Original: Sabin:And nothing beats drinking a fragrant tea.
Dialogue: And nothing beats drinking a fragrant tea.

Original: Ignis:Then I'll see if I can't find any good tea leaves around here.
Dialogue: Then I'll see if I can't find any good tea leaves around here.

Original: Sabin:You get it. Thanks!
Dialogue: You get it. Thanks!

Original: Noel:It seems like time's stopped here.
Dialogue: It seems like time's stopped here.

Original: Noel:I don't get the feeling of really living, like eating or sleeping.
Dialogue: I don't get the feeling of really living, like eating or sleeping.

Original: Ignis:Is that so?
Dialogue: Is that so?

Original: Prishe:But Noct is getting by with this feeling somehow.
Dialogue: But Noct is getting by with this feeling somehow.

Original: Yuri:Well, in that case...
Dialogue: Well, in that case...

Original: Yuri:Could we eat some food you prepared for Noct?
Dialogue: Could we eat some food you prepared for Noct?

Original: Chelinka:Yuri! Remember your manners!
Dialogue: Yuri! Remember your manners!

Original: Yuri:You say that, but aren't you interested, too?
Dialogue: You say that, but aren't you interested, too?

Original: Noel:I'm interested.
Dialogue: I'm interested.

Original: Sabin:I would have anything you make!
Dialogue: I would have anything you make!

Original: Ignis:Very well then.
Dialogue: Very well then.

Original: Prishe:You're so generous, Ignis!
Dialogue: You're so generous, Ignis!

Original: Chelinka:Won't it be difficult with vegetables you're not used to?
Dialogue: Won't it be difficult with vegetables you're not used to?

Original: Ignis:It won't be a problem.
Dialogue: It won't be a problem.

Original: Yuri:Yay! I'm looking forward to it!
Dialogue: Yay! I'm looking forward to it!

Original: Ignis:You won't be disappointed.
Dialogue: You won't be disappointed.

Original: Tidus:That's why I'm the star player now. You're yesterday's news, old man.
Dialogue: «That's why I'm the star player now. You're yesterday's news, old man.»

Original: Jecht:That so? Didn't anyone tell you that I'm makin' a comeback?
Dialogue: «That so? Didn't anyone tell you that I'm makin' a comeback?»

Original: Tidus:Some people might be saying that, but what they really want is my autograph.
Dialogue: «Some people might be saying that, but what they really want is my autograph.»

Original: Jecht:Haha. Well, of course.
Dialogue: «Haha. Well, of course.»

Original: Jecht:But no matter how badly people want my autograph, it's still a fake if you write it.
Dialogue: «But no matter how badly people want my autograph, it's still a fake if you write it.»

Original: Jecht:Keep tryin', kid. I'll keep watchin' you for as long as it takes.
Dialogue: «Keep tryin', kid. I'll keep watchin' you for as long as it takes.»

Original: Relm:I need to get back home or else he'll get lonely and senile.
Dialogue: «I need to get back home or else he'll get lonely and senile.»

Original: Shadow:...Why are you talking to me?
Dialogue: «...Why are you talking to me?»

Original: Relm:Just because. Besides, you're always nearby, Shadow.
Dialogue: «Just because. Besides, you're always nearby, Shadow.»

Original: Galuf:Krile, were you injured in the last battle?
Dialogue: «Krile, were you injured in the last battle?»

Original: Krile:You worry too much, Grandpa.
Dialogue: «You worry too much, Grandpa.»

Original: Krile:I'm fine! Are you okay?
Dialogue: «I'm fine! Are you okay?»

Original: Galuf:Ho ho ho. I am fine. I want to be with my adorable granddaughter and dear friends for as long as possible.
Dialogue: «Ho ho ho. I am fine. I want to be with my adorable granddaughter and dear friends for as long as possible.»

Original: Zack:Is this...everyone's ideal?
Dialogue: «Is this...everyone's ideal?»

Original: Zack:The place of respite that everyone wished for?
Dialogue: «The place of respite that everyone wished for?»

Original: Zack:Is this to weaken our wills?
Dialogue: «Is this to weaken our wills?»

Original: Zack:I need to...entrust it to someone...
Dialogue: «I need to...entrust it to someone...»

Original: Zack:My very cells are being controlled by him... My body won't last...
Dialogue: «My very cells are being controlled by him... My body won't last...»

Original: Yuna:There you are!
Dialogue: There you are!

Original: Tidus:Sorry, Yuna. We were just talking.
Dialogue: «Sorry, Yuna. We were just talking.»

Original: Jecht:Yeah. We'll be right there.
Dialogue: «Yeah. We'll be right there.»

Original: Warrior of Light:I found them.
Dialogue: I found them.

Original: Jecht:Who the hell are they!?
Dialogue: Who the hell are they!?

Original: Yuna:What's going on...!?
Dialogue: What's going on...!?

Original: Tidus:Well, I...
Dialogue: «Well, I...»

Original: Jecht:You don't...remember?
Dialogue: «You don't...remember?»

Original: Zack:I've been waiting for you!
Dialogue: «I've been waiting for you!»

Original: Tidus:Dad!?
Dialogue: «Dad!?»

Original: Warrior of Light:What's going on!?
Dialogue: What's going on!?

Original: Zack:What's all the fuss?
Dialogue: What's all the fuss?

Original: Zack:Is that...me!?
Dialogue: Is that...me!?

Original: Zack:No, I'm not. Neither are they.
Dialogue: «No, I'm not. Neither are they.»

Original: Tidus:Why did you do that to my dad...?
Dialogue: «Why did you do that to my dad...?»

Original: Jecht:Maybe he got the wrong one? I'm...
Dialogue: «Maybe he got the wrong one? I'm...»

Original: Cloud:They have the same face... Is this some kind of trick?
Dialogue: They have the same face... Is this some kind of trick?

Original: Zack:You know, don't you, Cloud? The injured ones are copies.
Dialogue: «You know, don't you, Cloud? The injured ones are copies.»

Original: Yuna:I didn't know. How could I have made such a mistake...?
Dialogue: I didn't know. How could I have made such a mistake...?

Original: Cloud:They're copies who can read our memories. The stronger your emotional attachment, the harder it is to see through them.
Dialogue: They're copies who can read our memories. The stronger your emotional attachment, the harder it is to see through them.

Original: Zack:How is that possible!? And why aren't you one of them?
Dialogue: How is that possible!? And why aren't you one of them?

Original: Zack:I'll tell you after we take care of these guys.
Dialogue: «I'll tell you after we take care of these guys.»

Original: Jecht:Having to fight someone with my own face...
Dialogue: Having to fight someone with my own face...

Original: Jecht:If it's a joke, I'm not laughin'.
Dialogue: «If it's a joke, I'm not laughin'.»

Original: Yuna:Their voice and personality are identical. I can't bring myself to harm him without knowing why...
Dialogue: Their voice and personality are identical. I can't bring myself to harm him without knowing why...

Original: Zack:It's no good if you guys don't do it. If you don't strike them down, it'll infect others.
Dialogue: «It's no good if you guys don't do it. If you don't strike them down, it'll infect others.»

Original: Zack:Hey. What we want is different, right? This isn't respite, is it?
Dialogue: «Hey. What we want is different, right? This isn't respite, is it?»

Original: Zack:Hold on a second. What are you talking about?
Dialogue: Hold on a second. What are you talking about?

Original: Cloud:You don't need to understand, Zack. You know who you need to defeat.
Dialogue: You don't need to understand, Zack. You know who you need to defeat.

Original: Zack:Reliable as ever, Cloud.
Dialogue: «Reliable as ever, Cloud.»

Original: Cloud:I'll put an end to these clones. Those who can't take it, stand back.
Dialogue: I'll put an end to these clones. Those who can't take it, stand back.

Original: Tidus:Do we really have to fight? Do we have to disappear!?
Dialogue: «Do we really have to fight? Do we have to disappear!?»

Original: Tidus:Why do they...
Dialogue: Why do they...

Original: Zack:I'm counting on you guys.
Dialogue: «I'm counting on you guys.»

Original: Zack:Don't force your memories onto us.
Dialogue: «Don't force your memories onto us.»

Original: Tidus:I didn't like seeing those clones of me and my old man.
Dialogue: I didn't like seeing those clones of me and my old man.

Original: Ignis:Have you ever fought puppets like that before?
Dialogue: Have you ever fought puppets like that before?

Original: Vivi:Not really... Most dark manikins we've met couldn't speak very well.
Dialogue: Not really... Most dark manikins we've met couldn't speak very well.

Original: Vivi:Their feelings were different from ours. They were very unique.
Dialogue: Their feelings were different from ours. They were very unique.

Original: Ignis:So they had their own wills and emotions based on that.
Dialogue: So they had their own wills and emotions based on that.

Original: Tidus:But these were different. It was like someone went through the trouble of making an exact replica.
Dialogue: But these were different. It was like someone went through the trouble of making an exact replica.

Original: Noct:Maybe it's a different type of dark manikin.
Dialogue: Maybe it's a different type of dark manikin.

Original: Zack:Which reminds me... My clone went somewhere during the battle.
Dialogue: Which reminds me... My clone went somewhere during the battle.

Original: Zack:He was saying that Cloud understood, if I remember correctly.
Dialogue: He was saying that Cloud understood, if I remember correctly.

Original: Zack:Calamity...?
Dialogue: Calamity...?

Original: Ignis:Tell us more.
Dialogue: Tell us more.

Original: Cloud:The calamity and those with its power could read the memories of others and had the ability to copy them.
