Dialogue: Now take it!

Original: Ace:These are...my memories...
Dialogue: These are...my memories...

Original: Ace:Is that it...? Was that...the end?
Dialogue: Is that it...? Was that...the end?

Original: Ace:...I see.
Dialogue: ...I see.

Original: Ace:So that's why you're trying to make me use the power of my will...
Dialogue: So that's why you're trying to make me use the power of my will...

Original: Cloud of Darkness:Will is law here. With it, one can create anything they desire.
Dialogue: Will is law here. With it, one can create anything they desire.

Original: Ace:And if my wish comes true, then so does yoursunleashing a flood of darkness.
Dialogue: And if my wish comes true, then so does yours—unleashing a flood of darkness.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:All is according to the will of humans. The choice is in your hands.
Dialogue: All is according to the will of humans. The choice is in your hands.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:If you will not use that power, we need only choose another.
Dialogue: If you will not use that power, we need only choose another.

Original: Ace:...That won't be necessary.
Dialogue: ...That won't be necessary.

Original: Ace:We have nowhere to return, no one to remember us.
Dialogue: We have nowhere to return, no one to remember us.

Original: Ace:That's why we'll live here... I'll create a home for us in this world!
Dialogue: That's why we'll live here... I'll create a home for us in this world!

Original: Cloud of Darkness:Then go forth. The land of respite awaits you.
Dialogue: Then go forth. The land of respite awaits you.

Original: Ace:...I will decide my own fate.
Dialogue: ...I will decide my own fate.

Original: Ace:I know the fear of death.
Dialogue: I know the fear of death.

Original: Ace:And now I choose...
Dialogue: And now I choose...

Original: Ace:To live in a world where I have a future.
Dialogue: To live in a world where I have a future.

Original: Ace:That's right. This is my place of respite...
Dialogue: That's right. This is my place of respite...

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Back again? You really like chocobos, don't you?
Dialogue: Back again? You really like chocobos, don't you?

Original: Ace:Is that weird?
Dialogue: Is that weird?

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):But you could be doing better things with your time than wasting it here.
Dialogue: But you could be doing better things with your time than wasting it here.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Couldn't you think of something else to do?
Dialogue: Couldn't you think of something else to do?

Original: Ace:This is fine. I don't want to make things worse.
Dialogue: This is fine. I don't want to make things worse.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Still... Don't you want to see the others?
Dialogue: Still... Don't you want to see the others?

Original: Ace:Not right now. I want to be somewhere quiet.
Dialogue: Not right now. I want to be somewhere quiet.

Original: Chocobo:Kweh, kweh!
Dialogue: Kweh, kweh!

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Does this sound quiet to you?
Dialogue: Does this sound quiet to you?

Original: Ace:They're just hungry.
Dialogue: They're just hungry.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):I know. Wait your turn.
Dialogue: I know. Wait your turn.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Well, if you're going to stay, at least help out.
Dialogue: Well, if you're going to stay, at least help out.

Original: Ace:Right. Who's this?
Dialogue: Right. Who's this?

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Ah, this one's name is...
Dialogue: Ah, this one's name is...

Original: Onion Knight:He also said the crystal core of darkness is running wild and being manipulated by someone.
Dialogue: He also said the crystal core of darkness is running wild and being manipulated by someone.

Original: Leo:Spiritus tasked me with locating the crystal core and putting a stop to whoever is abusing it.
Dialogue: Spiritus tasked me with locating the crystal core and putting a stop to whoever is abusing it.

Original: Kain:Heh... So I'm finally one of them now.
Dialogue: Heh... So I'm finally one of them now.

Original: Warrior of Light:We've been fighting together for a long time now. As we have with others summoned by Spiritus.
Dialogue: We've been fighting together for a long time now. As we have with others summoned by Spiritus.

Original: Onion Knight:Aside from the rotten apples we can't reason with...
Dialogue: Aside from the rotten apples we can't reason with...

Original: Onion Knight:Right now, I want to work with the other warriors who haven't joined us yet.
Dialogue: Right now, I want to work with the other warriors who haven't joined us yet.

Original: Machina:You're so calm. It's like you aren't worried at all.
Dialogue: You're so calm. It's like you aren't worried at all.

Original: Onion Knight:Me? I guess it's because the Cloud of Darkness from my world is like calamity given form.
Dialogue: Me? I guess it's because the Cloud of Darkness from my world is like calamity given form.

Original: Onion Knight:And there's no way you can reason with a storm or natural disaster.
Dialogue: And there's no way you can reason with a storm or natural disaster.

Original: Machina:I see... I guess everyone's got their own circumstances.
Dialogue: I see... I guess everyone's got their own circumstances.

Original: Kain:Exactly. Yourself included, Machina.
Dialogue: Exactly. Yourself included, Machina.

Original: Kain:There is no need to compare yourself to others. You must decide your own route for yourself.
Dialogue: There is no need to compare yourself to others. You must decide your own route for yourself.

Original: Machina:...I wish I could.
Dialogue: ...I wish I could.

Original: Mog:Kupo! I found a new area, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! I found a new area, kupo!

Original: Mog:I can sense brilliance, and Shinryu! Prepare to land, kupo!
Dialogue: I can sense brilliance, and Shinryu! Prepare to land, kupo!

Original: Rem:Now that you mention it, it does.
Dialogue: Now that you mention it, it does.

Original: Fran:This wasteland is your home?
Dialogue: This wasteland is your home?

Original: Deuce:Well...a part of it.
Dialogue: Well...a part of it.

Original: Rem:There are, unfortunately, a lot of places that look like this because of the war.
Dialogue: There are, unfortunately, a lot of places that look like this because of the war.

Original: Laguna:So it's a battlefield. Life sure is tough for soldiers...
Dialogue: So it's a battlefield. Life sure is tough for soldiers...

Original: Deuce:Weren't you a soldier, too, Laguna?
Dialogue: Weren't you a soldier, too, Laguna?

Original: Laguna:Yeah, but I quit the army. You kids are still fighting.
Dialogue: Yeah, but I quit the army. You kids are still fighting.

Original: Rem:But we had a lot of combat missions, so we got used to it pretty quick.
Dialogue: But we had a lot of combat missions, so we got used to it pretty quick.

Original: Machina:Huh? Oh...sorry. What were you talking about?
Dialogue: Huh? Oh...sorry. What were you talking about?

Original: Laguna:How you kids are so young, but doing an amazing job!
Dialogue: How you kids are so young, but doing an amazing job!

Original: Deuce:Is something the matter?
Dialogue: Is something the matter?

Original: Machina:Well, I just realized that I haven't seen Ace in a while now...
Dialogue: Well, I just realized that I haven't seen Ace in a while now...

Original: Fran:He may still be aboard the ship. Proper preparation is vital.
Dialogue: He may still be aboard the ship. Proper preparation is vital.

Original: Machina:...I hope you're right.
Dialogue: ...I hope you're right.

Original: Deuce:In a place that looks so much like home...
Dialogue: In a place that looks so much like home...

Original: Deuce:We might be able to find someone else from Orience here.
Dialogue: We might be able to find someone else from Orience here.

Original: Mog:And my pom-pom is in tip-top condition! So let's go go go, kupo!
Dialogue: And my pom-pom is in tip-top condition! So let's go go go, kupo!

Original: Basch:Could you tell us more about Orience?
Dialogue: Could you tell us more about Orience?

Original: Basch:It might help us learn what to look for here.
Dialogue: It might help us learn what to look for here.

Original: Seven:Orience is comprised of four nations, each with their own culture and crystal.
Dialogue: Orience is comprised of four nations, each with their own culture and crystal.

Original: Irvine:You guys were trained at school in how to fight, right? Like us?
Dialogue: You guys were trained at school in how to fight, right? Like us?

Original: King:Strictly speaking, our training wasn't just for warfare.
Dialogue: Strictly speaking, our training wasn't just for warfare.

Original: King:We cadets are the ones trained to become Agito.
Dialogue: We cadets are the ones trained to become Agito.

Original: Seven:You can only use magic when you're young.
Dialogue: You can only use magic when you're young.

Original: Seven:That's why everyone in the dominion army is as young as they are, cadets included.
Dialogue: That's why everyone in the dominion army is as young as they are, cadets included.

Original: Basch:So they sent you to war because you can use the strongest power out there...
Dialogue: So they sent you to war because you can use the strongest power out there...

Original: Penelo:You guys are the same age as us, but you're so much more mature...
Dialogue: You guys are the same age as us, but you're so much more mature...

Original: Penelo:I guess it's because your world forced you to grow up.
Dialogue: I guess it's because your world forced you to grow up.

Original: Zell:We aren't that far apart in age either...but you can tell actual battle experience changes the look in your eyes.
Dialogue: We aren't that far apart in age either...but you can tell actual battle experience changes the look in your eyes.

Original: Irvine:Yeah, well, we're just mercenaries.
Dialogue: Yeah, well, we're just mercenaries.

Original: Irvine:Nationality doesn't figure into it, and only a select few of us ever even went on covert ops and that stuff...
Dialogue: Nationality doesn't figure into it, and only a select few of us ever even went on covert ops and that stuff...

Original: Irvine:Same here! Talk about a coincidence.
Dialogue: Same here! Talk about a coincidence.

Original: Basch:An international war using magic on such a large scale...
Dialogue: An international war using magic on such a large scale...

Original: Basch:As a commander, I wonder how I would handle sending out such young troops...
Dialogue: As a commander, I wonder how I would handle sending out such young troops...

Original: Seven:You make it harder to answer when you look that gloomy about it...
Dialogue: You make it harder to answer when you look that gloomy about it...

Original: Seven:But sending your best soldiers out first should minimize casualties.
Dialogue: But sending your best soldiers out first should minimize casualties.

Original: Basch:I can understand your superiors coming to such a rationalization.
Dialogue: I can understand your superiors coming to such a rationalization.

Original: Penelo:That's why I can't see anything "rational" about it.
Dialogue: That's why I can't see anything "rational" about it.

Original: Zell:Hmm... Hearing all this makes me realize just how complacent peace has made me.
Dialogue: Hmm... Hearing all this makes me realize just how complacent peace has made me.

Original: King:I understand the theory of being better off without war.
Dialogue: I understand the theory of being better off without war.

Original: Seven:But we've never experienced a world without it, so we can't imagine what that's like.
Dialogue: But we've never experienced a world without it, so we can't imagine what that's like.

Original: Basch:I suppose that might be why Materia wished to give you respite here.
Dialogue: I suppose that might be why Materia wished to give you respite here.

Original: Zell:Which would be nice, but we've had nothing but problems here, too!
Dialogue: Which would be nice, but we've had nothing but problems here, too!

Original: Zell:Do you have any idea who could have summoned this place?
Dialogue: Do you have any idea who could have summoned this place?

Original: King:No one...in my memory.
Dialogue: No one...in my memory.

Original: Seven:If it's anyone we'd previously neutralized, we wouldn't remember them.
Dialogue: If it's anyone we'd previously neutralized, we wouldn't remember them.

Original: Penelo:Oh, that's right... You forget those who died...
Dialogue: Oh, that's right... You forget those who died...

Original: Irvine:Then all we can do is go forward, right?
Dialogue: Then all we can do is go forward, right?

Original: Irvine:If you remember anything else, let us know!
Dialogue: If you remember anything else, let us know!

Original: Cloud of Darkness:The power of darkness grows, responding to the desires of the warriors...
Dialogue: The power of darkness grows, responding to the desires of the warriors...

Original: Cloud of Darkness:The flood of darkness is at hand...
Dialogue: The flood of darkness is at hand...

Original: Ciaran:Huh? Where did you come from?
Dialogue: Huh? Where did you come from?

Original: Cloud of Darkness:Where the balance of light and dark is disrupted, we appear.
Dialogue: Where the balance of light and dark is disrupted, we appear.

Original: Ciaran:Where did she go? I wonder if she was a friend of someone's...
Dialogue: Where did she go? I wonder if she was a friend of someone's...

Original: Ace:Ciaran... What are you doing here?
Dialogue: Ciaran... What are you doing here?

Original: Ciaran:That's what I'd like to ask you: where have you been?
Dialogue: That's what I'd like to ask you where have you been?

Original: Ace:...Nowhere important.
Dialogue: ...Nowhere important.

Original: Ciaran:You seem...different from before.
Dialogue: You seem...different from before.

Original: Ciaran:...Did you find your respite?
Dialogue: ...Did you find your respite?

Original: Ace:What do you know?
Dialogue: What do you know?

Original: Ciaran:Nothing. It just doesn't feel like you're stretched so thin anymore.
Dialogue: Nothing. It just doesn't feel like you're stretched so thin anymore.

Original: Ace:Are you going to tell the others?
Dialogue: Are you going to tell the others?

Original: Ciaran:Why? I didn't plan on it.
Dialogue: Why? I didn't plan on it.

Original: Ciaran:It's important to you, isn't it?
Dialogue: It's important to you, isn't it?

Original: Ace:...Then that's fine.
Dialogue: ...Then that's fine.

Original: Ace:By the way, Ciaran...
Dialogue: By the way, Ciaran...

Original: Ace:You said it was natural to lose your memories, didn't you?
Dialogue: You said it was natural to lose your memories, didn't you?

Original: Ciaran:Right. No matter how precious they are, you can't hold on to all of them.
Dialogue: Right. No matter how precious they are, you can't hold on to all of them.

Original: Ace:Materia thought we were better off forgetting the things that weighed us down.
Dialogue: Materia thought we were better off forgetting the things that weighed us down.

Original: Ace:In our world, forgetting was a way to move into the future. It was the crystal's blessing.
Dialogue: In our world, forgetting was a way to move into the future. It was the crystal's blessing.

Original: Ace:But here, nobody wants to forget...
Dialogue: But here, nobody wants to forget...

Original: Ciaran:It's not wrong for them to treasure their memories. But...
Dialogue: It's not wrong for them to treasure their memories. But...

Original: Ciaran:They hurt you without realizing it, didn't they?
Dialogue: They hurt you without realizing it, didn't they?

Original: Ace:This world might really be a land of respite for us.
Dialogue: This world might really be a land of respite for us.

Original: Ace:Everyone is alive here. There's no need to...go back...
Dialogue: Everyone is alive here. There's no need to...go back...

Original: Ciaran:...I see.
Dialogue: ...I see.

Original: Ace:Do you think I'm a coward?
Dialogue: Do you think I'm a coward?

Original: Ciaran:Your secret's safe with me. I won't deny the way you feel. Everyone's different, after all.
Dialogue: Your secret's safe with me. I won't deny the way you feel. Everyone's different, after all.

Original: Ace:...I might become everyone's enemy soon.
Dialogue: ...I might become everyone's enemy soon.

Original: Ace:If that happens, even you, I...
Dialogue: If that happens, even you, I...

Original: Ciaran:I won't be done in so easily if it comes to that.
Dialogue: I won't be done in so easily if it comes to that.

Original: Ciaran:You're doing this because you have hope for the future. Right?
Dialogue: You're doing this because you have hope for the future. Right?

Original: Ace:...Right. I will fight for my future.
Dialogue: ...Right. I will fight for my future.

Original: Ciaran:Gotcha. But, if possible...I'd rather not fight such a good friend.
Dialogue: Gotcha. But, if possible...I'd rather not fight such a good friend.

Original: Freya:Hmm... No matter how far we go, it all looks the same.
Dialogue: Hmm... No matter how far we go, it all looks the same.

Original: Cinque:Uh-oh! Did we lose our way?
Dialogue: Uh-oh! Did we lose our way?

Original: Tidus:We're counting on you guys to get us out of here! Did you remember anything?
Dialogue: We're counting on you guys to get us out of here! Did you remember anything?

Original: Cater:Even if we had, it doesn't change the fact that this isn't Orience.
Dialogue: Even if we had, it doesn't change the fact that this isn't Orience.

Original: Mog:The presence of brilliance and Shinryu is all mixed-up in my head now, too, kupo...
Dialogue: The presence of brilliance and Shinryu is all mixed-up in my head now, too, kupo...

Original: Freya:Is it possible we've fallen into someone's trap?
Dialogue: Is it possible we've fallen into someone's trap?

Original: Mog:Very possible, kupo!
Dialogue: Very possible, kupo!

Original: Machina:If it's someone with a grudge against us, we might not be of much help...
Dialogue: If it's someone with a grudge against us, we might not be of much help...

Original: Cinque:Because if they go bye-bye, so do our memories of them!
Dialogue: Because if they go bye-bye, so do our memories of them!

Original: Tidus:That again... So you really can't remember anything? Not even traces of their existence?
Dialogue: That again... So you really can't remember anything? Not even traces of their existence?

Original: Cater:If it were an ally of ours, we might know their name from things they left behind.
Dialogue: If it were an ally of ours, we might know their name from things they left behind.

Original: Machina:But not from enemies. Ideas, beliefs, words... They all vanish.
Dialogue: But not from enemies. Ideas, beliefs, words... They all vanish.

Original: Cinque:But we can keep crushing our enemies to itty-bitty pieces because of that.
Dialogue: But we can keep crushing our enemies to itty-bitty pieces because of that.

Original: Freya:I see... And that is the rule of your ceaselessly warring world...
Dialogue: I see... And that is the rule of your ceaselessly warring world...

Original: Ace:Forgetting is the crystal's blessing.
Dialogue: Forgetting is the crystal's blessing.

Original: Tidus:You still think you're happier forgetting? Even after all this!?
Dialogue: You still think you're happier forgetting? Even after all this!?

Original: Tidus:You've seen people in this world without a future!
Dialogue: You've seen people in this world without a future!

Original: Cater:Don't lash out at us! It's just the way our world works!
Dialogue: Don't lash out at us! It's just the way our world works!

Original: Cinque:She's right. Getting mad at us won't change anything.
Dialogue: She's right. Getting mad at us won't change anything.

Original: Freya:We understand. But...it's not easy.
Dialogue: We understand. But...it's not easy.

Original: Freya:Even if that is the way your world works, some of us find it...sad.
Dialogue: Even if that is the way your world works, some of us find it...sad.

Original: Cater:Oh? Would you mind keeping that sadness to yourself?
Dialogue: Oh? Would you mind keeping that sadness to yourself?

Original: Machina:Come on, Cater. That's enough.
Dialogue: Come on, Cater. That's enough.

Original: Cater:Am I wrong? They're treating us like we're some cold-blooded animals!
Dialogue: Am I wrong? They're treating us like we're some cold-blooded animals!

Original: Cinque:We're just trying our very-berry best here!
Dialogue: We're just trying our very-berry best here!

Original: Ace:...Let me say this:
Dialogue: ...Let me say this

Original: Ace:The world we grew up in is different. We could never understand each other.
Dialogue: The world we grew up in is different. We could never understand each other.

Original: Machina:Stop it! I don't want to see this here, too...
Dialogue: Stop it! I don't want to see this here, too...

Original: Cinque:Aw, Machy, you're so sweet!
Dialogue: Aw, Machy, you're so sweet!

Original: Cater:Always the honor student! Ugh! Don't you ever get mad?
Dialogue: Always the honor student! Ugh! Don't you ever get mad?

Original: Machina:Say what you want about me... But I can't tolerate anyone disrespecting my friends.
Dialogue: Say what you want about me... But I can't tolerate anyone disrespecting my friends.

Original: Machina:The students of Class Zero aren't cold-blooded. You know that, right?
Dialogue: The students of Class Zero aren't cold-blooded. You know that, right?

Original: Tidus:...I just don't get you guys.
Dialogue: ...I just don't get you guys.

Original: Freya:Forgive me, I spoke out of turn. Nothing will come of us arguing.
Dialogue: Forgive me, I spoke out of turn. Nothing will come of us arguing.

Original: Mog:Kupo, kupo! I know where the brilliance is!
Dialogue: Kupo, kupo! I know where the brilliance is!

Original: Mog:So stop your fighting. We've got to go, kupo!
Dialogue: So stop your fighting. We've got to go, kupo!

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):You're back... You've come here a lot lately.
Dialogue: You're back... You've come here a lot lately.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Did you have a fight with someone?
Dialogue: Did you have a fight with someone?

Original: Ace:The people from the other worlds are just...suffocating.
Dialogue: The people from the other worlds are just...suffocating.

Original: Ace:But it's fine because I have this place.
Dialogue: But it's fine because I have this place.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):You won't be able to take breaks soon. They're heading to this Akademeia, aren't they?
Dialogue: You won't be able to take breaks soon. They're heading to this Akademeia, aren't they?

Original: Ace:Yeah. That moogle sniffed it out. He can tell when someone does this sort of thing.
Dialogue: Yeah. That moogle sniffed it out. He can tell when someone does this sort of thing.

Original: Ace:I'm sure they'll try to take me down as soon as they see the Akademeia.
Dialogue: I'm sure they'll try to take me down as soon as they see the Akademeia.

Original: Ace:Even though all I want to do is live a quiet life...
Dialogue: Even though all I want to do is live a quiet life...

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Will you fight them? Your classmates are with them.
Dialogue: Will you fight them? Your classmates are with them.

Original: Ace:They'll choose to live here, at this Akademeia.
Dialogue: They'll choose to live here, at this Akademeia.

Original: Ace:But the others...I'll fight.
Dialogue: But the others...I'll fight.

Original: Ace:Like how I've always done... I'm...used to it.
Dialogue: Like how I've always done... I'm...used to it.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Just one or two of us won't be enough.
Dialogue: Just one or two of us won't be enough.

Original: Ace:We won't know until we try.
Dialogue: We won't know until we try.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):Right! And even if we don't win, you can always get away on this one.
Dialogue: Right! And even if we don't win, you can always get away on this one.

Original: Ace:A chocobo...
Dialogue: A chocobo...

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):She's different from the ones who wandered here from other worlds. She was born from your will.
Dialogue: She's different from the ones who wandered here from other worlds. She was born from your will.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):She can take you wherever you want.
Dialogue: She can take you wherever you want.

Original: Ace:What was her name again...?
Dialogue: What was her name again...?

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):...He can't know. He's empty, after all.
Dialogue: ...He can't know. He's empty, after all.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):If Ace doesn't know, neither does that Machina.
Dialogue: If Ace doesn't know, neither does that Machina.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):It seems like I can move... Maybe I can leave Akademeia.
Dialogue: It seems like I can move... Maybe I can leave Akademeia.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):I must tell the me from the World of Light... This needs to stop.
Dialogue: I must tell the me from the World of Light... This needs to stop.

Original: Machina:The brilliance here must belong to Class Zero.
Dialogue: The brilliance here must belong to Class Zero.

Original: Vaan:What makes you say that?
Dialogue: What makes you say that?

Original: Kain:You know the future your friends don't...don't you?
Dialogue: You know the future your friends don't...don't you?

Original: Machina:I know I can't hide it forever. But I couldn't bring myself to say it...
Dialogue: I know I can't hide it forever. But I couldn't bring myself to say it...

Original: Cecil:It was something so painful and terrifying that you wanted to hide it, wasn't it?
Dialogue: It was something so painful and terrifying that you wanted to hide it, wasn't it?

Original: Machina:I survived... A helpless fool until the very end...
Dialogue: I survived... A helpless fool until the very end...

Original: Machina:There's no way they would forgive someone like that.
Dialogue: There's no way they would forgive someone like that.

Original: Vaan:Aren't they your friends? You seem pretty close to me.
Dialogue: Aren't they your friends? You seem pretty close to me.

Original: Machina:Only because they don't remember fighting with me.
Dialogue: Only because they don't remember fighting with me.

Original: Machina:No... It wasn't even a fight. I turned on them.
Dialogue: No... It wasn't even a fight. I turned on them.

Original: Vaan:What did you do?
Dialogue: What did you do?

Original: Machina:I was convinced that his death was the fault of Class Zero. Of Ace and the others.
Dialogue: I was convinced that his death was the fault of Class Zero. Of Ace and the others.

Original: Machina:So I held a grudge against them...
Dialogue: So I held a grudge against them...

Original: Kain:Seeking responsibility for a death on the battlefield can't go well.
Dialogue: Seeking responsibility for a death on the battlefield can't go well.

Original: Machina:Right... I was such an idiot. If only I had been more mature
Dialogue: Right... I was such an idiot. If only I had been more mature—

Original: Vaan:It's not that simple.
Dialogue: It's not that simple.

Original: Vaan:Your brother was important to you. You wanted a culprit.
Dialogue: Your brother was important to you. You wanted a culprit.

Original: Vaan:You couldn't rest without someone to blame.
Dialogue: You couldn't rest without someone to blame.

Original: Vaan:Because you recognize just how helpless you are...
Dialogue: Because you recognize just how helpless you are...

Original: Machina:...You're right, Vaan.
Dialogue: ...You're right, Vaan.

Original: Machina:When my brother died, I wasn't far away.
Dialogue: When my brother died, I wasn't far away.

Original: Cecil:You blamed yourself, thinking you might have been able to save him.
Dialogue: You blamed yourself, thinking you might have been able to save him.

Original: Machina:I couldn't forgive myself for being so powerless. I didn't want to lose anyone else...and I envied them.
Dialogue: I couldn't forgive myself for being so powerless. I didn't want to lose anyone else...and I envied them.

Original: Machina:...It's a feeling that the powerful cadets in Class Zero can't understand.
Dialogue: ...It's a feeling that the powerful cadets in Class Zero can't understand.

Original: Vaan:You can't know that. Have you ever tried talking to them?
Dialogue: You can't know that. Have you ever tried talking to them?

Original: Vaan:Not just about your brother.
Dialogue: Not just about your brother.

Original: Vaan:Wanting power, feeling pathetic... Have you talked to them about your feelings?
Dialogue: Wanting power, feeling pathetic... Have you talked to them about your feelings?

Original: Kain:Vaan is getting quite worked up, for Vaan.
Dialogue: Vaan is getting quite worked up, for Vaan.

Original: Vaan:You won't know until you tell them. It's too late if you wait until they can't respond back.
Dialogue: You won't know until you tell them. It's too late if you wait until they can't respond back.

Original: Vaan:They're alive in this world. Talk to them.
Dialogue: They're alive in this world. Talk to them.

Original: Vaan:What's there to laugh about!?
Dialogue: What's there to laugh about!?

Original: Machina:It's not you. I just never realized it until you said it.
Dialogue: It's not you. I just never realized it until you said it.

Original: Machina:They're still alive in this world. I can talk to them. I can face them.
Dialogue: They're still alive in this world. I can talk to them. I can face them.

Original: Machina:I don't know what awaits us in the future, but...I'm going to talk to them.
Dialogue: I don't know what awaits us in the future, but...I'm going to talk to them.

Original: Machina:I want us to understand each other this time. I want us to enjoy life...as friends.
Dialogue: I want us to understand each other this time. I want us to enjoy life...as friends.

Original: Cecil:A fine resolution. And this is a world where you can make that come true.
Dialogue: A fine resolution. And this is a world where you can make that come true.

Original: Jack:There you are, Machina! Have you seen Ace?
Dialogue: There you are, Machina! Have you seen Ace?

Original: Machina:Did something happen?
Dialogue: Did something happen?

Original: Deuce:We can't find him anywhere...
Dialogue: We can't find him anywhere...

Original: Jack:He even ignored Mog's call. Maybe he's slacking off somewhere, yo.
Dialogue: He even ignored Mog's call. Maybe he's slacking off somewhere, yo.

Original: Machina:Ace? I wonder...what happened.
Dialogue: Ace? I wonder...what happened.

Original: Dark Manikin (Cinque):What's up next again? Was it outdoor practice? Or another snorefest in the classroom?
Dialogue: What's up next again? Was it outdoor practice? Or another snorefest in the classroom?

Original: Dark Manikin (Eight):It's drills in the arena. We better hurry or we'll be late.
Dialogue: It's drills in the arena. We better hurry or we'll be late.

Original: Dark Manikin (Cater):Out of the way! First in line coming through!
Dialogue: Out of the way! First in line coming through!

Original: Dark Manikin (Cinque):Aww, no fair! You're always first!
Dialogue: Aww, no fair! You're always first!

Original: Dark Manikin (Eight):She can at least get good marks in drills, so she's going all out.
Dialogue: She can at least get good marks in drills, so she's going all out.

Original: Dark Manikin (Jack):Oh, yeah. I guess Nine'll be just as desperate then.
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. I guess Nine'll be just as desperate then.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):Assuming he isn't waiting in the wrong place. We'll have to go find him if he isn't there already.
Dialogue: Assuming he isn't waiting in the wrong place. We'll have to go find him if he isn't there already.

Original: Dark Manikin (Jack):I was planning to skip class, but if we're doing drills, I can give it a try.
Dialogue: I was planning to skip class, but if we're doing drills, I can give it a try.

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):Your grades suck, too. At least do better than "try."
Dialogue: Your grades suck, too. At least do better than "try."

Original: Dark Manikin (Deuce):It was easy, so everyone did well. I scored a 90.
Dialogue: It was easy, so everyone did well. I scored a 90.

Original: Dark Manikin (Cinque):Easy? I scored a make-up exam...
Dialogue: Easy? I scored a make-up exam...

Original: Dark Manikin (Cater):Hey! Practice is about to start!
Dialogue: Hey! Practice is about to start!

Original: Dark Manikin (Deuce):Right! Let's go!
Dialogue: Right! Let's go!

Original: Ace:If it just stays like this, everything will be alright.
Dialogue: If it just stays like this, everything will be alright.

Original: Ace:Everyone will understand.
Dialogue: Everyone will understand.

Original: Ace:If they remember, they won't want to go back. They can live their future here.
Dialogue: If they remember, they won't want to go back. They can live their future here.

Original: Ace:We can make whatever we lack. Streets, airships, other countries...
Dialogue: We can make whatever we lack. Streets, airships, other countries...

Original: Ace:And...Mother. Mother will definitely find us here.
Dialogue: And...Mother. Mother will definitely find us here.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):You're still here? The CO's looking for you, Ace.
Dialogue: You're still here? The CO's looking for you, Ace.

Original: Ace:...You're the only one completely a puppet. You only do exactly what I tell you to do.
Dialogue: ...You're the only one completely a puppet. You only do exactly what I tell you to do.

Original: Ace:What I mean is...the real Machina knows everything, but says nothing.
Dialogue: What I mean is...the real Machina knows everything, but says nothing.

Original: Ace:I can't know what happened after the end, but living in this world...
Dialogue: I can't know what happened after the end, but living in this world...

Original: Ace:I wonder if he still hates us. Maybe that's why he's hiding the truth.
Dialogue: I wonder if he still hates us. Maybe that's why he's hiding the truth.

Original: Dark Manikin (Machina):If you don't know the answer, neither can I.
Dialogue: If you don't know the answer, neither can I.

Original: Ace:I know...
Dialogue: I know...

Original: Ace:I know what the others are thinking. But I've never understood you.
Dialogue: I know what the others are thinking. But I've never understood you.

Original: Ace:Why do I want you to be here, too...?
Dialogue: Why do I want you to be here, too...?

Original: Machina:Where did Ace go?
Dialogue: Where did Ace go?

Original: Rem:If we don't find him soon, we should ask Materia...
Dialogue: If we don't find him soon, we should ask Materia...

Original: Mog:Kupo... I can't help but feel like he's refusing my calls, kupo.
Dialogue: Kupo... I can't help but feel like he's refusing my calls, kupo.

Original: Seven:You mean he left us of his own will?
Dialogue: You mean he left us of his own will?

Original: Penelo:I wonder if something bad happened to him. Or some villain kidnapped him...
Dialogue: I wonder if something bad happened to him. Or some villain kidnapped him...

Original: Ciaran:Villain... Hmmm...
Dialogue: Villain... Hmmm...

Original: Machina:Do you have any idea where he went, Ciaran?
Dialogue: Do you have any idea where he went, Ciaran?

Original: Ciaran:I don't know if it's right for me to say, so...let me think about it for a while.
Dialogue: I don't know if it's right for me to say, so...let me think about it for a while.

Original: Seven:It would be nice if we had that kind of time.
Dialogue: It would be nice if we had that kind of time.

Original: Mog:Kupo!? It seems like there's a dark manikin with brilliance over there, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo!? It seems like there's a dark manikin with brilliance over there, kupo!

Original: Machina:Brilliance? So...memories?
Dialogue: Brilliance? So...memories?

Original: Rem:Let's go. They might be able to tell us something about Ace!
Dialogue: Let's go. They might be able to tell us something about Ace!

Original: Seven:What's wrong, Machina? You seem hesitant.
Dialogue: What's wrong, Machina? You seem hesitant.

Original: Machina:It's nothing... No matter what happens, I'll face it.
Dialogue: It's nothing... No matter what happens, I'll face it.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):Thank goodness you found me!
Dialogue: Thank goodness you found me!

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):Yes. I've been looking for you. It looks like you managed to escape.
Dialogue: Yes. I've been looking for you. It looks like you managed to escape.

Original: Machina:Escape? So we were trapped? Was it the Emperor or a monster or...
Dialogue: Escape? So we were trapped? Was it the Emperor or a monster or...

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):No... The one gathering us dark manikins isn't an enemy of yours.
Dialogue: No... The one gathering us dark manikins isn't an enemy of yours.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):The one who made this Orience and the Akademeia up ahead...
Dialogue: The one who made this Orience and the Akademeia up ahead...

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):...Is Ace, from the World of Light.
Dialogue: ...Is Ace, from the World of Light.

Original: Penelo:Ace!? So he didn't answer the call just now because...
Dialogue: Ace!? So he didn't answer the call just now because...

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):He's closed his heart up in Akademeia...
Dialogue: He's closed his heart up in Akademeia...

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):He gathered us dark manikins to recreate his old life.
Dialogue: He gathered us dark manikins to recreate his old life.

Original: Rem:Why would he do that all of a sudden?
Dialogue: Why would he do that all of a sudden?

Original: Machina:Could it be...he got his memories back?
Dialogue: Could it be...he got his memories back?

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):We don't know when it happened, but someone gave him his brilliance.
Dialogue: We don't know when it happened, but someone gave him his brilliance.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):With all his memories until the end, Ace decided to create respite in this world.
Dialogue: With all his memories until the end, Ace decided to create respite in this world.

Original: Ciaran:So that's why he made all this. A place to feel at ease...even for just a moment.
Dialogue: So that's why he made all this. A place to feel at ease...even for just a moment.

Original: Seven:So my dark manikin is at Akademeia then?
Dialogue: So my dark manikin is at Akademeia then?

Original: Seven:Isn't anyone going to stop him?
Dialogue: Isn't anyone going to stop him?

Original: Rem:Right. If you have memories, then you should have a will.
Dialogue: Right. If you have memories, then you should have a will.

Original: Rem:It's not like us to be controlled like this.
Dialogue: It's not like us to be controlled like this.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):It's not like we're really being controlled. We haven't forgotten our mission to protect this world.
Dialogue: It's not like we're really being controlled. We haven't forgotten our mission to protect this world.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):But it is hard to resist the powerful wills of those from the World of Light.
Dialogue: But it is hard to resist the powerful wills of those from the World of Light.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):That's why we let him do as he pleased, waiting for you to show up.
Dialogue: That's why we let him do as he pleased, waiting for you to show up.

Original: Seven:So that's why you came here to tell us.
Dialogue: So that's why you came here to tell us.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):And to pass on memories of the truth to myself from the World of Light.
Dialogue: And to pass on memories of the truth to myself from the World of Light.

Original: Rem:The future that I can't remember...
Dialogue: The future that I can't remember...

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):Don't worry.
Dialogue: Don't worry.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):This brilliance... These memories will make you strong and kind.
Dialogue: This brilliance... These memories will make you strong and kind.

Original: Rem:...Okay. I'm ready.
Dialogue: ...Okay. I'm ready.

Original: Rem:I wonder...if we were together until the end.
Dialogue: I wonder...if we were together until the end.

Original: Dark Manikin (Rem):The future isn't as scary as you think. Isn't that right, Machina?
Dialogue: The future isn't as scary as you think. Isn't that right, Machina?

Original: Machina:...I was worried because Rem is so kind. I couldn't bring myself to say it.
Dialogue: ...I was worried because Rem is so kind. I couldn't bring myself to say it.

Original: Machina:But I won't waver anymore. I want you to get your memories back and be by my side.
Dialogue: But I won't waver anymore. I want you to get your memories back and be by my side.

Original: Rem:...Okay. Tell me...what really happened.
Dialogue: ...Okay. Tell me...what really happened.

Original: Rem:My memories...
Dialogue: My memories...

Original: Rem:Oh no... No...
Dialogue: Oh no... No...

Original: Rem:Everyone... Why...?
Dialogue: Everyone... Why...?

Original: Lyse:Are you okay?
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Original: Rem:Machina and I...survived.
Dialogue: Machina and I...survived.

Original: Rem:I thought I would die first because I was weak...
Dialogue: I thought I would die first because I was weak...

Original: Rem:But even though I lived...
Dialogue: But even though I lived...

Original: Rem:I can't be happy. This is so sad...
Dialogue: I can't be happy. This is so sad...

Original: Lyse:You survived? But you still...remembered your friends?
Dialogue: You survived? But you still...remembered your friends?

Original: Rem:You're right...
Dialogue: You're right...

Original: Machina:Our classmates only know the old order.
Dialogue: Our classmates only know the old order.

Original: Machina:After they risked their lives fighting, the people of Orience became unable to forget the dead.
Dialogue: After they risked their lives fighting, the people of Orience became unable to forget the dead.

Original: Machina:But only Rem and I remembered our classmates.
Dialogue: But only Rem and I remembered our classmates.

Original: Rem:So you knew all along, Machina, but didn't say anything.
Dialogue: So you knew all along, Machina, but didn't say anything.

Original: Machina:I didn't have the courage. I didn't know what to say.
Dialogue: I didn't have the courage. I didn't know what to say.

Original: Rem:But everyone's brilliance is up ahead.
Dialogue: But everyone's brilliance is up ahead.

Original: Lyse:Should we keep quiet? If you want to, I won't say a thing.
Dialogue: Should we keep quiet? If you want to, I won't say a thing.

Original: Machina:Ace got his memories back and is out of control.
Dialogue: Ace got his memories back and is out of control.

Original: Machina:The others might do the same.
Dialogue: The others might do the same.

Original: Rem:If we rewrite the world the way we want, our real home might fall to ruin.
Dialogue: If we rewrite the world the way we want, our real home might fall to ruin.

Original: Machina:I'll talk to them. I don't know what will happen, but I have to try.
Dialogue: I'll talk to them. I don't know what will happen, but I have to try.

Original: Lyse:Hey, Rem.
Dialogue: Hey, Rem.

Original: Lyse:You said you survived even though you were weak...
Dialogue: You said you survived even though you were weak...

Original: Lyse:I think...I might understand how you feel. So...
Dialogue: I think...I might understand how you feel. So...

Original: Rem:"You're not alone." I know. I'll be okay.
Dialogue: "You're not alone." I know. I'll be okay.

Original: Lyse:You don't need to say that you're okay right away...you know?
Dialogue: You don't need to say that you're okay right away...you know?

Original: Rem:Huh? Oh... I suppose it's a habit.
Dialogue: Huh? Oh... I suppose it's a habit.

Original: Lyse:You have a lot of good friends here, people who understand you. So please...don't hesitate to rely on us.
Dialogue: You have a lot of good friends here, people who understand you. So please...don't hesitate to rely on us.

Original: Cater:So what happened after that fight?
Dialogue: So what happened after that fight?

Original: Machina:Orience changed. But in that future, you all...
Dialogue: Orience changed. But in that future, you all...

Original: Cinque:Stop messing around, Machy! There's just no way that happened. We all remember each other.
Dialogue: Stop messing around, Machy! There's just no way that happened. We all remember each other.

Original: Cater:Talk about a bad joke. Are you sure it wasn't a dream?
Dialogue: Talk about a bad joke. Are you sure it wasn't a dream?

Original: Machina:Maybe it was a dream... I mean, I can see you all in this world...
Dialogue: Maybe it was a dream... I mean, I can see you all in this world...

Original: King:Ace got his memories back and is out of control. We had all better be prepared.
Dialogue: Ace got his memories back and is out of control. We had all better be prepared.

Original: Eight:Right. I don't think someone as serious as Machina would lie to us.
Dialogue: Right. I don't think someone as serious as Machina would lie to us.

Original: Machina:Once everyone has their memories back, I've got a lot to apologize for...
Dialogue: Once everyone has their memories back, I've got a lot to apologize for...

Original: Quistis:That's right. It might be something similar to your Akademeia.
Dialogue: That's right. It might be something similar to your Akademeia.

Original: Selphie:We even have uniforms like you guys!
Dialogue: We even have uniforms like you guys!

Original: Cinque:Did you have icky homework and tests, too?
Dialogue: Did you have icky homework and tests, too?

Original: Selphie:Of course! We all studied together before our exams.
Dialogue: Of course! We all studied together before our exams.

Original: Cinque:Rather than sitting and taking some stuffy test...
Dialogue: Rather than sitting and taking some stuffy test...

Original: Cinque:Wouldn't it be better if we could just beat some baddies for our grades?
Dialogue: Wouldn't it be better if we could just beat some baddies for our grades?

Original: Selphie:Ohh, I know what you mean! Tests and homework are so tough.
Dialogue: Ohh, I know what you mean! Tests and homework are so tough.

Original: Quistis:They study important things, like history and nature, too.
Dialogue: They study important things, like history and nature, too.

Original: Deuce:Fables of founders, how flowers bloom and bud...
Dialogue: Fables of founders, how flowers bloom and bud...

Original: Deuce:Hmm... I get a feeling I said something like this before...
Dialogue: Hmm... I get a feeling I said something like this before...

Original: Selphie:You guys never studied history or nature before?
Dialogue: You guys never studied history or nature before?

Original: Deuce:Not really. We learned about magic and endurance in class. And geopolitics and the other nations' strengths, too.
Dialogue: Not really. We learned about magic and endurance in class. And geopolitics and the other nations' strengths, too.

Original: Quistis:I guess it's to be expected of a warring nation... When you become part of the army, you need to devote time to your drills.
Dialogue: I guess it's to be expected of a warring nation... When you become part of the army, you need to devote time to your drills.

Original: Deuce:We're actually separate from the army, but it was an emergency...
Dialogue: We're actually separate from the army, but it was an emergency...

Original: Seifer:Hey! You have some nerve wearing sloppy uniforms like that around here!
Dialogue: Hey! You have some nerve wearing sloppy uniforms like that around here!

Original: Seifer:Fasten your jacket properly! And why is it so short? Nobody would believe you're elite looking like that.
Dialogue: Fasten your jacket properly! And why is it so short? Nobody would believe you're elite looking like that.

Original: King:All cadets at Akademeia were allowed to remodel their uniforms how they liked.
Dialogue: All cadets at Akademeia were allowed to remodel their uniforms how they liked.

Original: King:...Believe it or not, mine has fewer modifications than most.
Dialogue: ...Believe it or not, mine has fewer modifications than most.

Original: Raijin:I guess we don't have much power here, being out of uniform ourselves, y'know.
Dialogue: I guess we don't have much power here, being out of uniform ourselves, y'know.

Original: Seifer:Shut up! You over there! You skipped out on airship cleaning to take a nap, didn't you?
Dialogue: Shut up! You over there! You skipped out on airship cleaning to take a nap, didn't you?

Original: Seifer:I saw that four-eyed chef cleaning the kitchen by himself!
Dialogue: I saw that four-eyed chef cleaning the kitchen by himself!

Original: Jack:Me? Nahhh, I asked Prompto to take over my shift!
Dialogue: Me? Nahhh, I asked Prompto to take over my shift!

Original: Jack:I'm sure Ignis wanted to clean the kitchen himself because it's his sanctuary!
Dialogue: I'm sure Ignis wanted to clean the kitchen himself because it's his sanctuary!

Original: Raijin:Come on, Seifer. Can't we all just get along, y'know?
Dialogue: Come on, Seifer. Can't we all just get along, y'know?

Original: Seifer:Hmph! You had better clean up those sloppy uniforms next time I see you!
Dialogue: Hmph! You had better clean up those sloppy uniforms next time I see you!

Original: King:You're the Discipline Committee, right? I don't mind you cracking down on people, but...keep it to your own world.
Dialogue: You're the Discipline Committee, right? I don't mind you cracking down on people, but...keep it to your own world.

Original: Raijin:I think Seifer just wanted to talk to you because you seem like a nice guy and you're the same age, y'know?
Dialogue: I think Seifer just wanted to talk to you because you seem like a nice guy and you're the same age, y'know?

Original: King:What? I never would have guessed that...
Dialogue: What? I never would have guessed that...

Original: Jack:Aww, he likes us! Life must be hard for a committee leader who can't show his true feelings, yo.
Dialogue: Aww, he likes us! Life must be hard for a committee leader who can't show his true feelings, yo.

Original: Deuce:Hehe... Isn't it nice being around people who don't treat us like we're special?
Dialogue: Hehe... Isn't it nice being around people who don't treat us like we're special?

Original: Deuce:Yes. Our red capes make us Class Zero. We were different from the other cadets.
Dialogue: Yes. Our red capes make us Class Zero. We were different from the other cadets.

Original: Quistis:SeeDs are mercenaries whereas you folks are elites added to the army, but...
Dialogue: SeeDs are mercenaries whereas you folks are elites added to the army, but...

Original: Quistis:I suppose separating students into ranks is fairly commonplace.
Dialogue: I suppose separating students into ranks is fairly commonplace.

Original: Deuce:Even for you folks?
Dialogue: Even for you folks?

Original: Selphie:We did all kinds of missions as SeeD mercenaries!
Dialogue: We did all kinds of missions as SeeD mercenaries!

Original: Quistis:Our worlds may be different, but we have things in common. It would be nice to have a cultural exchange.
Dialogue: Our worlds may be different, but we have things in common. It would be nice to have a cultural exchange.

Original: Deuce:I want to know all about what you studied, too.
Dialogue: I want to know all about what you studied, too.

Original: Deuce:I feel like I'm going to learn some very valuable things!
Dialogue: I feel like I'm going to learn some very valuable things!

Original: Cloud of Darkness:Planesgorgers...gnaw at the warped world.
Dialogue: Planesgorgers...gnaw at the warped world.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:But the dragon who stands powerless before the world's rules is naught but a gatekeeper.
Dialogue: But the dragon who stands powerless before the world's rules is naught but a gatekeeper.

Original: Cater:Whoa! It's Akademeia!
Dialogue: Whoa! It's Akademeia!

Original: Deuce:The dark manikin was right... But who are you?
Dialogue: The dark manikin was right... But who are you?

Original: Cloud of Darkness:Are you the souls raised by the Mother?
Dialogue: Are you the souls raised by the Mother?

Original: Ignis:Who are you?
Dialogue: Who are you?

Original: Onion Knight:The Cloud of Darkness. It appears when the balance of light and dark is upset.
Dialogue: The Cloud of Darkness. It appears when the balance of light and dark is upset.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:The world has fallen into chaos. But it is not yet time to return to nothingness.
Dialogue: The world has fallen into chaos. But it is not yet time to return to nothingness.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:So we wait for a strong will to create the flood of darkness...
Dialogue: So we wait for a strong will to create the flood of darkness...

Original: Cater:Hold it! You said something about Mother earlier, didn't you?
Dialogue: Hold it! You said something about Mother earlier, didn't you?

Original: Deuce:Do you know something about Mother?
Dialogue: Do you know something about Mother?

Original: Cloud of Darkness:You say the same as that boy.
Dialogue: You say the same as that boy.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:See him with your own eyes. It is not our time now.
Dialogue: See him with your own eyes. It is not our time now.

Original: Onion Knight:It got away... No, it's just not time to fight it yet.
Dialogue: It got away... No, it's just not time to fight it yet.

Original: Onion Knight:It said a powerful will is going to cause a flood of darkness.
Dialogue: It said a powerful will is going to cause a flood of darkness.

Original: Terra:General Leo said the crystal core of darkness is out of control and giving power to warriors.
Dialogue: General Leo said the crystal core of darkness is out of control and giving power to warriors.

Original: Deuce:So then maybe it gave someone the power to create Akademeia.
Dialogue: So then maybe it gave someone the power to create Akademeia.

Original: Cater:Huh? So this isn't the power of will?
Dialogue: Huh? So this isn't the power of will?

Original: Onion Knight:Probably. But...I think the crystal core of darkness is overreacting to a strong will.
Dialogue: Probably. But...I think the crystal core of darkness is overreacting to a strong will.

Original: Onion Knight:I think it will grant anything to those with a strong will.
Dialogue: I think it will grant anything to those with a strong will.

Original: Ignis:Anything, from making a phone call...
Dialogue: Anything, from making a phone call...

Original: Terra:To creating a place to call home.
Dialogue: To creating a place to call home.

Original: Onion Knight:But if it continues to grant these wishes, this world will gradually fall into chaos.
Dialogue: But if it continues to grant these wishes, this world will gradually fall into chaos.

Original: Ignis:Because it cannot grant every single wish.
Dialogue: Because it cannot grant every single wish.

Original: Onion Knight:If that happens and darkness floods this place, the Cloud of Darkness will return the world to nothingness.
Dialogue: If that happens and darkness floods this place, the Cloud of Darkness will return the world to nothingness.

Original: Cater:So then what do we do?
Dialogue: So then what do we do?

Original: Ignis:Search the area, find Ace, and speak with him
Dialogue: Search the area, find Ace, and speak with him—

Original: Deuce:A planesgorger!? Here!?
Dialogue: A planesgorger!? Here!?

Original: Terra:I thought they were always at the end of those labyrinths...
Dialogue: I thought they were always at the end of those labyrinths...

Original: Onion Knight:Don't let your guard down!
Dialogue: Don't let your guard down!

Original: Warrior of Light:To meet in such a shallow place...
Dialogue: To meet in such a shallow place...

Original: Mog:Something's not right, kupo!
Dialogue: Something's not right, kupo!

Original: Bartz:It feels like he won't let us in.
Dialogue: It feels like he won't let us in.

Original: Ace:That's far enough!
Dialogue: That's far enough!

Original: Onion Knight:Do you really intend to fight your friends?
Dialogue: Do you really intend to fight your friends?

Original: Ace:You came to destroy this place, didn't you? That makes us enemies.
Dialogue: You came to destroy this place, didn't you? That makes us enemies.

Original: Onion Knight:Do you want to create more chaos between the worlds?
Dialogue: Do you want to create more chaos between the worlds?

Original: Ace:This is the place I belong.
Dialogue: This is the place I belong.

Original: Ace:I won't let any of you take it away!
Dialogue: I won't let any of you take it away!

Original: Ace:Gck... At least the planesgorger is gone.
Dialogue: Gck... At least the planesgorger is gone.

Original: Ace:Akademeia is still in good shape. It won't be threatened by anyone.
Dialogue: Akademeia is still in good shape. It won't be threatened by anyone.

Original: Eight:Ace! Did you really do this!?
Dialogue: Ace! Did you really do this!?

Original: Ace:I did.
Dialogue: I did.

Original: Deuce:Why? That makes you the same as the bad guys!
Dialogue: Why? That makes you the same as the bad guys!

Original: Ace:I can't help it if that's how you feel. But I had no other choice.
Dialogue: I can't help it if that's how you feel. But I had no other choice.

Original: Warrior of Light:Please, explain it to us. At this rate, the world will sink into chaos.
Dialogue: Please, explain it to us. At this rate, the world will sink into chaos.

Original: Ace:How could you possibly understand?
Dialogue: How could you possibly understand?

Original: Ace:Don't ask anymore. Just leave me and the rest of Class Zero here.
Dialogue: Don't ask anymore. Just leave me and the rest of Class Zero here.

Original: Cater:So that we're the only ones abandoning our mission!?
Dialogue: So that we're the only ones abandoning our mission!?

Original: Ace:Our mission... Right. This is also a mission.
Dialogue: Our mission... Right. This is also a mission.

Original: Ace:Saving this world and returning home...
Dialogue: Saving this world and returning home...

Original: Ace:That was the purpose of this journey, wasn't it?
Dialogue: That was the purpose of this journey, wasn't it?

Original: Ace:We're different from the others. We need a place to go home to.
Dialogue: We're different from the others. We need a place to go home to.

Original: Eight:So then what Machina said was...
Dialogue: So then what Machina said was...

Original: Ace:I don't want you to remember.
Dialogue: I don't want you to remember.

Original: Ace:There's no place for you to return to except here. That's all you need to know.
Dialogue: There's no place for you to return to except here. That's all you need to know.

Original: Deuce:I refuse to accept that!
Dialogue: I refuse to accept that!

Original: Eight:No matter what happened after that fight, I was ready for it.
Dialogue: No matter what happened after that fight, I was ready for it.

Original: Ace:You say that because you don't know.
Dialogue: You say that because you don't know.

Original: Ace:And I don't want you to know.
Dialogue: And I don't want you to know.

Original: Cater:But what about Mother? Mother's protecting us, isn't she?
Dialogue: But what about Mother? Mother's protecting us, isn't she?

Original: Ace:Mother only let us choose at the very end. We weren't revived, but...
Dialogue: Mother only let us choose at the very end. We weren't revived, but...

Original: Ace:If we wait here, Mother might come eventually.
Dialogue: If we wait here, Mother might come eventually.

Original: Warrior of Light:I understand what you're saying. But I cannot decide what you should do.
Dialogue: I understand what you're saying. But I cannot decide what you should do.

Original: Warrior of Light:Because your opinions are split among you.
Dialogue: Because your opinions are split among you.

Original: Ace:That's why I want you to leave us alone.
Dialogue: That's why I want you to leave us alone.

Original: Warrior of Light:We cannot overlook things if they continue like this. The power of wills is the light that guides this world.
Dialogue: We cannot overlook things if they continue like this. The power of wills is the light that guides this world.

Original: Warrior of Light:Your will created this place. That is one choice.
Dialogue: Your will created this place. That is one choice.

Original: Warrior of Light:But whether they choose this place or not is up to each of their wills.
Dialogue: But whether they choose this place or not is up to each of their wills.

Original: Eight:Our choice...
Dialogue: Our choice...

Original: Ace:Think about it carefully.
Dialogue: Think about it carefully.

Original: Cater:Hey! Where are you going!?
Dialogue: Hey! Where are you going!?

Original: Penelo:I'm sorry! But Mog...
Dialogue: I'm sorry! But Mog...

Original: Cinque:What's the matter, Moglin? Come over here by Cinquey!
Dialogue: What's the matter, Moglin? Come over here by Cinquey!

Original: Mog:I can't, kupo! I keep trying, but it's not working, kupo!
Dialogue: I can't, kupo! I keep trying, but it's not working, kupo!

Original: Fran:A magical barrier, perhaps...to keep Mog out.
Dialogue: A magical barrier, perhaps...to keep Mog out.

Original: Machina:That's impossible... Ah!
Dialogue: That's impossible... Ah!

Original: Cinque:So you can't get out, Machy?
Dialogue: So you can't get out, Machy?

Original: Jack:Is he trying to trap all of Class Zero in here?
Dialogue: Is he trying to trap all of Class Zero in here?

Original: Machina:...Including me?
Dialogue: ...Including me?

Original: Fran:It looks like you will have to wait, Mog.
Dialogue: It looks like you will have to wait, Mog.

Original: Mog:Kupo! Be careful, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! Be careful, kupo!

Original: Dark Manikin (Eight):What's Ace doing?
Dialogue: What's Ace doing?

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):He's with Machina at the chocobo ranch now.
Dialogue: He's with Machina at the chocobo ranch now.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):He thinks we're studying.
Dialogue: He thinks we're studying.

Original: Dark Manikin (Eight):Then let's go find our originals. They should be close.
Dialogue: Then let's go find our originals. They should be close.

Original: Dark Manikin (Jack):Wait up! I'm going, too!
Dialogue: Wait up! I'm going, too!

Original: Dark Manikin (Jack):Ace thinks I'm always slacking off.
Dialogue: Ace thinks I'm always slacking off.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):You know where we're going, don't you?
Dialogue: You know where we're going, don't you?

Original: Dark Manikin (Jack):Of course! I'll be fine.
Dialogue: Of course! I'll be fine.

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):Alright. Then let's move.
Dialogue: Alright. Then let's move.

Original: Eight:Who's there!?
Dialogue: Who's there!?

Original: Seven:Wait. It's us...from the World of Darkness.
Dialogue: Wait. It's us...from the World of Darkness.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):I'm glad we found you.
Dialogue: I'm glad we found you.

Original: Jack:Are you guys okay? You look beat, yo.
Dialogue: Are you guys okay? You look beat, yo.

Original: King:You're wounded. What happened?
Dialogue: You're wounded. What happened?

Original: Dark Manikin (Eight):This place was made by Ace's will. It's hard for us to move on our own.
Dialogue: This place was made by Ace's will. It's hard for us to move on our own.

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):He doesn't want us to give up our brilliance.
Dialogue: He doesn't want us to give up our brilliance.

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):That's why he shut out that moogle who can sense it.
Dialogue: That's why he shut out that moogle who can sense it.

Original: Eight:He did it so we wouldn't meet up...
Dialogue: He did it so we wouldn't meet up...

Original: King:So you slipped through to give us the brilliance back.
Dialogue: So you slipped through to give us the brilliance back.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):It's hard for us to determine right from wrong.
Dialogue: It's hard for us to determine right from wrong.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):Even with memories, our decisions are ruled by those with strong wills.
Dialogue: Even with memories, our decisions are ruled by those with strong wills.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):We dark manikins were created to protect this land of respite.
Dialogue: We dark manikins were created to protect this land of respite.

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):We thought it would be fine to let him do what he wanted, so we tried to be useful...
Dialogue: We thought it would be fine to let him do what he wanted, so we tried to be useful...

Original: Dark Manikin (Jack):But Ace didn't make Akademeia on his own.
Dialogue: But Ace didn't make Akademeia on his own.

Original: Jack:Was it the Cloud of Darkness? We met her at the entrance... She sure was spooky.
Dialogue: Was it the Cloud of Darkness? We met her at the entrance... She sure was spooky.

Original: Dark Manikin (Eight):No matter how strong your will is, you can't recreate a place to this extent with a crystal on your own.
Dialogue: No matter how strong your will is, you can't recreate a place to this extent with a crystal on your own.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):The crystal core of darkness is giving away too much energy...
Dialogue: The crystal core of darkness is giving away too much energy...

Original: Seven:So at some point, there will be a flood of darkness...
Dialogue: So at some point, there will be a flood of darkness...

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):We will fulfill our role and give you back your brilliance and restore your powers.
Dialogue: We will fulfill our role and give you back your brilliance and restore your powers.

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):But remember: it's up to you what happens from here on out.
Dialogue: But remember it's up to you what happens from here on out.

Original: Eight:Our future... I prepared myself for more than fighting on the battlefield, but...
Dialogue: Our future... I prepared myself for more than fighting on the battlefield, but...

Original: Dark Manikin (Eight):Once you know everything, it's okay to choose the same path Ace did.
Dialogue: Once you know everything, it's okay to choose the same path Ace did.

Original: Dark Manikin (Eight):We're fine with it...even if you end up fighting with your friends from other worlds.
Dialogue: We're fine with it...even if you end up fighting with your friends from other worlds.

Original: King:...We accept.
Dialogue: ...We accept.

Original: Seven:If we know what lies in store, we might be able to go forth with a level head.
Dialogue: If we know what lies in store, we might be able to go forth with a level head.

Original: Seven:Machina and Rem have their memories, but those two are too nice...
Dialogue: Machina and Rem have their memories, but those two are too nice...

Original: Jack:I'm a little scared, but Ace already has his memories.
Dialogue: I'm a little scared, but Ace already has his memories.

Original: Eight:It's not fair if only Ace carries that burden, and Machina and Rem are the only ones suffering.
Dialogue: It's not fair if only Ace carries that burden, and Machina and Rem are the only ones suffering.

Original: Eight:The fourteen of us are Class Zero, right?
Dialogue: The fourteen of us are Class Zero, right?

Original: Dark Manikin (Eight):...I'm glad. I wanted to hear that from you myself.
Dialogue: ...I'm glad. I wanted to hear that from you myself.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):Memories of worries and partings...
Dialogue: Memories of worries and partings...

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):We'll give them all to you.
Dialogue: We'll give them all to you.

Original: Dark Manikin (Seven):...I'm sorry we can't be of more help.
Dialogue: ...I'm sorry we can't be of more help.

Original: King:We have to be strong to set a good example for the others.
Dialogue: We have to be strong to set a good example for the others.

Original: Eight:Let's make a promise not to be hasty.
Dialogue: Let's make a promise not to be hasty.

Original: Jack:You made up your mind, didn't you? Then let's do this, yo.
Dialogue: You made up your mind, didn't you? Then let's do this, yo.

Original: Seven:Don't worry. You can leave everything to us.
Dialogue: Don't worry. You can leave everything to us.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):Thank you.
Dialogue: Thank you.

Original: Dark Manikin (King):This is all we can do... The rest is up to you.
Dialogue: This is all we can do... The rest is up to you.

Original: King:I was prepared for this.
Dialogue: I was prepared for this.

Original: Seven:But it was...unexpected...
Dialogue: But it was...unexpected...

Original: Faris:Are you being serious? How can you be so calm?
Dialogue: Are you being serious? How can you be so calm?

Original: Jack:Class Zero, taken doooooown right here! I don't think it was too bad.
Dialogue: Class Zero, taken doooooown right here! I don't think it was too bad.

Original: Eight:It wasn't an empty death. There was...meaning to our fight.
Dialogue: It wasn't an empty death. There was...meaning to our fight.

Original: Sazh:Are you holding back for the rest of us?
Dialogue: Are you holding back for the rest of us?

Original: Faris:You think if you waver, the rest of us'll get lily-livered?
Dialogue: You think if you waver, the rest of us'll get lily-livered?

Original: Basch:Is there anything we can do?
Dialogue: Is there anything we can do?

Original: Basch:Our worlds, positions, and ages are different...
Dialogue: Our worlds, positions, and ages are different...

Original: Basch:But we are here for you if you need us.
Dialogue: But we are here for you if you need us.

Original: Jack:Haha... You're a good guy.
Dialogue: Haha... You're a good guy.

Original: Jack:But my tears dried up back home.
Dialogue: But my tears dried up back home.

Original: Seven:...We're happy to hear it, though.
Dialogue: ...We're happy to hear it, though.

Original: Eight:All we ever did was obey someone else's orders, so we're bad at relying on others.
Dialogue: All we ever did was obey someone else's orders, so we're bad at relying on others.

Original: Faris:Well, if there's ever anything, just say the word.
Dialogue: Well, if there's ever anything, just say the word.

Original: Sazh:Seeing kids like you risk your lives without a tear...
Dialogue: Seeing kids like you risk your lives without a tear...

Original: Sazh:What kind of adult would I be to just let that go?
Dialogue: What kind of adult would I be to just let that go?

Original: Faris:There's no such thing as a life I'm fine with sacrificing, even for the sake of the world.
Dialogue: There's no such thing as a life I'm fine with sacrificing, even for the sake of the world.

Original: Eight:Our last fight was when the world was on the brink of destruction.
Dialogue: Our last fight was when the world was on the brink of destruction.

Original: Jack:We all thought about it. How we would escape. But in the end...
Dialogue: We all thought about it. How we would escape. But in the end...

Original: King:Rather than waiting for death, we accepted it and chose to fight.
Dialogue: Rather than waiting for death, we accepted it and chose to fight.

Original: Seven:It's like the dark manikins said. It's our choice, from here on out.
Dialogue: It's like the dark manikins said. It's our choice, from here on out.

Original: Sazh:It's okay for you to stay here, like Ace said.
Dialogue: It's okay for you to stay here, like Ace said.

Original: Eight:Wh-what!? But our journey...
Dialogue: Wh-what!? But our journey...

Original: Sazh:I'm trying to tell you that we adults can handle it.
Dialogue: I'm trying to tell you that we adults can handle it.

Original: Sazh:You're still kids. Be selfish once in a while.
Dialogue: You're still kids. Be selfish once in a while.

Original: Sazh:Ask for help. Rely on the grown-ups.
Dialogue: Ask for help. Rely on the grown-ups.

Original: Basch:Expecting to die... Expecting to kill...
Dialogue: Expecting to die... Expecting to kill...

Original: Basch:Expectations change a lot during war. I don't want your lives to end with those expectations unshaken.
Dialogue: Expectations change a lot during war. I don't want your lives to end with those expectations unshaken.

Original: Sazh:At the very least, we adults will never think of your deaths as unavoidable.
Dialogue: At the very least, we adults will never think of your deaths as unavoidable.

Original: King:Sazh... But we...
Dialogue: Sazh... But we...

Original: Sazh:Enough. A gun may be your weapon for war...
Dialogue: Enough. A gun may be your weapon for war...

Original: Sazh:But you yourself aren't.
Dialogue: But you yourself aren't.

Original: Sazh:You said so yourself, didn't you? It's your will that pulls the trigger.
Dialogue: You said so yourself, didn't you? It's your will that pulls the trigger.

Original: Sazh:So what does your will want to do? How does it want to live?
Dialogue: So what does your will want to do? How does it want to live?

Original: Basch:You may have been bound by duty, but you're free of that here.
Dialogue: You may have been bound by duty, but you're free of that here.

Original: Eight:Vayne, from your world, refuses to accept a world where the gods control its fate.
Dialogue: Vayne, from your world, refuses to accept a world where the gods control its fate.

Original: King:Thelast personwe fought was agodlike that.
Dialogue: The last person we fought was a god like that.

Original: Seven:We were led around by the crystal and legends, but...
Dialogue: We were led around by the crystal and legends, but...

Original: Seven:I don't begrudge being born in Orience.
Dialogue: I don't begrudge being born in Orience.

Original: Eight:If I weren't born in Orience, I wouldn't have met my friends.
Dialogue: If I weren't born in Orience, I wouldn't have met my friends.

Original: King:My only regret...is not having much time being sad.
Dialogue: My only regret...is not having much time being sad.

Original: Seven:We had our hands full comforting our crying comrades.
Dialogue: We had our hands full comforting our crying comrades.

Original: Eight:Attachment, regret, fear, remorse... Even if I felt them, I couldn't express them.
Dialogue: Attachment, regret, fear, remorse... Even if I felt them, I couldn't express them.

Original: Jack:So do we do it now? Now's the chance to whine all we want!
Dialogue: So do we do it now? Now's the chance to whine all we want!

Original: Eight:You're right, Jack. We have time in this world.
Dialogue: You're right, Jack. We have time in this world.

Original: Seven:We're alive. Even if we don't have a place to return to, we're here.
Dialogue: We're alive. Even if we don't have a place to return to, we're here.

Original: King:Even so...I don't think I want to stop here.
Dialogue: Even so...I don't think I want to stop here.

Original: Sazh:Is that what your will says?
Dialogue: Is that what your will says?

Original: Sazh:Then we'll keep going together.
Dialogue: Then we'll keep going together.

Original: Faris:Are you sure? This place is like your home.
Dialogue: Are you sure? This place is like your home.

Original: Jack:Psssh. It's not the same. There's no one here but monsters. I wouldn't want to call this home!
Dialogue: Psssh. It's not the same. There's no one here but monsters. I wouldn't want to call this home!

Original: Eight:Ace is being manipulated. I can't overlook that.
Dialogue: Ace is being manipulated. I can't overlook that.

Original: Seven:Right. We can choose where we want to return to after that.
Dialogue: Right. We can choose where we want to return to after that.

Original: Seven:That's my choice.
Dialogue: That's my choice.

Original: Basch:In that case, we support your choice wholeheartedly.
Dialogue: In that case, we support your choice wholeheartedly.

Original: Faris:And if you ever wanna talk, we're all here for you.
Dialogue: And if you ever wanna talk, we're all here for you.

Original: Cinque:I wonder if we'll be okay.
Dialogue: I wonder if we'll be okay.

Original: Cinque:Can we really accept it that calmly...?
Dialogue: Can we really accept it that calmly...?

Original: Dark Manikin (Deuce):We found you! What a relief.
Dialogue: We found you! What a relief.

Original: Deuce:Our dark manikins!
Dialogue: Our dark manikins!

Original: Cater:We heard you encountered some interference from Ace and the Cloud of Darkness.
Dialogue: We heard you encountered some interference from Ace and the Cloud of Darkness.

Original: Dark Manikin (Cater):Yeah... It wasn't easy breaking through the barrier, but I'm glad we made it.
Dialogue: Yeah... It wasn't easy breaking through the barrier, but I'm glad we made it.

Original: Cinque:You came to return our memories, right?
Dialogue: You came to return our memories, right?

Original: Dark Manikin (Cinque):That's right. But...we're being influenced by a powerful will.
Dialogue: That's right. But...we're being influenced by a powerful will.

Original: Dark Manikin (Cater):Ace doesn't want us to return your memories.
Dialogue: Ace doesn't want us to return your memories.

Original: Dark Manikin (Cater):So we started thinking that we don't want to give them back...
Dialogue: So we started thinking that we don't want to give them back...

Original: Dark Manikin (Deuce):Only humans can choose their own fate.
Dialogue: Only humans can choose their own fate.

Original: Dark Manikin (Deuce):Dark manikins can't.
Dialogue: Dark manikins can't.

Original: Deuce:So...you want us to choose.
Dialogue: So...you want us to choose.

Original: Cinque:Are they sad memories? Painful memories?
Dialogue: Are they sad memories? Painful memories?

Original: Dark Manikin (Cinque):If you leave them, things will only be sadder and more painful.
Dialogue: If you leave them, things will only be sadder and more painful.

Original: Dark Manikin (Deuce):Our ability to decide as dark manikins is being controlled by Ace's will and the Cloud of Darkness pulling his strings.
Dialogue: Our ability to decide as dark manikins is being controlled by Ace's will and the Cloud of Darkness pulling his strings.

Original: Dark Manikin (Cater):At this rate, everyone's memories will disappear into darkness.
Dialogue: At this rate, everyone's memories will disappear into darkness.

Original: Cater:But aren't they so painful you want them to disappear?
Dialogue: But aren't they so painful you want them to disappear?

Original: Dark Manikin (Cinque):Do you want them to disappear? To forget everything and live a fun life?
Dialogue: Do you want them to disappear? To forget everything and live a fun life?

Original: Cinque:Hmm... I feel like that's not a good idea.
Dialogue: Hmm... I feel like that's not a good idea.

Original: Cinque:I mean, Seven and the others got their memories back. I don't want to be the odd one out.
Dialogue: I mean, Seven and the others got their memories back. I don't want to be the odd one out.

Original: Cater:And if we let Ace do what he wants, this world is in trouble, isn't it?
Dialogue: And if we let Ace do what he wants, this world is in trouble, isn't it?

Original: Cater:I would be lying if I said I wasn't scared, though.
Dialogue: I would be lying if I said I wasn't scared, though.

Original: Cater:But it's not fair to talk to Ace, Rem, and Machina with my memories as hazy as they are.
Dialogue: But it's not fair to talk to Ace, Rem, and Machina with my memories as hazy as they are.

Original: Dark Manikin (Deuce):So you'll take them?
